text: My wife and I absolutely love this place. We lived in Japan for many years and it's very rare to find a restaurant with authentic Japanese taste in the US. Hire Sushi definitely has it though.  Tip: try sitting at the sushi bar (walk in only) and listen to the chefs banter in Japanese. Even if you don't understand it it will be fun.

I think this is the best sushi in the valley, I can't think of any other place that is as close to the traditional Japanese experience, without flying to tokyo, except I haven't been to shinbay yet in scottsdale.  Wife and I go here a few times a month and almost never lets us down.  Great eel, spanish mackrel, tempura, and toro.  Great service too, sometime almost too good!

I'm genuinely surprised by all the good reviews. I got the Sushi Dinner and was not impressed. The fish was old and tough. It should have been smooth and creamy - almost buttery - when you get the good fresh stuff. I've actually had better supermarket sushi, and Sakura Sushi in Kingman, AZ is better by far, which is pretty sad. I should have known that a restaurant named after a famous Sushi guru would be nothing but a poser. I should have just gotten sushi from Whole Foods, that would have been fresher and tasted better.

I'm from S. Cali where the Sushi options are plentiful. Moving to AZ I've been in desperate need of finding a local sushi spot that would be at least semi-comparable to the quality we get back in LA and at reasonable price-points. Taking in to consideration that the fish might be fresher and not previously frozen because LA has its harbors, I went to Hiro's with lower expectations so I wouldn't be disappointed. Overall, the ambiance and the sushi quality is pretty good for being in AZ. However, the prices are a bit high as to be expected being that it is located in Scottsdale and that the rent and getting quality fish so far inland from the coast would raise cost. The portions could be larger to justify the higher prices. Moreover, I don't understand WHY the bento boxes (i.e. Teriyaki Chicken & Mixed Tempura) is priced so high! For that reason, I probably won't be returning here, especially if I want non-fish options. That kind of stuff shouldn't be priced so high because it's produced locally. I would understand if it were Kobe beef or something.. but chicken? And to add insult to injury, the chicken that I received that night was a bit on the dry side. Not sure if it was an isolated incident but for the high price I expect quality or even naturally raised organic style chicken...now we're talking! Anyway, now I feel cheated in that respect. Sorry Hiro, on to the next spot!

This is by far the best sushi restaurant in Phoenix and I've tried many.  This is not the typical modern fusion type places that seem popular these days. You will have the legit Japanese style sushi restaurant experience.  The quality and freshness of the fish is top notch.  Be sure to check out the specials on the board for some out of this world flavors.  I got both maki rolls and sashimi and loved them all.  The spanish mackerel was wonderful.  The fish was neatly presented and they even deep fried the leftover bones and head which was 100% edible and super tasty in the vinegar sauce.  I'll be sure to come back here again next time I'm in town.

We came here in search of good sushi based on yelp reviews.  It's very hard to find a place that compares to the sushi you can find in the San Francisco Bay Area.  It's comforting to see Asian families eating here and Asian sushi chef's.   The food was very good and the fish tasted fresh.   The place was small and we couldn't tell if the place was open, but the decor was nice and not Americanized.   I will definitely coming back here for sushi.

I'll sum this place up in one word -"hamachi-kama". Or is it two. I don't know for sure, my Japanese is very limited. What I do know is that it is without a doubt one of the best things that I've had there. For those of you that don't know, it's charcoal grilled yellowfin collar. The collar is the part of the fish just behind the gills and forward of the pectoral fins and is one of the most neglected part of the fish, at least here in the States. Ours came grilled to perfection, crunchy on the outside, silky soft and delicious inside. Another high point was mackerel 3 ways- two marinated pieces of nigiri sushi, as a carpaccio salad, and then finally the skeleton coated in rice flour and deep fried as a bone cracker.  I could go on, but words can't do it justice. To find out for yourself just how good this place is, walk in, ask to be seated at the bar, and ask your "Itamae" (sushi chef) "Omakase onegaishimasu". The phrase means "Please astonish me" or "Please give me your best". It puts you in the chefs hands and he will bring you the best he has to offer, often times not even on the menu.  To accompany your dinner, ask for one of the cold, unfiltered saki's. Subtle and so much better than that heated swill that people drop in their Sapporo.

hands down the best sushi in the valley and some of the best that I had throughout the world. Who would have thought that from a little sushi shop in the desert?  Fresh fish flown in. Lots of non-sushi authentic dishes (try the Dynamite. You're welcome) and an impressive list of sake.

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday... In fact we just left there and I just have to say..this place is AWESOME! We both come from Hawai'i and have never had sushi this good since we left home! The staff is awesome,great great service.. And the sushi chefs are on POINT!! Defiantly coming back!!!

This place is pretty much the only sushi restaurant I will go to in the Phoenix area. It's authentic and the quality of the fish is just amazing. It literally just melts in my mouth.   I've gone alone here to eat some lunch and got immediately sat at the bar. The service is quick and friendly. I just love watching the sushi chefs cut up all the different slices of fish. The lunch sushi combo is very generous and fills me up. I usually also order some steaming hot green tea. Whenever I close my eyes, I sip some tea, and let the Japanese that the staff are speaking to each other just wash over me. I can forget for just a moment that I'm living in the desert and I'm transported back to when I visited Japan.   If I could afford it, and if I didn't live too far, I would eat here as much as I could.

A plus sushi in the desert! Fantastic staff, always make us feel very welcome, extremely accommodating with our 2 year old, who absolutely loves the Cali rolls and salmon sashimi. Best sushi in town by a country mile

Came in to this place while I was in Scottsdale this weekend. It was recommended to me by some friends.   First, what can I say! Probably some of the best sushi I've ever had! Phenomenal taste and blend of flavors. Good quality fish selected for the sushi, and everything blended together nice, it didn't taste like eating rice, seaweed, and fish seperately like other places.  The place is smaller so come earlier or right when they open to avoid waiting.  The sushi is reasonably priced, and service was fast and great!  Highly recommended if you want to try something different than the norm (RA/Stingray)  in Scottsdale .  Ill be back next time I'm in the area.
Just okay. We had two rolls, but the rice was just okay. We didn't try any specialty rolls, which I heard they are known for.

Weeknight, Hiro Sushi was crowded.    Greeted by the Sushi chefs as we entered.  Back at you, whatever you said!  Sat down, ordered copious amounts of delicious sushi, sashimi and sake.  Stopped eating long enough to look around and realize we were the only non-Asian table in the restaurant.  Great service.  We will be back!

Best fish in town for sushi.  However,  anyone else notice that the standard type rolls (yellowtail, salmon, etc) went from 8pc to 6pc?    That would be OK if the 6 pieces were as large as the original 8, but they are not.  It leaves me and my wife needing to order an entire extra roll just to eat the same amount as previously served.  I would have preferred a couple dollar price increase to get the original quantity of food.    The fish is great and the service is great, but the value has diminished and caused me to look elsewhere.

This is, by far, the best sushi restaurant in the Valley. I have eaten in sushi bars all over the world, including Tokyo, and this place is rivals the best of them. The sushi chefs are what you expect sushi chefs to be, Japanese. The presentation is perfect, the staff is friendly; you're greeted by the entire staff when you walk in and receive a farewell when you leave. I have been to this restaurant on numerous occasions and have never been disappointed. Before finding Hiro I spent years trying different sushi bars, and now this is the only one I will go to.  Tip: try the Uni
friendly staff and some good rolls. Not my favorite place in the greater Phoenix area but definitely up there. Hiro gets pretty busy on the weekends so making a reservation is recommended.

I really love this place. This is my second visit for lunch and man this place gets packed. The first time we beat the rush so the service was a little better. We sat at the counter  both times which is better during lunch if there are 2 in your party. It seems like you get your sushi faster.  We got a wash cloth the first time but not our second visit. I think it was too busy.  So far we have ordered the spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, unagi, tobiko, and soft shell crab (spider roll)  that's what they call it. The only item I didn't really like is the spider roll, I have tasted better.  I wish I live closer to here but I don't.

After years of eating mediocre Japanese  food in Arizona, I've finally found a place worth going back to again and again. From the outside it's nothing impressive, but it was packed on a Friday night. The steak tarriaki, was great and the miso soup was the best I've had in years. if you're  in the area, give it a shot.

OMG! The best! I ordered  box lunch. Amazing but ordered California Roll on the side. I kept asking. Wheres Cal. Roll? Waitress said, the sushi bar customers are priority before you. Not fair! I want to eat my meal together. They should have told  me..UGG!

This is a hidden gem.  Had the sashimi lunch combination and received an ample selection and amount of sushi.  It was the sort of sashimi you would expect to receive in a high-end sushi bar.  Service was great.    The only drawback is that the restaurant is small, and that it fills up quick, so you may have to wait for your table.  But the wait is well worth it!
Had Okinawan soba today for lunch, it was amazing!  3 other people had the same and it was 101degrees outside.

Japanese chefs, top notch sashimi, affordable neighborhood sushi place! 5/5  I'd lived in Japan before and this place can beat those in Tokyo! If you go to Hiro, you have to order their sashimi. We always order scallops sashimi, yellow tail, salmon, toro sashimi and uni (sea urchin)! Their rolls are amazing too. All sashimi comes in a big-fat-lap portion! Very fresh! The service is great too.

Best sushi ever! We loved the spicy mussels for an appetizer. My husband loved the Dback roll. I ordered the sashimi dinner, which came with delicious miso soup, a house salad with ginger dressing (sooooo good) and warm rice. The sashimi was so fresh. Wow! We'll definitely be back! Friendly chefs, attentive staff and great atmosphere too!

if you want the real deal sushi - go here  if you want the Scottsdale sushi, prepared by hack chefs, go to sushi brokers  this is the real deal, and shut the front door because no place is better.  every time I go here is a culinary experienced prepared by chefs, presented by chefs and  set a standard by chefs..  otherwise go to brokers and tell me you had warm sushi @ 'happy hour prices'

The whole service staff had attitude right from the get-go everyone seemed in a bad mood our Korean sushi chef was the worst he sat there and talked about me and my boyfriend in front of us laughing to his friend I felt so uncomfortable we left immediately!! I will never eat there again ever!

It was the absolute best sushi I've ever had, and I've been to a lot of sushi places. The service was amazing and waiting time was just 33 seconds! I ordered the smoked salmon and the crab which were heaven. Thank you so much Go to Sushi!!

Ridiculously priced. I paid 14 dollars for one of the rolls and there was only 5 mediocre pieces on the plate. The overall bill was 81 dollars and my boyfriend walked out hungry. I've never really been frustrated with food pricing but this place is crazy. For that amount of money I could have walked out with plenty leftovers from any other "expensive" Scottsdale place.   Also, the place is tiny so expect to rub elbows with people. The waitress seemed nice initially but god forbid you actually ask her to bring you anything and she makes a face like you ended her whole world.   Definitely will not recommend to anyone nor will I ever return.

When i have sushi, I always base my ratings on the freshness of the fish. If it's not fresh, it's not for me. Also, in Japan the most popular fish is Maguro or Tuna. Hiro Sushi serves only the freshest fish available. The Maguro sashimi was excellent! I have also tried the dinner combo which is good for the non sushi eating crowd. It's a small restaurant so arrive early to guarantee a seat. Fortunately, we arrived 10 minutes before the restaurant opened and we were NOT the first in line.

I really like Hiro Sushi- The atmosphere is traditional, none of that hyped up IMAGE you get at some of other "Social sushi" places- This place is about the food. Period.  I usually come twice a month, the fish is always fresh, and service is top notch! When I drop on in, its usually for the Chirashi.  Their miso soup is lovely, nice pieces of tofu and none of that watered down colored broth stuff. I wish their wasabi had a bit more kick in the crotch heat to it, but otherwise its great! I'll keep coming to this place for sure!

This is as good as it gets. From the outside it appears uninviting but once you go inside you will be hooked. The sushi chefs have experience and skill. The waitresses and hostesses are professional with upmost respect for the customers. Although I am not a sushi expert, I have had my share around the country and this is 5 star sushi. Fresh, perfect portions and high quality presentation.
We love this place. Best sushi around..even got to see a few SF Giant players in having sushi. They said its there favorite place.  If u love sushi you will love this..

After my last review which states our $100 cost of a lunch for two (ok...we tried a ton that day)....I wanted to follow up with our visit for a birthday dinner last night. Three of us dining. We each ordered dinners. Two beers for my husband and hot tea for us. $87 total. It was a wonderful meal!

We have going to Hiro sushi for over 10 years. My husband and l love the intimate atmosphere and excellent sushi. You will need reservations when you have a group of 4 or more or you will be waiting a while. If you are a party of 2, you can always squeeze in at the bar.

Wow! An all around amazing experience. Their rolls are nothing short of perfection, and their nigiri is to die for. I would give this place seven stars if I could. I definitely would come back to Hiro, and I strongly recommend this restaurant for any special occasions, or for a fun night with friends. Definitely stay for dessert and order some amazing mochi. It's creamy on the inside, and soft on the outside. Amazing place!

So, we decided to come here because of the reviews and well, I wasn't very impressed, especially after such a long drive.   I was content with the sashimi and happy that they didn't charge extra when they served extra hamachi, but was a little irritated with the rolls. The cucumber rolls were dry, and the spicy tuna and spicy yellowtail rolls were mediocre at best. Overall, the quality of their sashimi was good, but you'll have to pay for it.   A little to over priced for what we ordered. Probably won't be making a second trip here unless we are in the area.

Found my new favorite sushi spot. Before yelp directed me to Hiro I was complaining that there was no sushi place that I loved around here. The atmosphere is calm and homey. Everything we ordered looked and tasted phenomenal. We ordered the Arizona roll which was cucumber wrapped, the sauce that came with it was so delicious we kept dipping our other food in it after the roll was done. We also ordered the Sedona roll, crispy spicy tuna, edamame and sea weed salad. I would recommend all of these items and I can't wait to go back and try more !

One of my favorite sushi spot in town. Authentic and fresh !!   This is not your typical scottsdale fusion sushi place with all the nice decor, chic ambience with fancy cocktails. Instead you will find this a solid family business restaurant with clean interior, fresh and authentic sushi. The owner and head chef is always there and you will often find quite some japanese regulars hanging there. Isn't this always a good sign to tell if the food is authentic ;)   Both the nigiri and rolls are good. Try their scallop and must have is salmon. They have the freshest in town. Uni (sea urchin) is always fresh there too.
Well above average neighborhood sushi joint.  I have had very nice quality fish here.  But potion can sometime be a bit on the small side.

Another good neighborhood sushi place, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here.  Miso soup, sunomono, and Las Vegas Roll were very good; Arizona roll, just okay; house salad, not so good.  Ambiance is...well, there isn't really any. Service is great.  I'd go here again if in the area, but there are equally good sushi places all over the Valley.

I grew up in sunny California eating a ton of sushi and loving every minute of it. When I moved to Phoenix I was resigned to the fact that my sushi days were probably over. I was not a fan of the chain sushi restaurants so many people rave about and frequent. I rate my sushi bars by the quality and the interest level of the food and not their creative roll names or multiple uses for mayo and imitation crab. Hiro sushi has put my sushi yearning heart to rest. The fish is fresh. The specials board is full of really interesting and different options. We encountered multiple people who frequent the place on a weekly basis and they informed us that the boards are always changing and they have never been disappointed. All in all I walked out of there full and excited that I was not going to have to drive to the coast for my fix!
Very traditional and fan-freaking-tastic.  Great specials,  shima-aji and kohada!  I need to go here more often.
The sushi here is pretty good I came the other night with my husband and they had great sushi but the service wasn't great and the wait was long. It's okay!

One of the few sushi places in Arizona I've gone to that I couldn't stop thinking about for hours afterwards (and the next day!). And that includes the long drive home from Phoenix to Tucson. I found this place after yelping it and boy were Yelpers spot on.  I don't know if it's on the menu but we got the "Chef special." Pretty much it consisted of us asking the sushi chef what's good there and he said he'll take care of us. If I have time, I'll post pictures but we received a whole array of fresh fish (nigiri, roll, and sashimi), including monkfish pate, and they were all amazing. I think the stars of the night were the Spanish Mackerel (tasted like a fatty Salmon) and the Toro, but honestly, you can't go wrong with any of them.   Bill was about $50/person but we didn't order any drinks. I think it's totally worth the price though.  P.S. I guess there was another dish that wasn't on the menu called the "lollipop." The patrons next to us got it and it looked delicious. We were too stuffed to order one at that point but in the future I'll be sure to try it. Also, it may help to call in reservations. We went on Sunday night at around 7pm and they were still packed.

My fiance and I are from NY where you never struggle to find sushi, so I was skeptical of finding a great sushi place in AZ.  BUT..this place proved me wrong!  It was very authentic Japanese and the sushi was incredible.  Extremely fresh, melt in your mouth, sushi.  And great service.  The place was bustling and the sushi chefs, Hiro included, seemed to know all the regulars!  Definitely a place to try if you are visiting and a place to frequent if you live in the area.

if you've grown up eating japanese food this place will bring back great memories! every thing is delicious and the restaurant is very comfortable. don't get rolls! instead treat yourself to some real japanese food, sashimi. ask the chef for what's good, trust him he does it for a living.

So, my friend and I went first to Yasu because we heard it was great. We were traveling on business and therefore using company plastic. So, we show up and the kid working the door says in a very "Spicolli-like" voice, "uh.... our credit card machine is broken tonight"..... So we replied that we were on expense accounts and would there be any way they could manually run our credit cards... The guy replies, "dude, you're outta luck"....  Funny, considering that I am a guy who eats out a lot and am not afraid to spend a lot of money in a place when the food and service is good... I wont be going back in there...  So we made our way to Hiro..... We were pissed and hungry after driving around and dealing with idiots all over town. Hiro was just what the doctor ordered. We sat down and were greeted and served drinks right away. We put our sushi order entirely in the hands of our chef who did not disappoint. He brought out order after order of fresh delicious sushi and sashimi... We had beer, sake and a great night.... When it was said and done, we spent about $250 for the two of us which was a lot but well worth it..... I'm sure you could go and have a great meal for much less, but we were going big and NOT PAYING!!!!!  Morale of the story is that Yasu's children working that night ran us out and straight to their competition where we will be spending money in the future... Go check out Hiro!

Let me join the chorus of people who are singing the praises of dining out on sushi at Hiro Sushi!    I just love the Kani (crabmeat) and Ebi (shrimp) sushi because it is fresh, tasty, and the chefs make it for me to order sans nori (seaweed).    We've tried a number of items on the hot menu, but come back primarily for the sushi and the friendly service -- from the hostess to the servers to the sushi chefs to the bus staff... just lovely.    We go early to ensure we get seated.  Try it out!  You'll become a fan.
Took sushi to go was very very good sushi just filters little bit pricey but still reasonably priced.

Great menu selection & service. Waitress was charming & helpful. She recommended fresh wasabi octopus which was the highlight of our meal. Served raw, with fresh wasabi wrapped nigiri. Texture was a surprise (squishy eyeballs) but wonderful. Spicy baked mussels were a curdled mess but my dinner companion enjoyed them very much. I was also not thrilled with the monkfish liver pate (ankimo). But again, my more experienced companion thought they were wonderful.

Hiro makes the best sushi in Phoenix, period. The fish always tastes fresh. It's not mushy and frozen in the middle like most sushi you find in Arizona. The tempura is light, fluffy, and seasoned. Most of all, it doesn't taste like it belongs on an onion ring. The calamari is tossed in a light sauce that elevates the dish from good to awesome. If you like sushi that is deep-fried five different ways and stuffed with cream cheese, this is not the place for you. If you like fresh fish, bold flavors, and a friendly staff, go to Hiro. The long line of people clamoring to get in on any given night is a great indication of what to expect once you get in.

First review on Yelp because it's just so extremely frustrating to deal with shitty service. Just visiting Scottsdale with my family, looked through Yelp for a Japanese restaurant and was excited to come here due to all the great reviews. When we walked in, the host was great, extremely friendly. When we were greeted by our server Judy, she had an attitude & was rude. I noticed that it was an added gratuity of 18% for parties 6 or more. My family and I were 6 altogether. From the get go, I knew I would be unsatisfied with the service. She got our drinks & when we were going to order, she was rushing and had the attitude like "I've got better things to do than stand and take your orders". There were 6 of us, after every person she would say "is that all?" Like hello, you see 6 or us. Do you think only 2 will order while the rest just sit here & look pretty? Nope. Rude, unacceptable and unprofessional. I'm a server as well and could care less if you're having a bad day. You work for you tip, you're not entitled to it. If this wasn't an added gratuity I wouldn't have left more than 10%. All in all, the food was good, service was unacceptable, I was highly disappointed and will not be back.

Best Sushi place I've been to, great food without the snobby ''sushi is so trendy' attitude and blaring music.  The staff is so friendly, the sushi is affordable --- we go there once or twice a month! Delicious!!!

A regular for 15 years but their new host was rude enough to guarantee they won't have my business for the next 15. Can't spend enough to get respect, I guess. Simply stated, "wrap it up" is not an appropriate phrase to use on a customer who waited to be seated at a table and dropped $150 on a Wednesday in celebration of her father's birthday.
Place is good!  Go check it out!  Restaurant, not much to it, very basic, small, but the sushi is excellent!
Yummy sushi, reasonable prices and fresh.  Staff and chefs super friendly, will return!
Small space . .Great food.short wait.friendly staff. Friendly patrons, who obviously love the place. Will certainly be back next time I am in town

Amazingly delicious and fresh sushi, probably the best in the Valley. I even got to try Jelly fish which was surprisingly scrumptious. I recommend having a reservation as we luckily got a seat at the bar on a Tuesday evening but I'm sure it's only busier on the weekends and I can see why.
I thoroughly enjoy the sushi here.  It's not the best sushi I have ever had (I use to live in CA and WA), but it is the best out here in Arizona!
One of my favorite sushi places.  Gets really crowded and its not very big though.  Not good for a large party.
Very surprised at our experience given all the favorable reviews on Yelp. We ordered rolls mostly and found them mediocre and some even "fishy" tasting, not fresh.

Very bad customer service. I was at the restaurant at 5:15 with my family to celebrate birthday of my 8 year old birthday. The staff said no reservation no table or take your family to bar area. It is really sad that the service to the customer is not important especially when the restaurant is empty.
Sushi is fresh and service is great.  I just wish the place could accommodate more people.  Sometimes the wait isn't worth the time.

Love searching out great sushi wherever I go.  This definitely hit the mark. These days so many sushi places are not very authentic - this is clearly staffed by Japanese who know what they are doing!  Very small - so call ahead.

Yay! I'm a fan :)  Wow, this place is SMALL. Far smaller than I expected, so be prepare to wait on a busy weekend night. Big selections of menu from appetizers to sushi, to entrees, and noodle dishes. We sat by the inner edge side of the sushi bar, and was greeted warmly by the sushi chef across from us.  We shared the Pork Katsu (probably one of the best from my memories of having this, it was fried to the golden color with white(?) meat inside, so delish!), Shrimp Tempura roll (good, like most of other place), Tuna Sashimi (we can taste the freshness, yum!), and Eel nigiri (decent, but prefer the ones at Sakana with much bigger size of the fish). The rice used for the sushi is a bit to the sticky side, but we both liked.   Service was a bit slow on the other side, my friend had to ask for water for a couple of times; overall the food was tasty. I'd definitely go back to check out more of the menu. btw, did I mention how much I liked the Katsu? I'd just go back for more of those! LOL

I've been to Hiro before and while I admit that the sushi is fresh and decent, it wasn't mindblowing by any means.  The reason why I'm giving one star though, is because my brother made reservations to eat here and we didn't get to because upon arrival, we waited 15 minutes for our table to "clear up" and then we were told that it would be at least another 20 minute wait.  It's obviously good enough for it to be crowded, but customer service was beyond horrible - what's the point of a reservation if you have to wait over 35 minutes for a table that was supposedly reserved?  And when I told the host we were leaving, he could not have cared less, nor was he remotely apologetic. . . I won't be going back.

I have lived in Los Angeles for over 20 years, and visited Phoenix on a house-hunting trip.  I made the mistake of eating at Ra (Gilbert, AZ) the night prior, and was having second thoughts of moving to the area...  ... that is, until I ate at Hiro.  What a relief!  Real Japanese sushi in the middle of the desert!  Where other Scottsdale sushi places distract you with unnecessary sauces or overly loud music, at Hiro the fish speak for themselves.  Recommend: yellow tail and salmon nigiri / spicy ribbon roll  Try: Orion beer (did you know the US versions of Kirin/Sapporo/Asahi are all NOT brewed in Japan?  Don't believe me?  Read the label.)  Plan to try next: Arizona roll / Okinawa Noodles  I will be moving to Chandler, but will gladly make the drive here for all my sushi needs.

This is our go to place for the best sushi in Phoenix.  They have the freshest quality followed by excellent service.  My favorite is the pickled wasabi which most japanese restaurants don't even know what it is.  Very good hamachi kama (grilled yellowtail collar) This is a must try place.

I've tried sushi one time before this place and I wasn't pleased. I give everything a second chance and this place was well worth the second try! I walked out of there stuffed, and loving some of the sushi I wasn't a fan of at my last place. The waiters and waitresses are fantastic! They are all very courteous, caring and know how to treat their customers! I'll be coming back for more!

Love this hidden gem. The place is tiny but the service and food is memorable. I seriously have no idea how people find this place, it is always busy. You can make rsvp which I highly recommend especially on the weekends.
It's become my "go-to" sushi restaurant when I'm in the Northeast Valley. Everything from the sushi to the service is great. I highly recommend Hiro to anybody.

Sushi/sashimi is always fresh, the service is good. If they want to increase sales they need to improve on the details of the rest of their menu. I.e meat, chicken dishes as they are just ordinary. Stick with the Sushi/sashimi - great stuff...and get there early....plenty of parking.

As Manhattan sashimi snobs, we were surprised to find this restaurant in Scottsdale.  While not up to top NYC standards, it was definitely reliable for an enjoyable and solid Sushi and sashimi meal.  The rolls were top quality utilizing local fresh ingredients.  The ankimo was excellent.  Staff was kind.
AMAZING. Fresh, thick slices of fish with perfectly cooked rice and genuine Japanese flavors. A true hidden gem
We have visited this restaurant several times and each time we really enjoyed the food here.  The wait can be long as 45 minutes or longer but worth it.

This is by far my (and the hubby's) favorite Japanese place in the Valley. The sushi rolls are typical of what you would find in just about every other "sushi joint" but what sets Hiro apart in my opinion are the non-sushi menu items. It is reminiscent of my experiences in Japan - Okinawa Soba, Nabeyaki Udon and mushroom tea pot soup to name a few. And if you consider yourself an adventurous eater and really do want sushi/sashimi ask for "omakase" and the chef will whip up some off-the-menu items sure to make you smile. Oh and the staff is worth getting to know if you have some time to chat a while. (Hint: they have lives outside of the restaurant. Go figure!)

Best sushi in the Phoenix area!  I originally heard about this place from a sushi chef at another restaurant.  I asked him where he went when he wanted sushi, and he said to Hiro!  The best thing about Hiro Sushi is that the average customer has a sophisticated palate, so they can offer all the exotic stuff nobody else has.  If it is your first time, sit at the far left of the sushi bar (that is where the owner, Hiro-san does his work).  Tell him you are "at his mercy" and see what he gives you!

This restaurant used to be my best Japanese restaurant, now the old owner is not there most of time. We went to the restaurant this Saturday evening,we called for reservation at 5:30 pm for sushi bar,she told us sushi bar is only first come first serve. We arrived there before 6:pm,She wrote our name on the waiting list and another guest Tony's name was behind us,but when the bar table was clear, she called Tony's name in stead of us.We protested, She said Tony was working there,and he called one hour before. She didn't apologize to us, they seated us 10 min later.The quality of service is no longer like before.  Unhappy Jenny

I can't say enough good about this place.  I have eaten here many times and have never had a bad meal.  As a matter of fact, I ate there one night, and the only way I can describe the meal is that it was magical.  Every bite was amazingly delicious, and every dish was better than the previous one.  I took one of my co-workers from Japan there for lunch one day and he said it was just like being in Tokyo.  High praise.

AMAZING sushi! Sat at the bar and asked the sushi chef to surprise us with something...and he served us this HUGE roll with LOTS of raw fish on top (yummy!). Never be nervous to ask them to do that because they definitely know what they're doing. It was delicious...and so were the other rolls!
Meh. It's fine. Maybe this is great sushi for Arizona, but I really wasn't impressed.

This is by far the best sushi in Arizona! Always fresh and that chefs are fantastic! I moved here from Santa Barbara California so my fish standards are high! This place is the only place on par with SB!

What an amazing hidden gem. Quality of ingredients is through the roof here some of the best fish I've had in AZ. Very authentic feel on the inside and great rotating specials.   Pricing for what you get is very good. You get what you pay for with sushi but I felt that this was a big value.   Will be a returning customer for a long time.
love it best sushi on the planet great service good crowd servers very helpful with menu the best highly recommend

LOVE this place. Hands down some of the best sushi I've ever had - everything is fresh and thoughtfully made. The sushi is great (the scallops are amazing), they have some unique rolls on the menu and the service is outstanding. It's a very small place which I love and I think it adds to the authenticity. The chefs greet and say thank you to all who enter and leave. Can't say enough good things about this place!

Absolutely the best Japanese restaurant in Arizona.  Whether you're bored with the ubiquitous maguro, california rolls, etc., or just looking for a great bowl of Okinawan noodles, this is your place.  Besides, where else can you find shiokara?  Order from the specials board for the best variety of tastes,  Or you can do what I do and let the chef make whatever he thinks is best.   Sometimes the ex-pat sitting next to you is a celebrity in Japan who is in AZ to anonymously enjoy a little golf.  And if you're a baseball fan, stop by during spring training; you may be sharing bar space with more than one major leaguer.

Everything was AMAZING. We sat at the bar with the chefs making everything in front of us. We asked he serve their favorite rolls and went with a couple. My favorite was the Hiro Roll - I highly suggest anyone trying it. I was disappointed they didn't have a happy hour and the prices were more than I expected them to be but overall it was amazing. Also try the pickles wasabi!! So amazing. We will definitely be back once we have more of a budget
Great sushi without the fluff.  It's kind of nice to find a cozy sushi bar in scottsdale.  =)

Unfortunately, the other sushi joint was closed.  Fortunately, I found Hiro sushi within 6-7 mi. of the original one.  Thanks yelpers!  Ordered the sashimi and the chirashi for lunch.  I had the chirashi.  The fish was fresh, there was a nice variety and the portion was decent.  Reminds me of Sugarfish in LA.  Only complaint is that it's in the suburbia part of Scottsdale.  Would have been a regular spot if it were more centrally located.  Will return!

I really wanted to like this place. I was so excited for another great sushi restaurant to try. After reading the rave reviews, we decided to go in on two occasions and try the sushi, but both times it was just so-so. Nothing stood out and nothing was any better than the other sushi places in the area.   On another occasion we decided to try takeout and had the chicken katsu thinking that maybe the cooked food was where people were blow away, but we enjoyed this even less than the sushi.   Needless to say, we likely won't be returning anytime soon.

This is a great place for sushi. It's always fresh and tasty. They have one of the best seaweed salads in Phoenix. They are also have inari which is a fav of mine and very difficult to find around here. I'd recommend the veggie roll as well. I never eat tempura or teriyaki so I can't comment on those selections.
Best Sushi in town! My wife and I have been dining at Hiro for 13 years and still make it one of our favorite date night destinations.

We only tried the sushi, and we tried the restaurant three times.  Where are these raves coming from?  We found it overpriced and undistinguished, as good let's say as the sushi in Fry's supermarket.  No, we won't bother giving it another chance.

Well, actually I give Hiro a 4.5, but I did now know how do give a half-star. No matter, Hiro is fantastic.   We were driving from Flag back to our hotel in Phoenix and reached out to Yelp and this paid off big time. We were directed through the darkness of Scottsdale, to a very non-descript place and there is was: the friendly facade of Hiro Sushi.   We had the usual: miso, salad, rolls, and tempura. The quality was without doubt, and the service was without flaw. The welcoming interior made us feel right at home, with a desire to linger long after the meal was done. There were other patrons enjoying the experience in the same way we were. I can't wait to go back.

Brief Review:   Just OK.  Feedback on rolls primarily.  Too few options. Rolls smaller than most at this price point. Hiro Roll presented as raw roll but the frying cooked the fish.  Service good and sushi chefs quick in response and friendly.

I was very impressed by this place! Everything was more than perfect, from the friendly hostess, to the hard-working bus girl (she was GOOD! Our drinks were always filled, and as soon as we finished a plate she took it almost immediately), as well as the awesome service from our server, and lastly, everything we ordered was so so SO good.   Everything was so fresh, and so tasty, just imagining it all is making me hungry for it all again. The calamari came, and my fiance and I looked at it kinda freaked out but then as soon as we tried it we couldn't get enough. We got a few different rolls, and they were all perfect.   I believe this is now going to be our go-to sushi spot from here on out. Will definitely be coming back and will DEFINITELY be recommending this to everyone.

This is the most authentic Japanese restaurant in the phoenix area. The chefs are actually Japanese, where most others are Chinese. The prices are very reasonable and the selection of dishes it great with seasonal specials as well.  Great atmosphere and service!

The Chart House in Scootsdale has a great menu for two for $50.00.My friend and I were very happy with the menu and the food. The coconut shrimp appetizer was excellent and the Mud pie was very large and out of this world. Great ambiance and good service

As a North Scottsdale resident, I hate to admit it but good sushi and sashimi are kind of hard to come by.  This is not to say that there is a dearth of sushi places available, just that most places suck.  However, Hiro had been recommended by several friends and, of course, there are glowing Yelp reviews.  So it was with high hopes that a friend and I stopped by for lunch a couple of weeks ago.    As mentioned in other reviews, the decor is not much to look at.  However, I have had good luck with other sushi places in strip malls (Hana, Yen & Yasu), so this did not really affect me.  Bring on the fresh fish and I'll forgive just about anything.  And Hiro delivered on this front.  The Toro was delicious and the Uni was just right.  We also took a run at the Hiro Roll, thinking that the restaurant's namesake roll would be a shining example.  Unfortunately, the flavors did not quite meld for me and the eel sauce was anything but special.  Perhaps it was the asparagus  . . .  I addition, I was not really impressed with the the flavors in the miso soup - it kind of felt like they were just going through the motions here.
Every year when I am in town for Barrett-Jackson I have dinner here at least 5 times!

My new favorite place for fresh RAW fish.  You get what you pay for.  The price can be high if you like to eat lots of rolls and/or lots or sashimi.  This is not a buffet style place.  The sushi chefs behind the counter acknowledged my fiancee and I as we entered and as we left the restaurant.  Their mackerel was the freshest I have ever tasted and I'm from the New York, New Jersey region.  The mackerel had a soft texture and neutral taste, I'm imagining that it was delivered and prepared the day that I went.  I also ordered the salmon sashimi and the spicy salmon roll; both of which were excellent.  If you want a buffet, another restaurant near by will do.  But if you want to savor every bite and you want to really taste fresh fish then I recommend Hiro.  Can't wait to schedule another visit, which reminds me pay day is near.....

My husband and I have both loved sushi for a very long time.  We've eaten at quite a few of the sushi places here in town.  A friend recommended Hiro and we tried it about ten years ago.  It's still the best sushi in town in our opinion.  You can find places that offer bigger rolls, cheaper prices and other "lures" but you won't find the quality of sushi at those places that you will at Hiro - consistently!

I moved from Los Gatos, CA to Scottsdale in July 2011 and when I interviewed for the job I knew I had to find at least one decent sushi restaurant before I could accept the offer...maybe a slight exaggeration, but it was top on my list!  I found Hiro Sushi on Yelp and made a late night run for dinner.  The restaurant is cozy and tucked into a strip mall, so I wasn't sure what I was going to get.  When I went inside, there was a line, which I took as a good sign...and waited for my table.  I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and quantity of sushi.  Each roll I ate was tasty and service was very good.   I was pleased to find a great, little sushi spot and have eaten there many times in the last year...their takeout service is quick and easy too!  I may be moving back to CA but if and when I'm in Scottsdale again, I will certainly pay a visit to Hiro Sushi!
Best sushi in the valley would recommend to anyone who knows good sushi very fresh fish and very attentive service will be my regular sushi spot

Stop by for a quick lunch and was presently surprised by this little sushi restaurant. The service was good and the food was good. They had asahi beer on draft which is rare find. Overall the fish tasted very fresh and I would go back! Con is that a kind of hole in the wall place...
Pretty tasty and standard japanese fare. The waitstaff are really fast and a bit crazed but that's ok with me. Good sushi for Phoenix.

By far best sushi in town. The sushi is always fresh. The selection is very satisfying and service is good too. Had the nigiri toro, tuna roll and seaweed salad. The mochi ice cream is at the exact temperature so if you're looking for a sushi restaurant that is unnecessary on the high-end style that would be the perfect place to go. No wonder it's always full. The food is delicious at the right price with excellent service. Don't miss out this gem, you wouldn't regret it. Definitely coming back.
Everything here is amazing!!! Our go to spot when i'm Scottsdale for sushi and Japanese cuisine!
Super fresh fish small seating area so arrive early as they get very busy.service by everyone there is excellent very attentive. I think the best sushi in  Scottsdale. Very good selection of fish.

Probably my favorite sushi restaurant in Scottsdale! Everything about this place is awesome, from the food to the staff. I haven't found a place with fish fresher than what I had at Hiro. It's never a disappointment! Please try it!!

We came here just after landing late Friday night for Spring Training.  We had made reservations for 6 at 9pm.  We showed up at 9:10pm and were seated immediately.  Our waitress could not have been any nicer and was very appreciative that we had made reservations.  I was shocked to see that the place was packed so late on a Friday night---definitely a popular place.  Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious.  I would definitely eat here again!

I can't believe that I have not written a glowing review of quit possibly the best sushi joint this side of Tokyo... yes Hiro is that good! I have been coming here for almost 15 yrs. and have never been disappointed by the stunning freshness or the real deal approach owner Hiro takes when preparing his dishes. This isn't a typical Scottsdale "night club" that just happens to serve sushi... you know who I am talking about! This is a true master's class on how fish should taste!  The staff is always friendly and despite how busy they are always manages to create a nice experience. The specials are always new and very interesting and if you are feeling daring just sit in front of Hiro himself and say surprise me.... hold onto your gee!

Very authentic place -Japanese speaking chefs. Ordered Okinawa soba - first time ever had that. Worth trying, strong ginger flavor. Pork ribs on top.   Chirashi (sashimi on top of rice) was good quality. Not as good as circle sushi - in Atlanta - place we usually go.   The disappointment was the "catch of the day" fried pompano. Butterfish. It was small, a little sad, and deep fried. Very small, not tasty. Not much to eat.   Overall a place worth trying. In a strip mall, but authentic experience.

Arguably the best restaurant in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area that primarily focuses on sushi/sashimi. The quality and selection of fish at Hiro Sushi is top notch. They regularly carry items that are hard to find at most other sushi restaurants in the area like sea eel (anago) and abalone (awabi). In addition to their regular selection of fish, they have a menu of special seasonal fish that changes from week to week. They put a lot of care into cutting and preparing the fish that they serve. You can also order izakaya-style cooked appetizers like yellowtail collar, fried squid legs, and fried smelt. Given the quality and freshness of ingredients, the prices are very reasonable.   The service is attentive and all of the sushi chefs are very friendly and accommodating to special requests.
Love this place.  They open at 5pm.  Get there a few minutes early and there is always someone hungrier than you waiting to get in first.

Excellent sushi! Countless celebrities consistently eat at Hiro - they aren't repeat customers because the sushi is bad!  We ate a variety of rolls, none disappointed. Miso soup was very good. Small area so be prepared to wait. We waited roughly twenty minutes but hostess was very friendly. The sushi bar is really cool - there is a lot of action going on and the chefs are incredibly social.   I will be returning when I go back to Phoenix!

Very good and fresh sushi. They have some special fish too like: Madai, Shima Aji, Sake Toro, Aji, Mirugai, Suzuki, Bluefin Tuna and Toro. Nice service. Make sure sit at the bar and asked to be served one at a time. Also reasonable too for this quality of fish   They also have fresh wasabi and give a lot for only $1. Would come back.

I finally tried Hiro Sushi...OMG!  Now I understand why everyone I know raves about this place!  Best sushi in AZ.  Just as good as some of my fav sushi places in Southern California and East Coast!  HIGHLY recommend!
This place is great. The Sushi is always so fresh and they don't skimp on the amount of fish in each roll.  The restaurant has good energy, a must visit for any Sushi lover.
I don't know what I'm missing here....... We eat sushi at least four times a month, and to be honest. I've had better sushi at fry's!! bland rolls, no flavor. Tuna was terrible!!
Great sushi best I had in Scottsdale! As good quality of fish like best in CA. Expensive but worth it. Will definitely be back
Pretty fresh ingredients,  truly "spicy" when the menu says "spicy" (not a fake spicy if u know what I mean). Loved all 7 rolls we ordered for 2 people! The service was great as well.

Wonderful hole in the wall sushi place. From the outside you wouldn't know such an authentic and delicious sushi restaurant awaits you! My colleague and I sat at the bar and shared a few rolls and our favorite was the Diamondback or D roll. Excellent service too!
If you want to sit at a table, you must make reservations.  Very small, excellent place.

RACIST!!! Bring my parents there Saturday night, waiting for 40 mins and finally there were 4 seats open at bar, the front desk guy let one white couple who has absolutely NO RESERVATION and just arrived for 10mins took the seats and we were on top of the waiting list. Well the front desk guy himself is an ASIAN as well said he is bad at math sort of crap. I'll never go there again

Love this place!  One of my favorite spots to drop in for dinner while on the road.  Sushi is fresh and tasty. And, if you like teriyaki steak...it's very nice (for those who need their food cooked). Enjoy!
EXCELLENTE!!! Small spot in the Shea medical area with fresh fish and very warming service.

My boyfriend and I love sushi, so we're always looking for new sushi restaurants to try. Our usual place is Kabuki, but this surpassed it by far! We sat at the sushi bar. The servers and the sushi chefs were all really friendly. The rolls started coming shortly after we ordered. The fish was extremely fresh, we could definitely taste the difference!  We started off with the Philly roll, which we get at every sushi place we go to. Then we got the rainbow roll (my favorite, the fish was so good!), the spicy tuna roll and the Vegas roll. When the check came, we realized that they had forgotten to give us our spicy salmon roll. We brought it up to the servers and the chef apologized and made us one, no questions asked. And again it tasted awesome! 5 stars without a doubt.
Consistently delicious! We love their Teriyaki dinners, green tea, salads with ginger dressing and edamame. Yum!
Really excellent authentic Japanese dishes. Nice atmosphere and great service. Prices are a little high but not unreasonable. :-)

Went here on a whim, I really enjoyed it. The rolls are reasonably priced, most are under $10. Nigiri and sashimi were great! My biggest regret was that I didn't have room to try more things. They are usually pretty busy so we wound up sitting at the bar, it's a good idea to make a reservation. The everybody who worked there were eager to please and seemed genuinely excited and grateful we were there, which I found rather charming. Go check it out!
Best sushi in the valley. They pay attention to every last detail. The restaurant itself is small but cozy. This is my new go to sushi spot.

I'm not usually into sushi but Hiro has some very delicious food. Even at 9:00pm the place was packed, but we got lucky enough to be seated at the counter right in front of the sushi chefs. I've never had sushi made directly in front of me before so it was quite an enjoyable experience.  I was there with my boyfriend, and between us we got a caterpillar roll (eel), a spider roll (soft shell crab), a shrimp tempura roll, a lobster roll, a tuna roll, some edamame, yellowfin nagiri, tuna and salmon sashimi, and some mochi for dessert. Everything tastes great, and the staff were very friendly. My only complaint is that occasionally we had to remind the chefs that we were missing a roll or two, but it was understandable with how busy it was, and afterwards they were quick to get us our food. It was a bit pricey, though most sushi is, but we'll definitely be back!

Mind blown!  Did not think you could get amazing sushi in AZ!  I will surely return!  All the dishes were delicious, service was polite and professional, and of course the sushi was great!  We had many dishes and I will post pics of them. Each were amazing!

All Show & No Go! This place has all the hallmarks of a great Sushi restaurant: An army of chefs, an extensive (and expensive) menu, reservations needed for a table, people waiting 20 minutes for a seat at the bar. But the fish itself is actually very mediocre! I ordered the sushi assortment for $21 and most of the pieces were flavorless. I've actually had supermarket sushi at Fry's that tasted better than this!!! My experience eating the finest sushi in New York City and the upscale suburbs of NJ has been that the fish explodes with flavor on your tongue and practically melts in your mouth. Not here. This place is way overpriced for what it is and it left me quite angry

All the restaurants I went to in Japan consistently impressed me with their superior quality of service.  Long story short, this pseudo-Japanese joint in Arizona (aka land of where you should be getting mexican food instead) seems to pride itself on consistently shitty service, horrid issue-resolution, and perpetually menopausal waitresses.

I've been in Arizona now for 12 years and I'd say this is the best sushi I've had here! The Salmon and Toro were so buttery and just melt in your mouth.  The spicy yellowtail roll was super yum too! I will definitely be back!
Great small sushi and lunch hangout. Always friendly and fast service! A regular for me.

This is hands-down my favorite sushi joint in town. The fish is always amazingly fresh, the owners and staff are always friendly and the soft lull of music and clean, minimal surroundings are perfect. My favorite rolls are the negitori crunchy roll and the spicy salmon, however; everything is very tasty. If you love sushi, you'll love Hiro. Naomi Garnice gives it two-thumbs-up!!

We were looking forward to eating here because of the good reviews. But we found the food mixed. Also you can't really call it "authentic" with the selection of Sushi Rolls it offers. Most of them don't exist in Japan. I expected more from a Japanese owned sushi restaurant.   The fish itself was fresh, but the rolls we ordered were poorly made and were coming unrolled. Messy on the plate, and difficult to eat. No, they weren't overstuffed, just normal rolls, except for the Crazy Roll, which surprisingly was the best one of all. Tasty & well made.  The Spicy Tuna wasn't very spicy. The Spicy Scallop had a drop of hot sauce on it that looked so much like blood, I couldn't try it. The real crab in the California Roll was so dry that it ruined it.  The Negi Toro was tasteless, the Negi Yellowtail, the same. The Unagi  was sloppily cut. The Chirashi Sushi was smaller than other restaurants where we've eaten. Plus, they forgot my husband's order of oysters.   On the other hand, the salad was good because the dressing wasn't over sweet, and the edamame tasted fresh. Not a reason to drive to North Scottsdale for dinner.

Do not let the strip mall, small location deter you from visiting this sushi place.  We just went with a huge assortment of sashimi with a sprinkling of grilled mackerel and edamame.  For being in the Scottsdale area right of the 101, the sashimi was very fresh and we got the insider hookup for wasabi.  This place is a keeper.

Enjoyed a anniversary dinner here at the sushi bar with my guy. It's nestled in a shopping center and some place that I wouldn't have noticed but I'm glad my boyfriend picked this place out for us. They had a great selection of rolls, nigiri, and sashimi. The service was very attentive and smooth. We were able to really enjoy ourselves.

Got the Salmon Bento Box for lunch and Sushi / Sashimi lunch combo.  Both were very tasty.  Food took a little longer to come out but, was worth the wait.  Tempura was fried perfectly.  Some issues with service, otherwise would be 5 stars.  They gave shrimp tumpura instead of vegetable tempura.  Also ordered white tuna, but they forgot that.  Over all food was great though, quality of the fish was great.

Unacceptable to tell us that yes we will hold the sushi bar since you are coming in 5 minutes, and literally as you walk there server has given that spot to another group that walked in from of us. Good food but horrible service and not polite!

By far THE BEST sushi in AZ! Not much by way of atmosphere. It's clean and traditional in its decor but not only is the waitstaff terrific but the fish just melts in  your mouth. I actually go at least 2 or 3 days a week and most of the time by myself after a workout. I sit at the bar and Hiro (the owner) takes good care of me! Prices are reasonable for sushi and the salad dressing is the best EVER and I am a sushi-a-saurus!

Best sushi in Arizona. Comparable to some of the top sushi spots in San Francisco!  They have some of my favorite items, including Ankimo, Natto, Toro and Uni.  The salmon is amazing and their selection of fresh fish is excellent.
Great food is worth the wait- and this is beyond great food! Staff is wonderful, sushi is excellent, atmosphere is comfortable. Worth many repeat visits so that I can try everything on the menu!

We've tried this place several times in the past few years, and each time that we do, I end up kicking myself for giving it another shot.  I just do not understand the reviews raving about the sushi here!  Once again, the fish we had was of mediocre quality at best.  Maybe I'm just missing something here since it seems like the regular customers are able to command the best quality fish (or at least it certainly looked a lot better than what we had), but the fish just isn't all that fresh and the service is consistently lackluster.  We sat at the sushi bar and literally had to flag down the waitress to get our drinks refilled.  We had some Hamachi and Maguro nigiri, neither of which were impressive and a couple of rolls, one of which was the Negi Toro roll that I had to force myself to eat given the off taste it had.  We'd actually assumed that the sushi chef had forgotten about the Maguro nigiri and were ready to leave, but as soon as we flagged down the waitress, he presented the two pieces to us, nearly a half an hour after the last roll he'd served us when the place was less than half full.  I find it strange to hear how many other reviews mention the number of Asian people they see eating here and somehow manage to draw the conclusion from that fact that this is a great place.  That would seem to follow the logic of visiting Europe and seeing a McDonald's filled with Americans and drawing the conclusion that McDonald's is a top-notch American restaurant.  The point here is that not everyone is discerning regardless of whether they are eating their native fare and I find it difficult to believe that this would be considered a quality sushi restaurant among discerning Japanese diners given how much better quality sushi is available in the Valley.  Our last visit to Hiro will be our last and for anyone looking to find fresh, high quality sushi in Scottsdale, I would highly recommend trying Yume at the Scottsdale Promenade.

I used to live down the street from this place, but I never gave it a shot. I'm sorry I missed out all these years, because as it turns out.... out of all the sushi places I've been to, I was most impressed with this place. The fish was fresh, the rolls were plentiful... I can't wait to go back.
I've been here a couple times on business trips to Scottsdale and I'm always impressed.  Excellent quality.  Restaurant is small and popular so it's best to go early or late.

Regularly go here for basic sushi fare. Not the best, but it's not a Scottsdale sushi chain owned by Caucasian douchebags so I'd rather give Hiro my business :) Gave 4 stars because the sushi is above average taste-wise and they do NOT have any type of happy hour specials
Love Hiro. Whether it's lunch or dinner you will not be disappointed. Seating is limited so plan ahead.

This is the best sushi I had in the phoenix area. This is a traditional japanese sushi restaurant where quality is most important vs the mediocre sushi restaurants that focus on the atmosphere first.   The fish is very fresh and the chefs prepare it very well.  I got 4 orders of nigiri (2 per order) , eel cucumber roll, mushroom teppan soup, seaweed salad.  My favorite was the salmon nigiri. The chefs were very nice too and it was fun sitting at the sushi bar.  I will definetly be back!

Sunbum here with Jill eating the sea urchin. (First time for Jill)  I say this place is the best sushi place in Scottsdale Area!! Very fresh and well cut !! and great appetizers !! Go there right now and try for yourself ! Bring few people! You need to share the experience!!

Really solid sushi and sashimi here. My main complaint is we asked our waitress to bring us a bunch of sushi and sashimi that the chef recommended and asked to include some of the unusual specials. The waitress asked how much we wanted to spend and we asked how much money would require something special and she said $50 a person.  After waiting about 30 minutes we get a plate of very basic sashimi - although it did taste very good. Then we received 6 pieces of sushi, which were also tasty, but it didn't seem that we received $50 worth of food considering the costs of items on the menu.   Also - we asked for a specific roll on the side and asked for avocado twice and didn't receive it both times.   I'd definitely give this place another try and order items directly off the menu but I was a bit disappointed by the experience because it seemed we didn't get the amount of food we paid for and were still hungry at the end.  Otherwise, the service is great and this seems like a good local place.
Descent sushi for Scottsadale.  No brown rice option was odd considering the recent health movement away from white breads, rice etc.  Very friendly staff.

I have to agree, as so many others have said, it is one of the best sushi places in Phoenix area.   It is a small intimate hole in the wall place with very friendly and personal staff. It's rather authentic especially compared to the many other fusion spots nearby. And their food is great! Thus far, I've tried a handful of their rolls, sushi, appetizers, and noodles. The fish is fairly fresh, the food well presented and authentic. Particularly liked their okinawa soba. The food isn't cheap, but the price is more than reasonable given the quality and portions. Typical dinner for us $20-30/person

Great sashimi, everything is fresh and prepared gracefully. Not to be racist, but youve got real japanese chefs, waitresses, and patrons here.  Never knew there would be so many Japanese people in Scottsdale, AZ. One thing they can improve is to expand their sake menu, but their sushi is legit.
Nice ambiance, the place is quite small but the wait is not too long. Food is delicious and will come back again when visiting Scottsdale.
Best sushi I've had in Arizona. My whole family loved it and they are pretty harsh critics usually

This is one of my favorite places to eat. I think that their uni is always the freshest and creamiest compared to other competitors. Only place so far that gets good quality monk fish liver. Very consistent in good quality. There is always a wall of the their fresh catch of the day where you have the opportunity to try something you usually would not. They are priced very fair.   The restaurant has a very authentic feel to it all well. The staff is very friendly. The restaurant is small though and fills up fast.

I've been to 90% of the sushi restaurants in the Phoenix area and Hiro is always my baseline comparison. You can always tell if it's a sushi restaurant with true Japanese influence if they have good saba, hotate, and toro. Also, you can always tell if it's Americanized or not based off of how many rolls have cream cheese...out of the 18 rolls only 2 have cream cheese (and of course it's the Vegas roll and Philly roll). And c'mon they have an actual Japanese language menu, it doesn't get much more authentic than that, does it? Our routine order here is: Saba, hotate, hamachi, albacore, inari, zaru soba, hiyayakko (or agedashi tofu on a cold day), and of course a lovely, cold Gunma beer! I dare you to try that order and not walk out with a big smile on your face. To really get the full experience go with just 1 or 2 people and sit at the bar and chat with your sushi chef. Trust me, you'll have a great time!

Food is good, and usual for sushi restaurant. However, Service is terrible. Four of us sat down for lunch the restaurant was only serving 3 tables at the time we arrived then slowly more customers came in. One of us didn't even receive our meal and we all had finished our orders. Bento box came our first, then each of my two rolls, then Combination plate. One roll and two hand rolls never made it to the table. We kept checking with the server and she didn't seem to have concern or urgency. We then asked to remove those so he could go grab lunch somewhere else. Still waiting on a check. Server came back ten mins later and asked if we wanted anything more! No, we needed the check when you saw one person at the table didn't get to eat. No discount on the bill for lack of service and the apology was hmmmm. 3 other customers were served sushi plates during this time. It's odd because ours was all on one ticket that they would make other plates before finishing the ticket. Worst service at a sushi restaurant I've ever had.
Best in town hands down! I've tried everywhere else. Don't waste your time or your pesos. Go to hiro. Yellowtail all day

Great food, great chefs, great dinner experience!  I went for my birthday, and was treated to a nice chef's choice of some very interesting culinary experiences.  Our chef Leo was very fast, very polite, and very knowledgeable about the food.  They made me feel more like a guest and less like a foreigner.  To top it off, Leo did an awesome fruit carved rickshaw and served it to me with ice cream to make my night special.  Ill definitely go back again!

One of my top 3 sushi places in Arizona. Can't believe I forgot to write a review, must of been because I was too busy eating some of the best sushi/sashimi in the area. If you care about quality, presentation and attention to detail come here. People wait because it is that good when they are busy. Everything is good here.

First visit rating!  we tried a broad sampling of the menu. Tempura, sashimi, nigiri, rolls, etc. Our go to place for Japanese as of now. More to follow... after a second or third visit.   Four or five visits later our opinions have not changed. Still THE place to go for The freshest in sushi and Asian food.   Additional visits.... best Asian in the whole area!  Oh l, did I mention my spouse is Asian?
This is now my favorite sushi place in Scottsdale, great food and service, huge menu and efficient staff! Had dinner for 3 last night. We had great items and were stuffed and very satisfied!

This is officially MY sushi place in Phoenix. I've traveled far and wide, tried sushi in many states, in many countries, and in many ways, but this place has it all!  The cuts aren't perfect, like they are in other places, but they are thick and of such high quality you just don't care!  The specials change based on what's fresh.  The chefs are friendly and excellent at what they do.  The servers are kind, and attentive.  I was able to get types of sushi (as well as sake and beer) that I haven't been able to find elsewhere! (at least not in the states) The waits can be long because of the high volume of people and the tiny dinning area, but they do take reservations.  I almost hate to give such a glowing review because the more people, the bigger the line! But... I must, because it's just too good! If you're a sushi novice and wanting to try for the first time - this is your place! If you're a sushi aficionado, and just like what you like, but want it better - this is your place! If you're a sushi expert and wanting what you can't find elsewhere - this is your place!  You won't be disappointed!

This is a great local sushi place in Scottsdale. I went here with my parents a few days ago as it's near their condo and we were craving sushi.  Hamachi Kama - Didn't see this on the menu, but we asked the waitress and ordered it. Perfectly grilled and super tender. A great appetizer to share between two or three people.  Okinawa soba - Loved this noodle soup dish so much. Great broth, not too salty, which delicious noodles and fall of the bone spare ribs. Excellent.  Toro nigiri - Super fatty and buttery  Sashimi sampler - I usually wouldn't order this, but my parents don't eat much nigiri and rarely eat rolls, so they ordered it. Everything tasted super fresh though.  I had ordered one of their special rolls, but the name escapes me now. I think it had spicy tuna, cucumber, avocado, and something else...anyways, it was pretty good.  Service is great and the prices were pretty reasonable. Not the best sushi I've ever had, but good value. If my parents are still going here by the time I return next year, then this place is a keeper.  Go early for dinner. We went shortly after opening and were the first people in the restaurant. By six, there were only two small tables open.

Went here this evening with the wife and 4 1/2 year old.  Based on the reviews I was expecting better.  Don't get me wrong, there wasn't really anything wrong with the food (albeit maybe the toro) but it was no way a meal that was memorable.  Received a salad as part of a dinner entree - way too much dressing.  There was enough for 4 salads.  Miso was yummy though.  The yellow tail was very good as was the unagi but the toro nigiri was chewy due to sinew...  I don't know why we keep trying the spider roll at anywhere but Sushi Sam's in San Mateo - it was just OK.  Trying the California roll with the tempura bits was a mistake when there were so many other items on the menu.  Ordered the oysters on the half shell special and that was decent but again, not particularly special.  Price wise I'd say it was moderate to expensive.  The bill for 2 adults and a 4 1/2 year old was $115 before tip.  There was only 1 large beer on the tab.  I'm a visitor and I don't believe I'd come back again.  For the price I'd want to have a taste of Roka Akor.  Hindsight is 20-20 but that might have been the better bet tonight...

Summary: Consistently snooty hostesses, great wait staff and phenomenal quality food.  I'll share the bad first since Hiro gets more than ample praise that is mostly deserved. I don't know what it is, but the hostesses at the front of the restaurant have been particularly rude and unwelcoming for the past 3/5 visits. Hiro is very busy and very small with few seats. If you haven't got reservations expect to feel like an enormous burden if you come to eat here. It honestly feels like all the hostesses are 10th grade girls who don't know how to accommodate a party without a reservation. It's as if they haven't dealt with such a perplexing situation before. I wouldn't have let this shortcoming bother me so much if the staff didn't have such poor self control. After seating our party at the bar, one of the hostesses said, "You REALLY should get reservations if you're going to eat here" as she walked away. We live a mile from this place and sometimes decide to eat here in the spur of the moment... It's just poor form and not the kind of attitude that should be present in a quality dining establishment.  Food-wise, I can't speak highly enough of the sashimi. The quality and freshness of the fish is apparent. i haven't explored the sushi scene in cities like LA or SF but would imagine Hiro humbly rivals the quality of the best in these culinary hot spots. Once your seated, the staff seem to all be delightful and professional.

Really liked their Okinawa soba. I am usually all for the sushi and rolls at a place like this but the noodle dish really was something else. Sushi and rolls, however, were just okay. The rolls may have had too much rice - it was a bit difficult to eat.

A lot of Yelpers are very excited about Hiro Sushi here in Scottsdale, and it is conceivable that Hiro is one of the best sushi places around. However, being from San Francisco I am not quite as taken by it. It's a good sushi place, and that's all it is. The quality of the fish seems fairly average. I did try the miso soup and shrimp tempura both of which were quite good. The caterpillar, rainbow, and philly rolls however were nothing special, although the spicy yellowtail roll was great. The service was wonderful, everyone was really friendly, and the decor of the restaurant was nice - transporting you far away from the drab parking lot exterior. The prices are fairly high, though. The special rolls such as the rainbow roll is around $13 and their famous diamond back roll is a $18! Salmon nigiri is $5.50 I think which is more expensive than a lot of sushi restaurants I've been to in San Francisco. Overall it's a good sushi restaurant and clearly deserves 4 stars here in Scottsdale, although in San Francisco I would probably only give it 3 stars.

this is my favorite sushi place in the phoenix / scottsdale metropolitan area.  all the sushi fish are extremely fresh and made expertly with just the right amount of rice and wasabi.   the sushi rice is also perfect, the best i've had in phoenix with the exception of the now defunct seasaw. toro is to die for, sea urchin is sweet and delicate.  sweet shrimp is succulent and juicy.  the specials always change, but are always consistently unique and excellent.   service is always friendly and warm. on top of that, the prices are reasonable.   hiro can't be beat for really good, fresh, reasonably priced sushi.

I've eaten sushi all over the country, and Hiro Sushi is hands down the best sushi in Arizona.  The location is a bit hidden away within the shopping center, and walking inside there aren't that many tables, but this smaller size gives more attention to the customer, and it results in great service from the staff!  I find that almost everything I order here is great. Everything is made consistently fresh and great regardless of time of year.   Hiro Sushi is also great for Japanese cuisine in general! The noodle soups and soba are other dishes I frequent, and there are excellent lunch and dinner packages that come with rice, soup, and salad.  My recommendation? Go for the specials! The fried fish and teapot soup are very light and tasty. Don't be afraid to ask for something that isn't there! Chances are if you ask the waitress they still have plenty of that favorite dish coming up!  It gets very crowded on a weeknight, so because of the small size of the restaurant, be sure to make a reservation a couple hours in advance. It's painful to wait an hour and watch people eat their fantastic food!  It's a bit expensive compared to happy hours at other places, but who eats sushi to SAVE money? Hiro is truly quality over quantity, and I have never felt I've wasted a single dollar.

Hiro's is by far the best sushi in town. Hiro buys his fish fresh everyday and everything is meticulously prepared. Seating is limited so reservations are strongly recommended.   As a side note, Hiro is quite the golfer, he's had three holes-in-one!
Decent fresh sushi in a convenient location. The only downside is they close between lunch & dinner. The parking lot is very busy and crowded during the lunch hour.

Great place. Hard to find decent sushi this far from the ocean sometimes, but this place was great. Lots of choices and reasonably priced lunch menu. There were people lined up outside at 1130, waiting for this place to open. Clearly, they do some great stuff.

Nice quiet place, full for lunch. Lots of regulars from the sounds of the way the waitresses talk with the patrons. Great food, buttery smooth nigri and sashimi. Las Vegas to was huge and just the right amount of ingredients so nothing is overshadowed, very crunchy exterior my wife really enjoyed it. Coming back for sure.

WOW! What a great find! When the hostess escorted us to our seats (at the bar) - I immediately glanced over to look at the fish, I could already tell the quality was on point.  The rolls are unique and there's a decent selection - just enough to not be overwhelmed. The mackerel is some of the best I've ever had!  The service is great! Attentive but not overbearing. I'd easily be a regular if I lived here - but that's not to say I'm not coming back. The quality is amazing and it is truly the best sushi I've had. You definitely get what you pay for!   Who knew you could find fresh sushi in the middle of the dessert?! It exists! SO A.W.E.S.O.M.E.

The negative reviews about this place should be disregarded. The ones I've read are all written by people who seem to know little about Japanese food, like not to get a deep-fried dish for takeout, what the names of things they ate are...   Hiro is world class, period. I was a NYer for 15 years, ate at several of the best places there. I've traveled to Tokyo several times, and around Japan. I had the best sushi in Honolulu at Sasabune. Hiro holds its own with any of them. Not every thing on the menu is special, true. Which is why my wife and I tend to go there when we want to splurge and get the omakase. The chefs bring out their very best stuff, and you don't know what it'll be. It's usually the best meal of the year.   We went for our third omakase meal there last night, and it was wonderful again. All the fish was exemplary, starting with the red snapper, o-toro, and yellowtail sashimi. Absolutely top quality. We also had a dish of sauted mushrooms and grilled black cod, both of which were outstanding. There was what they call the crazy roll (delicious) and the spicy ribbon roll (also terrific.) There was the butterfish sashimi served with the fish's deep-fried skeleton. All of it wonderful. Ate every bone and morsel. Then came the nigiri, which included a wasabi octopus specialty, and frankly the only octopus sushi I've ever enjoyed. The salmon was sublime, the bluefin and albacore tuna wonderfully contrasting and delicious.
