The service was very good, and we felt like two very lucky people, having one of the best meals possible. Bill for this extravagant spread came to just over $200 for the two of us, including two large beers and two glasses of wine. The same meal at Sasabune cost us $330, and wasn't really better.   If you go and want to order a special treat, try the kiwi salmon. It's a blend of raw salmon, salmon roe, and kiwi seeds. The whole thing works brilliantly, and was invented by Chef Hiro. Memorable. Go, and get the good stuff. You will not be disappointed. Unless you don't know about Japanese food.
Love this place. Was referred here by a Japanese family that is on a two year assignment here. If they liked it it had to be good and it was!!
Best sushi place in Arizona.  They hook you up with healthy slabs of sushi.  We always go for nigiri, shrimp tempura, our favorites include, Sake (Salmon), Uni (sea urchin), Sweet Shrimp nigiri.

Being from California, the sushi was alright. Nothing that blew me out of the waters. But what I did appreciate was the service and how the restaurant was owned by Japanese people (instead of the Korean-owned sushi places that is everywhere from East Coast to West Coast). Service itself was excellent. Our hostess was very attentive to adjust to even the smallest changes to our party's requests. Sushi, on the other hand, was served at a varying rate which I found a bit annoying because some people got their food really quick while others had to eat after the rest of our group had finished eating. The quality was good but I have found "good" elsewhere also. I'll probably give it another try after I explore some other restaurants.

Before I delve into my personal experience at Hiro, I will discuss the important factors of, what makes a good sushi restaurant, according to my criteria.   For credibility I've eaten sushi my entire life, everywhere from Cali to NYC to Tokyo . I believe I can distinguish between the different levels of superb sushi grade fish.   - Fish Quality     I ordered the dinner sashimi platter ($21), 2 orders of the spanish mackeral nigiri($11), 1 order of the giant clam nigiri ($11).               *The sashimi was average, and the tuna had a distinct "fishy" smell to it. The portions were of average size, and the layout was aesthetically pleasing. The Spanish Mackeral was OUT OF THIS WORLD GOOD! I highly recommend it, albeit the cuts are small, the fish is delicious. The giant clam was overpriced based on its size and freshness.   - Rice Quality     This is pretty hard to mess up. The rice is perfectly balanced as it should be. The fish to rice ratio was good.   I went into this restaurant with high expectations, first from the high reviews on Yelp, and second upon entering the restaurant you are overwhelmed by an abundance of Japanese celebrity pictures plastered all throughout the entrance. They are all somehow affiliated with the restaurant/owner. The pictures suggest that these Japanese celebrities have eaten at this restaurant and give their thumb of approval.   3 stars because this restaurant, in regards to nigiri and sashimi, were just average. The problem with sushi reviews on Yelp is that you get a lot of yelpers reviewing based on rolls and sake bombs. It's sad but true that so many people will judge a restaurant based on how good their rolls are when the true judgment of a sushi restaurant should be in the quality of their nigiri.   I have given up on sushi in Phoenix. From now on I will get my sushi fix elsewhere.

Went here for my birthday dinner and it was quite busy. We managed to find a place by the bar and it was quite charming. We ordered miso soup, Shumai and couple of sushi dishes. All of it was delicious! We ended the meal with the tempura ice cream and god was it yummy! Will definitely be goin back to this place to try out more from the menu.

Absolutely the best sushi and Japanese restaurant in Scottsdale and one of the very few if only that is Japanese owned and operated. All of the Chefs are Japanese and are well trained. The food is fresh and portions are generous. We go at least once a week and never grow tired of the food. You can also order large bottles of Sake which they will keep for you for your next time in. Hiro, Leo, Masa, EJ, Take, Kazu and Steve are fantastic chefs.

My favorite sushi place in town.  We always get the spicy tuna and the crunchy california.    I've never had a bad roll at this place.  The wait staff has never left us waiting for attention - they are all sweethearts.  Everything is priced nicely and they have specials up on the board.    Hiro, the owner, is from Japan and is typically working on the bar - they seem to be having a good time back there, rolling up a storm.  I'd recommend reservations for groups of 4 or more.  The place is small and often frequented by Japanese, which has to be a good sign.    Big beers, wine and saki are there to wash it all down.  The green iced tea is recommended as well.
The best sushi in town. Ate in the hundreds of sushi restaurants and this is the best one I've ever had nice mom-and-pop feel and the food is amazing.

Hiro, Leo, Masa and Take are fantastic sushi chiefs!! The lady's that work there are the nicest ladies you will ever meet! The sushi is superb. Hiro expects perfection in the raw fish he selects. I have been going here every week or 2 since they opened in 2001!!!  Best in Scottsdale!!!  Peter

Hiro offers good clean sushi in a fun hospitable environment. Hiro has been around for awhile and they make the experience fun for all ages. They always do something special if its your birthday. I wouldn't consider this place to be trendy or modern. The staff has been working there forever and they are extremely friendly. Prices are fair and the sushi is great! Give it a shot. They are usually only open for a couple hours during lunch, and then again form dinner.

I have worked and lived near this place for many years and remember when it first opened. They used to advertise lunch specials and happy hour to get customers in the door and oddly I never heard any comments about it until YELP.  With so many great compliments in Yelp, my hubby and I decided to give it a try.  We ordered the calamari to start and it was very delicately done but not much of it.  They have mackerel but it is called spanish mackerel--it was still very good.  We enjoyed a tasty assortment of sushi that was beautifully presented.   My only gruff is that the sushi crab is the fake Krab, but at least they note it on the menu.

I'm on a hunt for a new sushi place, so I drove 40 minutes to go check this place out.  My review is strictly on their food.   I drove that far, because I trusted Yelp reviews on this place.  What a disappointment it turned out to be...  Yes, they have the abalone,  and otoro which I can't find in many other places in AZ...but that's about it.  Their cut on sashimi is poor, meaning, the sashimi chef's skill is not up to par.  The fish is cut too thin, and is jagged at the edges.  Everything is over priced for what it is.  I've had much better other places such as Gilbert of all places!    I'm all for paying top dollar if what you serve me is top notch!  But this place just isn't worth it!

I've been coming here for 8 years, and I can guarantee this is THE best and MOST authentic sushi you will find in all of Arizona. The family is super friendly. I'm never disappointed by a meal. All of the best to this restaurant.

Fresh sashimi, delicious yakitori and rolls.  We drank a lot of sake, ordered about 4 rolls, several pieces of sashimi and the total came out to $80-90.  Well worth it.  I would def. come back for their sashimi.

What a wonderful sushi restaurant.   If you want trendy, or a place to see and be seen, head further west to Ra or Stingray.   On the other hand,  if you are looking for outstanding quality, fresh fish and attentive service, then this is your (and our) place.  Yes, it is small, but the intimacy always seems to create a special ambiance. Appetizers:  the soft shell crab with a ponzu sauce is incredible.  Last night, one of the specials was Washington oysters on the half shell; plump,  juicy, and not overly briny.  Just fresh and delicious.   All of the sushi & sashimi are recommended.   We always enjoy the negiri Toro roll, eel & cucumber roll, sesame roll, any of the clams, and flying fish roe. Sea urchin may be an acquired taste, but if you enjoy the taste of the sea, please give it a try.  We always end our meal with the tenzaru,  soba noodles with tempura served with a soy based dipping sauce (add scallions, wasabi,  and quail egg).  So, all in all, just a fabulous place.  And you'll be so well taken care of; we'll keep our favorite waitress a secret, but they're all terrific!
This is the kind is sushi place I like. Small and unassuming but oh so good. People were lined up to  get in on a Saturday night. Prices are reasonable and the quality is one of the best in Arizona.

This is the type of place you go when you want good, no-nonsense sushi.  It's not the place you go if you want elaborate sushi rolls or fancy dishes.  I will say my edamame was perfect!  Cooked to perfection and served warm but not hot.  Since I'm more of a sushi rolls and cooked-fish type of person, I don't think I appreciated this place as much as it deserved.  But if you really like raw fish and the simpler sushi dishes, then this is the place for you.

The sashimi was definitely the best part of this meal. Other than that I was not a huge fan of this place. We had difficulty communicating our order and almost everything was incorrect. On top of that the rolls were pretty low quality. I think this place is a bit over rated
Super fresh fish and always packed!  Been coming here for years and am never disappointed, well, only when they run out of King Crab ;(

Once again, I was craving sushi.  I read your reviews, and decided to take the small leap (if there is such a thing) into Hiro Sushi.   We ordered the Rainbow roll, Crazy Roll and Crunchy California Roll.  All were pretty good. Not great (sorry) but good.   The people that work there are darling, nice and attentive.   Maybe I"ve had too much sushi all over the planet,or am too picky (or spoiled with killer sushi?) but this was good,  not great.   Scottsdale peeps, try Dozo...it looks like an old Jack In the Crack from the outside, but inside? Pretty. Most importantly, they have awesome sushi.  Anyone in the Chandler/Awautukee area? Try Sushi Eye (on Warner)...
Hiro sushi is traditional Japanese food. They always have great specials and food yummy. No bad on the pocket book

First of all, don't be put off by the strip mall locale; Hiro is the real deal. Delicious, fresh fish, artfully sushified for me ... light, crispy tempura and tasty teriyaki, generously plated for my husband and my son. Excellent service and reasonable prices rounded out the experience. Highly recommended. Dinner at Hiro will certainly be on the agenda next time we make it back to Scottsdale!
One of the best sushi places in town. It's a tiny place so expect a wait. Always try the chef specials on the board. They are always excellent!

If you want authentic, high quality sushi in the Phoenix area....look no further.  Located in a little strip mall, Hiro Sushi is not flashy, fancy, or trendy...but that's part of why its so great.  It's a tiny restaurant and its always packed, so you will probably have a little bit of a wait if you come during peak hours.  Most of the people that come here are all dedicated Hiro regulars it seems.  Once you try it, it WILL become your go-to sushi joint.  I think its always best to sit at the sushi bar so you can interact with the chefs.  Leo is the man and who I usually wait for, but they are all great guys and all very talented!  As I've said in some of my other sushi restaurant reviews, I'm a stickler for quality and freshness with my sushi.  Hiro has it nailed down here.  If its not fresh, they won't serve it.  I don't know if I can count how many things I've tried here but not a single thing stands out to me that I have ever disliked.  All of the fish melts in your mouth and all the pieces are properly sized and cut.  My recommendation is to just go and have them make you whatever is best.  They always have a sizeable amount of fish specials that they get in, you can never go wrong with one of those.  One highlight is the spanish mackrel....if they have it, order it.  It is prepared fresh, right in front of you...and it is out of this world.

Brand new to this yelp thing so this is my first review...I have traveled to Japan for business multiple times so I know sushi. Traditionally "Americanized" sushi is a whole different fare than anything found in Japan. I like this spot because it's the closest I've found...their food is amazing. Give it a try - you will be back!
Very good sushi, but not my favorite in the valley by any means. I will probably be going back in the future though at some point.

Delicious and fresh! One of the best sushi places I've been to and the best in Scottsdale in my opinion. Hiro typically will be a busy place so prepare with a reservation. If you get a seat at the sushi bar, the chef always has great picks and suggestions! Yum.

This is a real Japanese sushi restaurant...I say this because there are plenty of "fake" sushi places all over.  We were in AZ for few days to house hunt before moving permanently and this place made us feel a little easy about moving from L.A..  *Price = pricey compared to L.A. sushi restaurants *Quality = very good (sweet shrimp was a small) *Service = very good *Atmosphere = bright and cheerful

I wholeheartedly agree with the other reviews declaring this the best sushi in town.  We had a former sushi chef dining with us and he declared it "the real deal."  The freshness is incredible and they have an amazing selection of rare and unusual options.  Service is perfect - plates were cleared quickly without us feeling rushed.  Our meal hit all the right notes and it's going to be hard to sushi anywhere else.

You can get any fresher than Hiro's in Greater Phoenix! We experienced a treat on Tuesday night when our party dined at Hiro Sushi. Thanks to the tips and recommendations of my Yelp community, we enjoyed a meal that that was better than five stars.  Tip: Make reservations, 5 pm if you can make it. There was a line forming even before the doors opened. Fortunately, we made reservations 3 weeks ago.  Even though they were extremely busy, my guests and I never felt rushed.  Now for the nosh: The hamachi or yellowtail and salmon grilled cheeks (kama) were fantastic. Flavorful and smoky from the habachi grill, the fish was tender and succulent.  We enjoyed 2 orders of spider roll (softshell crab). We also had shrimp tempura roll and a Vegas Roll.   One of the highlights of our meal was the beef teriyaki which was a steak seasoned and grilled to perfection. Everyone enjoyed a bite. It comes with rice, a cucumber salad and a delicious seaweed based salad.  We also enjoyed fresh sashimi (raw sliced fish). We had otoro (tuna belly), salmon belly (not on the menu but served up when we asked for it), and surf clam.  I thoroughly enjoyed the monkfish liver pate. It was creamy and tasty, rich with fish oils.  We were way too full for dessert. It was a fabulous evening of feasting!
Wish I was capable of saying something bad but I can't!  Best sushi.  Now please make room for me at bar...

Big selection of ingredients, including all of the usuals, plus types of tuna, quail egg, and sea urchin. The staff seems large for such a small space. Servers are fast and attentive, and almost all Japanese. Great place for a date or a business meeting. You quickly forget you're in a strip mall!

I wish I had a bigger stomach so I could eat more of this amazing sushi! I'm so surprised by how fresh, and delicious, it all is!  Definitely try the Arizona roll - very unique. And the Spicy Ribbon roll. The tuna and salmon are so, so fresh.

I'll preface this review in saying that I tend to like a mix of both authentic Japanese and a little bit of Americanized cuisine as well - but when it comes to the authentic end, I'm very picky.  I went here a little over a week ago with my uncle and aunt who are both from Japan (born and raised) and they were very impressed as well by the quality of the food and service.  We ordered a couple of apps, sushi, and entres which was more than enough food for the three of us.  The fish was very fresh, tempura was light and crispy and everything was well balanced and prepared properly.  I love their hand rolls and the cuts of fish are generous and absolutely delectable! I swear... my mouth is watering just thinking about it!  If you're looking for a place with great ambiance or amazing decor, you'll have to move along.  Hiro is modest in design, but what it lacks there it makes up for in quality and integrity of the food and service.  This place for sure has the best sushi I've had thus far here in Arizona!  Finding the place was a little on the difficult side since we didn't know exactly where it was and it's located in a strip mall (we drove past it at first).  But it was definitely worth the trip out and I can't wait to come back.  Don't be surprised at their non-extensive menu, but they are accommodating if you're looking to have something specific.  What Hiro does, Hiro does well and are very knowledgeable.  Everything I have tried on their menu is delicious and a wonderful treat! Yumminess for sure!

After three long years of searching for a happening sushi place with great nigiri in Phoenix I have finally found it!  Went there last night for date night and the service and atmosphere could not have been better.  It has a really authentic feel, the chefs speak japanese amongst themselves, and they are lively to watch which makes sitting at the bar a great experience.  The fish is very fresh and the pieces (nigiri) are both generous and delicate.  Also, I highly recommend trying the ikura nigiri (salmon roe) with a quail egg. We are definitely going back.  So, why not five stars?  We ordered some friend butter fish and some fried mackerel and they both came out a little to dry and oily, but the sushi was excellent.

Came here for dinner last night just because I craved for sushi and not knowing how sushi places taste like here I just decided on this one due to good yelp reviews. Well some of the rolls and sushi we ordered were either a hit or miss..  $4.95 2pc - Salmon Sushi was great - big fatty piece of salmon, hint of wasabi and just the right amount of rice underneath.   $5.50 2pc - Yellowtail Sushi wasn't bad either.   $4.95 2pc - Albacore Sushi - ehh not a big fan of albacore.  $12.95 Spicy Ribbon roll - consist of spicy tuna in the center and topped with salmon and avocado - liked it  $6.95 Spicy Scallop Roll - ehhh not sure I like it as a roll...usually it's the two piece with the seaweed wrapped outside and the scallops are on top. but this one is a full roll and I got tired of the taste by the third bite.   $5.95 Salmon Skin Roll - again this wasn't really good as a roll...better as a hand roll...   Overall the service was great I even tipped an additional four dollars to the sushi chef that served us at the bar and they were constantly clearing out our empty plates. The food on the other hand was just so-so...tasted semi-fresh...not like it's right out of the ocean..lol but going in I didn't expect it to taste like it's right out the ocean after all we are in the desert! This was a relatively small restaurant...it was quite busy though. The prices were pretty high....we ended up eating like $50 something dollars worth of sushi...we don't usually surpass $40 for two in California with the same amount of food and of good fresh quality. But eh I guess it somewhat curbed my sushi craving for the time being.

My first visit to Hiro was a delight! I came in for dinner and sat up at the bar where sushi chef Leo was really friendly and offered up some helpful suggestions.  I started with the $2 miso soup which was not watered down and had some meaningful chunks of tofu in it and was just right to warm me up on this cold AZ day. I ordered the Houston roll and the Crazy roll for my main meal and while I waited I eyed the slabs of fishmeat hungrily.  My Houston Roll was up first - really smooth fatty salmon slices with julienned cucumbers and scallions, an inside out roll. The total effect wasn't especially overwhelming, more of a palate for wasabi and soy sauce. But good quality maki for sure. The Crazy Maki is Leo's favorite I'm told, and I can see why. First of all, I have never had a soy paper roll, that was fun (and pink!).  The Crazy Maki has a tempura shrimp rolled up with spicy tuna, avocado and roe. Most restaurants make the tuna with spicy mayonnaise, but this was mayo free (i'm a mayo-phobe) and ultra silky in texture. the maki is a fattie but because it's rolled in soy paper you can eat it in bites, unlike seaweed rolls which if you try to bite will empty their contents on your shirt and lap while everyone in the restaurant stares at you. so yay for soy paper!   I have one singular criticism: the wasabi was not spicy. i was putting a quarter-sized amount on each sushi piece just to get a tingle - so I ran out quickly and didn't ask for more (what for). Have all my tastebuds died? do they make particularly weak wasabi at Hiro's? I don't know but I'm prepared to do some arduous wasabi studies at Hiro Sushi for the rest of my life.
Great place for sushi....  the service is amazing just like the selection the chef has put together. Get in early, it gets busy quick.

Hiro sushi provides fresh and delicious ingredients to its food. First, the bento box is a great meal if u want to mix in typical Japanese dishes. If you love eel, they have a great number of dishes for you. And of course, the sushi. You can taste the freshness and flavor of the sushi. The sushi chefs cook it to perfection. Also, for drinks, the hot green tea is an excellent choice. Will be coming back.

Thanks to Yelp we found this place while on a business trip.  Who would have thought you could find quality sushi in an authentic atmosphere in the desert?  Pulling up to the restaurant in the strip mall next to a gun shop didn't start so well but as soon as we stepped in and the place was packed we knew we made a good choice.  Great sushi and cold beer is always a great combo!

I came here because of the Yelp reviews.  I was a single and sat at the sushi bar and the service from both the wait staff and the sushi chef was very good (reason for a 3 star vs 2 star).  The food was average.  Maybe it was because I got some standards (Spicy Tuna roll, Spicy Salmon roll, Eel and avocado roll, and a squid salad). I don't know....the place smelled a little "fishy" and my dinner was reasonable but I have had better and will keep looking.....

Fantastic place if you are looking for authentic, make it in front of you sushi. We sidled up to the bar and watched the chef make sushi, sashimi, and other Japanese delectables. Very outgoing chef with good sense of humor and suggestions. To say we pigged out is an understatement. Everything very reasonably priced. So many options to choose from but we especially liked the crazy roll, sammy roll, crispy spicy tuna roll, California roll and the freshwater eel. Highly recommend this little secret tucked away in an unsuspecting strip mall if you are looking for fresh sushi.

This came highly recommend  from three friends. The service was horrible. It took one hour  and 40 minutes  for lunch. The last order came one hour after the first dish. The server forgot . The sushi was dry . My teriyaki  chicken was so dry. Prices were reasonable.  To top it off .The waitress spilled soup on my shirt and pants and backpack.maybe they had a bad day. We did like the shrimp with potato  wrap

Hiro should be spelled Hero. It was that good. Super fresh. I consider myself a Sushi snob and this was superb. Great food and great price. Truly classic Japanese Sushi place. Great selection of fish and the wait time was reasonable for the quality of this place. Highly recommend a reservation as this place tends to get booked. Have a couple of large beers and some Saki while you wait passes the time really well!
Excellent, authentic sushi restaurant. I loved the atmosphere and engaging with the sushi chef. We will definitely return.

This was our first return visit for years: it is a good place but there are so many to choose from. Friends and I dined from the sushi menu. It is always good and not too spendy by local standards.  My wife had the tempura dinner which included miso soup and seaweed salad as well as battered seafood and vegetables. She couldn't finish it but declared it excellent.  Except for a dramatic water glass upset at the beginning, service was excellent.  We should return more often.

Not much that I can say other than -- this place serves the best sushi I've had in the Valley. The fish is very fresh, the other ingredients top notch, the service impeccable and the space itself very cozy.

My husband and I drove in from Tucson and we were dying for some authentic sushi & that's exactly what we got! Amazing fresh authentic sushi! Great friendly service. We were greeted immediately when we walked in the door & seated at the sushi bar. This is a small spot with about 7 tables. And about 10 seats alongside the sushi bar. They have a variety of rolls for the not so pro sushi eaters and also the real authentic nigiri, sashimi rolls for the true sushi eaters myself! This isn't a fancy spot so if your looking for ambiance over quality than I wouldn't recommend it.

Seriously, this is the freshest best sushi I have tried. When you enter, there is no fishy smell, which means all the fish is FRESH! I love the sushi chefs, fun, funny and accommodating. If it is not on the menu, just ask and you will receive. :-) Make reservations, very buzy!
Great sushi, small cozy restaurant. A little pricey but paying for great quality. Would recommend to anyone in a heart beat.

Fantastic hidden gem. From the outside it looks like a little dentist office, but inside is a traditional sushi restaurant, half actual sushi bar, half sit down restaurant. The sushi chefs are authentic Japanese, and the ingredients are extremely fresh. Rarely have I found a sushi joint this far from the sea that has Ahi that has ZERO fishy smell. They are flexible with adapting if you want a custom roll. One of the chefs even turned a regular ahi sashimi dish in to a rose for me and my girlfriend. The prices are fair and they have several Japanese beers that are delicious. If you are a sushi fan, you owe it to yourself to check this place out. Sit at the sushi bar, its great to watch these guys work.

My favorite sushi in town! And trust me....I get around. To sushi bars, that is.   They have fantastic prices, very friendly staff, and great dessert and drink options.   The downside is the limited space. You'll want to go here earlier on a weekend night if you want to get a table. It's about the size of a master bedroom.   This is what you expect a truly authentic sushi restaurant to look like.

Brilliant!!! Fresh! Sushi!!! I'm not taking about rolls people- i'm talking sushi!!!  You can get good rolls anywhere.  This place is amazing!!  In addition, the selection of nigiri is the best I've seen around here. Also, try the Ankimo -it's delic!! Can't finish this review without telling you about the staff. Friendly, knowledgeable and excellent service even when they Were slammed!
Top notch.  Might only be 4 1/2 stars in LA but far better than I have found  in most American cities.  Order the special catch or have the usual if that is how you roll.  You won't go wrong.
I can't think of a better sushi place I've been to in Az... Tried them tonight for the first time.. A whole in the wall and OMG the best ever! Everything so fresh and delicious!

My favorite sushi spot of ALLLLL TIME.    I usually go here when I'm trying to watch what I eat, which is always, but that's neither here nor there. They always accommodate my absurd requests: Sashimi Dinner, No rice, Double salad, Dressing on the side. I hate myself for that order, but they don't judge, and that makes me happy. The sashimi is amazing. Another reviewer commented on the sushi being cut poorly (jagged edges). I'm no Sushi master, but I did pass first grade, can color in the lines, and cut out shapes. I never noticed these jagged edges, AND I'M A REGULAR (literally considering mercury poisoning just to be the duchess of this place.) One more comment, and then I'll move on, who cares if the edges aren't perfect - the taste is amaze, and that's what really matters, I think.  So things I swear by: Sashimi dinner, obviously. The mushroom special from the specials board... cooked with.... what's it called.. dang it, well they're amazing, and the sauce is amazing. PONZU? I think. Big fan. My mom always orders the tempura, and it's delightful as well.

If you are interested in having the best sushi in valley.  This Japanese owned and operated restaurant is for you.      My mother in law lives in Japan comes back to visit once a year and she always insists on coming to Hiro, because she remembers it as being most similar to sushi in Japan.     In Japan, my inlaws don't actually order food.  They simply let the Sushi chef choose what he feels like feeding us.  If you operate under this principle at Hiro Sushi, prices will augment.
This is the best sushi place I've been to in Arizona, although not comparable to little Tokyo and some other place in LA area. Their Volcano roll (in appetizer) is a must try.
Hiro was great. We got the Hiro roll, the yellowtail jalapeno sashimi, caterpillar roll, and blue fin. Mussel were good but not my favorite.

Son runs terrible business got take out. Went back in to tell them three rolls were missing. Waited forever then they tell me they gave all. One was their $15 diamondback roll. The father would not run the business like this. Great food but do not get takeout. Oh and the teenage HOS test probably did not help the ordering. Hope this turns around or their legacy is going down hill fast.

This week, our sushi quest brought us to Hiro Sushi in Scottsdale.  After last week's debacle, we wanted something that seemed like a more sure bet.  We started with the miso soup, and then ordered pretty much everything that seemed new and/or tasty.  The first dish that was served was our sashimi, which included uni (not the best I've had, but I'm spoiled after having had live sea urchin), toro (this was delicious), and Spanish mackerel (with deep fried bones!).  I am a mackerel fan, and the bones were even better.  I thought about asking if they had any extra Spanish mackerel bones lying around.  Next, we had the ankimo, which was pretty good.  I've had better ankimo, but it was far superior to the ankimo we had at Hana Japanese Eatery over a month ago.  After the ankimo, they brought the dynamite appetizer.  This was a baked scallop, mushroom, and cream dish that was pretty delicious, and a definite hit at our table (though it was inferior to the dynamite I had over a week earlier, which had geoduck in addition to scallops).  We then had the sushi: sea snail, edge of halibut, escolar, and jellyfish.  The halibut was garnished with too much wasabi for my taste, the sea snail was lightly flavored and crunchy, and the escolar was amazing.  (One of my friends pointed out this morning that escolar can cause diarrhea that is orange and oily, and I said, "So, basically like my diarrhea this morning."  I contend that it was worth it.)  The jellyfish was a first for me; it was crunchy with a bit of a spicy flavor (not sure if they seasoned it, or if this is naturally the way jellyfish tastes).  At this point, we decided that we wanted a little more, so we ordered grilled shishitou peppers and salmon roe.  The salmon roe was not the best I have had, but the peppers were pretty tasty (not as good as the ones they have at Roka Akor, however).  Out of curiosity, I asked the waitress if they had any kama, which I did not see on the menu.  She said they had hamachi and salmon kama, which was only $8, so we sprung for the hamachi.  It was tasty and tender, but not as fall-off-the-bone tender or mouth-wateringly delicious as the hamachi kama we had at Sushi on Shea.  Finally, we had the tempura ice cream, which was the best tempura ice cream I have found in Phoenix.  Overall, Hiro seems like a very good sushi bar.  The food is fresh, they have some good special items, and it is actually very reasonably priced.  Unfortunately, it will be hard to go back here with Sushi on Shea being only a few miles down the road.
Had lunch with a friend here one day several months ago and I was very impressed with their daily special including hand rolls.  I will definitely be going back there.

This place is ah-mazing.  It's a family-owned business and they came from LA to Arizona to setup shop.    The sushi is so yummy.  We had Toro and a rainbow roll.  The quality of fish is excellent.  I also had the udon noodle soup which I split with my mom.  It was the perfect accompaniment to a chilly winter day.  You can split it easily, and they bring you the bowls and spoons to do so.  It even has a soft boiled egg in it! Yummy  The menu has more than standard rolls, there are a lot of fusion rolls to choose from!  They also had hot green tea that was so good.  This place is intimate and welcoming, definitely worth becoming a regular at!

tryout this place last night since many yelpers gave it a 5 stars.  unfortunately, this place is no 5 stars to me.  portion was small (the mirugai on the sushi is about 1" by 2/3" on top of the rice ball) & the rice was on the dry side.  ordered 12 pieces of sushi, 1 roll, & an order of sashimi (4 thin pieces).....$115 total for 2 adults & a kid (tax & tips included).  not going back.....:(
Looking for a smaller legit place for good sushi? This is your place.   It's small, not glam and quiet. Thank God :)  We finally have found our neighborhood sushi joint. :)

First sushi place I tried in Scottsdale with my gf.  To be honest I was nervous about the whole sushi in the desert situation.  Luckily I eventually found a few better places but the price and taste combo made Hiro sushi 2 stars easy.

I am ALWAYS on the lookout for fresh authentic sushi and Hiro is it! I enjoy coming her for lunch. They have a great sashimi lunch deal that includes a salad, rice and miso soup. The chefs are mostly from Japan and are friendly to speak with. They always have something new and unusual like snapper carpaccio. My only let down was the rolls. I am thinking this is because they are best at traditional sushi, nigiri and sashimi. It is still worth a try. Just get there early because they will be busy but worth the wait!

I went to dinner with 2 co-workers last night, a Monday night.  We walked in and found out it was our lucky night.  Without a reservation we weren't able to get a table, but there were 3 seats in a row immediately available at the sushi bar.  This place is small, so definitely plan ahead and make reservations.  The service was friendly and prompt. We started with edamame, seaweed salad and a house salad.  Our group of 3 ordered a variety of sushi rolls, nigiri and sashimi.    I tend to stick with rolls primarily, but couldn't resist the tuna (maguro) nigiri my boss ordered.  The fish is so fresh here, I had to try a piece.  He also had the Negi Toro roll (fatty tuna/tuna belly with scallions) which I tried.  It wasn't my personal favorite, but I'm glad I tried it here at Hiro to try the best.  I chose 2 rolls for myself. First, a shrimp tempura roll.  Pretty reliable and not very creative, but I always get it.  This one was a little bland (probably made worse by my no-cucumber request) but they happliy provided a little side of eel sauce when I requested it.  My second roll was the Spicy Ribbon Roll.  I LOVED it.  I will go back for this roll.  The spicy tuna had a great flavor and was a perfect match for the cool, creamy avocado striped on top.  This was by far the highest quality sushi I have had in Phoenix/Scottsdale, and probably anywhere else in the country.  The price was fair and as I expected.  Rolls range from $6.95 to $13.95.  No real specials like happy hour, but I was coming here for an exceptional dinner, not a discounted price and/or experience.

Hiro Sushi is the best Japanese restaurant in Arizona. It's everything you ever want in a sushi restaurant. It is authentic Japanese, prices are reasonable, and the fish is fresh. Forget about all the other fancy, trendy, expensive sushi restaurants in the valley. This is where it's at.  I've had the spicy salmon roll, spicy yellowtail, las vegas and a salmon skin hand roll. The rice is cooked perfectly and as previously mentioned, the fish is always fresh. My boyfriend always orders the chef's choice (Omakase I believe?). For appetizers, I always order the seaweed salad and squid salad. Their calamari is honestly my favorite calamari ever. It is cut into tiny pieces and breaded, and comes in a bowl with green onions and ponzu sauce. Absolutely delicious. You can't go wrong with the hamachi kama as well as one of their potato string wrapped shrimp appetizers.   All of my foodie friends and I always rave about how amazing Hiro Sushi is. If you are a sushi snob like myself, there is absolutely no doubt that Hiro would be your favorite as well.

Since I've relocated from Los Angeles, finding good sushi places has been a task. I took it upon my fellow yelpers to find this place and I was happy that I did. I was planning on going to Ra or Stingray, though I knew it would be mediocre, before finding this place on Yelp.  So we get there day after Christmas with no reservation at around 6:20pm. Why would we need one it shouldn't be that busy, right?  Wow we were wrong. The wait was going to be 50-1 hr for 2 and it was only for the sushi bar. So we decided to wait. (I needed my sushi fix) There was no place to really wait except for outside. There was no bar, the restaurant was small so we couldn't wait inside, and placed in a strip mall with nothing much around.  We walked to a small Mexican cafe located in the same area for some drinks while we waited. (back in 40 mins since there was no other methods of letting us know that our table was ready)  Finally we get seated at the sushi bar. We ordered several pieces of nigiri (toro, sweet raw shrimp with fried shrimp head, scallop, uni, hokkigai) and one maki of spicy yellow tail. That was delicious. Maybe it was because I haven't had sushi in such a long time but everything that I had was pretty tasty. The only thing that I could done without was the salmon collar. It was greasy and had a little gelatinous taste for me on some parts but my husband enjoyed it so that's all that matters.  The severs were great and attentive. Place was cozy and had a warm feel to it and prices weren't too bad. 4 stars for the wait and the so so salmon collar.   I will be back most definitely and maybe it will be 5 stars.

I went to this sushi joint twice. The service is average and both time during lunch. The second time , I ordered omekaze at later part of lunch period. I waited about half hour and the whole ordered came in one plate . First of all, I am used to sushi serve by the chef one at time for omekaze . The other things were missing all the basics , no ginger or wasabi and some of the garnishes for certain pieces that the head chef ( I think was Mr. Hiro himself ) had to put on the pieces . It was quite disappointing for pricey sushi set menu at $110 . The quality was little better than average . I noticed most the clientele at Hiro ordered rolls and not nigiri. So, if you are looking for sushi , look at other as Shinbay

There is a great scene in the movie High Fidelity where John Cusack's character, Rob Gordon is "dying a long slow death" at a dinner party full of pretentious, nouveau riche snobs, including the beautiful Catherine Zeta-Jones. Rob thinks to himself..... "Of course there's envy: why isn't my life like this? Sure I want their money and clothes and jobs and opinions. And I'd like to have advice on jet lag, but that's not it. I mean they're not bad people and I'm not a class warrior, it's something else."   If I were to sit here and attempt to write an educated, articulate and accurate appraisal of how good Hiro's sushi is than I would be just like one of those snobs Rob so despised.  I wish I could tell you how I could taste the freshness of Hiro's tuna, or how the mackerel was served at just the right temperature, but I need to recognize my culinary limitations. I have never lived near the ocean. I have never been to Japan, and until about two years ago all I ever knew of sushi were the ubiquitous "rolls" that we have come to know all too well.   Lately however I have been ordering more sashimi and nigiri trying to learn the nuanced flavors of the fish, rice and combination of the two. I will try to stop dunking everything in soy sauce and wasabi, and whenever possible I will order omakase and let the chef take over.   For the time being I believe that Hiro is a really good place to continue my sushi education. My first visit went well. The restaurant itself certainly passes the eyeball test. Hiro appears to be very authentic. The service was friendly and fast, and the fish portions were very generous. And yes, everything I had tasted wonderful, I just don't yet have the expertise to be able to honestly explain exactly why it was better than other sushi joints around town.
Pretty impressive sushi for being in the middle of the desert. I ordered the kalamari (zesty , tangy and fresh) and the diamondback roll which was to die for. Delicious!! Thanks , yelp .

I've been wanting to try this place for at least a decade, and finally made the drive to try it. Damn, that was the best sushi I have ever had. Yeah, it's a little pricy but that's because you truly get what you pay for. The fish was so fresh and tasty and all the employees were super sweet and attentive. If you're jonesing for some amazingly delicious sushi, do your mouth, stomach, and emotional well-being a favor and eat here.

This IS as good as it gets for sushi in Arizona. Not only is the sushi superbly prepared but the selection of fish has to be the freshest I've tasted here in Arizona. It is one of those "hole in the wall" restaurants that everyone praises about but, it actually deserves the praise. One could easily order nothing but hand rolls and sashimi and be perfectly content, if you want to mix things up, I suggest the Dynamite Clams.

Hiro Sushi has a magical affect on me.  If you close your eyes and relax just a bit, it will transport you to a very special place. You see, Hiro Sushi reminds me so much of those old style Japanese sushi places from the past.    No, it doesn't have a conveyor belt.  Nor does it have any of those fancy, wiz bang modern features that you find in so many Valley sushi places. No huge caldrons of fire keeping watch over it's entrance. LOL  It fact Hiro's entrance is very unassuming. If you driven along 90th Street regularly, you probably past it many times, not realizing it was there.  The California Rolls are delicious, as are the tuna sushi. In fact everything is great. Five Stars. Expect to pay around $25-ish depending how thirsty and hungry you are.   Enjoy!

So me and my boy decided to hit this spot up because I was here like 2 weeks ago and liked it. This place does not disappoint the Tuna here is FRESH and Delicious. This place was crowded on Friday at 7:30 we had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated but it was well worth it. Once seated the food came out fast and was superb, I don't drink but my friend got a beer and said it was well priced. As of today this is my favorite Sushi spot!

Took my 7yrs son who is a big sushi fan but never had Toro before.  Ordered a few nigiri, udon and Toro sashimi.  Great food and excellent service.  Sitting at the sushi counter is a nice treat for my son to watch his sushi being made.  Sushi and Sashimi are the highlights.  Udon has a nice broth.  Price is about $20-40 per person depending on what you ordered.

This is the sushi spot I've been searching for! Fresh fun and fantastic service. Sitting at the sushi bar is key for the experience. Chefs are knowledgeable and entertaining. This is my new sushi go to. Kid friendly.

Came here last Saturday night with my husband. We were told we have to wait about 30 minutes but were seated at the bar within 15. I was so excited to have some good quality, authentic sushi. Our waitress was nice, but definitely rushed. There wasn't a lot of talking let's just say LOL. But that was fine, I was there for the food! I had the chirashi which was so beautiful and tasty. The fish was fresh! I also had the smoked salmon nigiri which was the best I've ever had.... melts in your mouth deliciousness. My husband doesn't like sushi (lame I know) so he had an udon noodle bowl and vegetable tempura which were also good. We washed it all down with Kirin and hot sake. I will definitely return when I want good quality, authentic sushi!! The chefs appear to take great pride in their work, the presentation of the food is a piece of art and it was nice to see the owner there working hard as well :)

Second time eating at the sushi bar and I still think it's the freshest sushi in Arizona. I'm from LA where there is a ton of fresh sushi and this place is surprisingly up to par. Got the omakase tonight and it was amazing!  Got uni sushi and most of the time when I order this it's not fresh and looks gross... Both visits I've ordered this and both times it has been fresh and tastes like the sweet ocean!  Sushi chefs are friendly and attentive. Waitresses are hit or miss. My first visit the waitress refilled my green tea constantly. This time I had to turn around and ask for it to be refilled. Oh well. I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in the area!

First visit tonight.  Was reassured when I saw how packed the place was. A little tucked away place with the most awesome sushi ever!  My family has decided they didn't want to go to any other sushi restaurant but this one. Sushi was fabulous!  My ears perked up when I heard the sushi chefs speaking to each other in Japanese!  I haven't heard that since my childhood in Japan!  Explains why the sushi was so good- it is authentic. Going back tomorrow per family's request!
Excellent service, food was good, prices are descent. Very busy little spot. We sat in front of the chef by the bar area, very interactive and fun. This is a great spot for a first date.

As the first restaurant I've ever visited in AZ, Hiro Sushi knocked it out of the park on the first swing. After a long, exhausting, and morally defeating week of 120-degree weather, I was in need for a real "treat yo self" evening. I strolled into Hiro elated to find an air-conditioned oasis with a lively sushi bar and (most important) cold sake.   I've dined solo at several points in my life; sometimes it's awkward, especially if you're given a table for two with a romantic view. Bellying up to the sushi bar took all of the awkwardness out of eating alone. With the friendly sushi chefs taking orders and providing a little bit of entertainment, I had a great time with my roll ($6), my udon ($13), and my unexpectedly huge bottle of Nigiri sake ($11).   Really friendly service and a full house of patrons (on a Thursday night in my case) made for fun, family-friendly vibes with great food. If I'm staying in the area again, I'll be sure to return!
This place is hands down the best sushi in Scottsdale and it's quiet and the sushi chefs are fun and friendly. Definitely would recommend!

Authentic Japanese sushi place.  Coming from NYC, we have been missing a real Japanese sushi restaurant that doesn't over sauce or over complicate the dishes.  This place hit the spot.  Low key, fresh fish, delicious.  We sat at the sushi bar and had several sushi and sashimi dishes with sake.  So happy there is a great sushi place like this near by.  We look forward to discovering other great Japanese, Chinese, Thai and Korean restaurants in the area.

My husband is Japanese and this is an authentic sushi place, the ambience and lighting its not so bright but it's private, I kind of like it actually... they don't have so many tables so I think this is part of the ambience, the service is very good as you can expect from the Japanese culture, i will totally recommend this place for a date! But make sure to have a reservation in advance.  Of course the food is fresh and tasty and they accommodate if you want something that isn't included on the menu.

The best sushi place I have found in the Valley!  Service was pretty good for a small place.  A lot of the dishes are spicier than you would normally find them elsewhere, which was great!  Prices were reasonable.  I will certainly be back to this delicious place!

Best sushi I have ever had. Consistently good, as fresh as it gets. I travel among the best city in the US for my job in the food business and I would never thought I'd be saying the following: The best sushi ever it's at Hiro Sushi in Scottsdale AZ! Good job Hiro!
Consistently fresh, friendly and delicious! Authentic, true Japanese style. The best sushi in Scottsdale!! But, during high season, be sure to make a reservation.

Just AMAZING.i love ppl who working there. the service is very Japanese style.and I really had good conversation with them they're owners sister and her husband.i came for only here from NM lol and It was worth  ????????????????????????!!??????????????????????????????????????????( ?)

I had a lunch combo, Sushi and Mixed Tempura deal. I think the food is not only fresh but also appealing to my Japanese taste buds. There were two Sushi chefs at Sushi counter, and they are both Japanese. I will definitely eat there again when I am in Scottsdale!

Best of the best.  This is THE sushi place in all of Scottsdale and the surrounding cities in the Phoenix area.  Having lived in Japan, I have tasted the real good sushi and other traditional Japanese dishes like udon, tonkatsu.   The fish is always fresh, some flown in from Japan. On a regular night, Hiro and his sons are behind the counter, making sushi for the customers.  During the cooler months, I like to order the nabeyaki udon and some rolls like toro, caterpillar, rainbow, spicy tuna etc.  The nigiri and sashimi are amazing.  Sometimes, I like to order the bento selection with tempura and tonkatsu as my favorite choices.  The tempura here is just the way it should be, light and crunchy.  Seriously, Hiro Sushi is an oasis in the desert state of Arizona, can't get any better... Totemo oichi desu...  (very delicious)

My husband is a sushi snob and has eaten at some of the best sushi restaurants on the states. So, he has a rather discerning palate when it comes to sashimi.   We found Hiro on Yelp and met up with some friends there for a night out. Immediately we knew we were on the doorsteps of sushi heaven (well, the sushi heaven in AZ) because of all the Japanese celebrity photos on the wall. If Japanese celebrities are eating here, it must be good.   It is was. We ordered a variety of items from the menu including sashimi, rolls, and even a cooked dish. Eat one provided a fabulous experience and left not a single crumb on a dish.  The atmosphere is unsophisticated and quaint, which I enjoy. It's sushi, man. Keep it real. Don't blast your trendy music and distract us with large fish tanks and clean lines.   The service was on par, the chefs top notch and we will  definitely go back time and again.

Let me say this, I usually hate sushi in Arizona. I love it in general but most places are down right disgusting, this place however is a right step in the direction, its what sushi should be. Unlike Ra and stingray, it's very intimate, the servers are knowledgable, the sushi chefs are experienced and by that I mean they have some age to them. I can't imagine an 18 year old making sushi really knows much about each fish in the trendy places. Loved the tuna belly sashimi and sedona roll!
my favorite sushi place in phoenix. tiny place thats hard to find, but the best and most authentic sushi i've had in phoenix. good atmosphere with friendly chefs. descent prices too.

The most beautiful sushi I've eaten in Arizona. This place requires a reservation which I sometimes forget to make, but staff is always kind and seat us. I give it 5 stars for service and 5 stars for food.

Hiro Sushi is my favorite sushi place in Arizona, and I've tried a lot. The food is very authentic Japanese and basically everyone on their staff speaks Japanese. I wish they had brown rice options, but the food is so good I still have to give it 5 stars even without it.

Good sushi place... you will be able to find some unique cuts of tuna that you cant find at most sushi places... the prices are pretty good... you have to try the noodle bowl thing... i guess hiro (th owner)  is famous for this thing... the atmosphere is nothign special... it is in a strip mall with typical sushi decorations... but i would definatly go back if i was in the area...
Sushi was decent but service was painfully slow on what didn't appear to be a particularly busy night. Hopefully will do better next time.

This is hands-down the best sushi place I've ever been to, till date! I've been here at least a dozen times, and this review is certainly long overdue. Everything on their sushi menu is amazing, and the quality of the food is truly top notch. The salmon sashimi simply melts in your mouth, and the Negi Torro (Tuna belly), yellowtail and Uni (Sea Urchin) sashimi/rolls are my other favorites. Yes it's a pricey place, but you gotta believe me when I say it's totally worth it. And the servers are the kindest, humblest and the most mild mannered people ever. Amazing experience every time!

I found a favorite sushi restaurant in AZ!  Their sushi was fresh & the chefs were all Japanese!  One unique roll I had there was the Sukiyaki roll.  Since I was a somewhat regular they'd provide us with 3 types of wasabi which really made the sushi experience.

I had a really nice time at this restaurant and enjoyed my sushi, especially for the lower price. This place is smaller than its counterparts like RA, but the quality of the sushi is just as great.  The setting was very authentic, and the service was AMAZING. Everyone was incredibly friendly and polite.  I recommend the dynamite roll.

As good as it gets.  Went on Wednesday.  Apparently it's the best day for unique fresh fish selection.  Saw things on the sushi menu that I've never had before.  3 lined grunt, Red Sea bream, etc.  always order the eryngii mushroom which are fabulous.  The salmon skin roll is the best on earth.  I'm not super adventurous when it comes to sushi but their mainstays like toro, bluefin, yellowtail are solid.  Will return next Wednesday.

Hiro continues to please as it has for years. The fact that it is consistently packed on mid-week nights speaks to the quality and consistency of the sushi.  No bells and whistles, and still no flaming radish blooms, but Hiro has some of the best sushi around and has proven itself year after year.

For Arizona, I think this is one of the better options around. What makes this place decent is the quality of the sushi and the service. The sushi is not mind blowing amazing, but its not terrible either; perfect for a casual lunch or dinner.

Hiro! My FAVORITE sushi joint in AZ!! The last sushi I had was about two weeks ago in Hawaii so coming back I haven't had the urge to get sushi thinking it just won't be the same. I have always loved this well kept secret and have continued to bring friends who are obsessed! Thank goodness for the X who showed me Hiro. I needed to find a place to get good sushi. I have come here for a few years n have never been disappointed. It's a small restaurant where the sushi chefs don't use gloves because they are so excellent with their knives and watch the handling of everything I trust that this place is not only authentic sushi but very clean. The staff are nice, they have good specials and the food is amazing!!! Please order a calamari for yourself as an appetizer (you won't regret it) :)

Authentic sushi and atmosphere in Scottsdale. Found this place through Yelp. So glad we came here. We came at lunch, they open at 11:30, by 12pm the place was packed. Great service by friendly and knowledgeable servers. So fun watching the sushi chefs prepare our food. This place reminded me of the sushi places we've visited in Kyoto and Tokyo, took me back to great memories! Super fresh fish, not smelly and not fishy. We had the crazy roll, tuna sushi and bento box with gyoza and tempura. All were great. Tempura well done slightly greasy but yummy. Big servings. The spicy tuna in the Crazy Roll was amazing! They don't use mayo just fresh chopped tuna and spicy sauce. I appreciate that. The gyoza in the bento box was full of flavor, juicy meat and pan fried to perfect crispness! Definitely go here! The price is right, the food is on point and it will take you on a trip down memory lane in Japan!

Hiro is probably the best place to get sushi in the Valley area. It is a small, yet high volume restaurant- so if you're going around the 7-8pm-ish times, be sure to make a reservation as sometimes we see groups waiting in the front for decent periods of time.   Their nigiri is really the best in Arizona. I've gone to plenty of sushi spots, and none can compare to the quality of Hiro's nigiri. They serve a great portion of fish with the perfect amount rice to go with it. Their fish is always fresh and always melts in your mouth. Recommendations: yellowtail, salmon, and albacore. I usually don't wander from my comfort zone when it comes to nigiri, but these never disappoint.   Now for the rolls. I know that true sushi really doesn't include rolls, but, hey. How could you go wrong? Their Las Vegas roll is AMAZING. Probably The best I've ever eaten. Crunch on the outside, and warm, smoked delicious salmon on the inside with gooey cream cheese! Yum!  Be sure to try the crazy roll as well! It comes in pink wrapping instead of the traditional green seaweed paper.  The rolls are also a decent size for what you pay for. One Las Vegas ($12.95) roll is enough to fill me for lunch on a regular day!  Their caterpillar rolls and rainbow rolls are also picks that I frequently see when dining there.   The service (and i mean waitresses) is pretty good. Not great, not bad, just good. All they do is pretty much bring you your rolls/nigiri/sashimi whatever and then leave. But nothing to complain about.  The sushi chefs are great though! If you have the opportunity to sit at the sushi bar- do so. Because you can always make conversation with the chefs who know just about everything about the menu and they are funny and polite. They also give the restaurant an authentic Japanese feel because they speak Japanese!   Other recommendations: the sweet and sour cucumber salad. Usually it comes right before the sushi and makes a delicious and light appetizer! (They also serve teriyaki chicken and things that are more kid friendly, but I have yet to try them!!)
Great little place. All the sushi was good, but the flying fish roe was put together loose and the eggs spilled in my soy sauce :[ but they were still good. Very friendly sushi chefs.

OMG...this place it's amazingly good!  Every pieces of sashimi it's just melt in our mouth. This place is very cozy not fancy but the foods are out of this world.   Besides serving fresh fishes, the chef is very knowledgeable of his products, and the waitresses are outstanding.  Thank you for the delicious meal Hiro Sushi you really deserved the five stars from me! For dinner of two adults and one kid the meal come to $181.42 plus tips.  All of us were stuffed and happy!

Really good sushi! I'm from San Fran, and usually skeptical about eating Sushi in AZ, but this place is the exception. My dad dragged me in and i ended up really enjoying myself. Great service and phenomenal tempura, deff get an order of that with your sushi (same with tempura rolls). Toro rolls and shrimp were both really tasty.Also it looks like they keep the place really clean which is comforting. Definitely will be my sushi spot from now on living in Scottsdale.

Best sushi in the Valley hands down.  Everything was fresh, and if you have the pleasure to have Masa as your chef he knows what he's doing.  Uni with quail egg, toro, maguro, oysters, hamachi, spicy tuna roll, unagi, fresh water eel.   If you want to get in the mood, turn on Netflix, watch Jiro Dreams of Sushi, and then go and eat here.  BE PREPARED TO PAY!  Good sushi is never cheap, but for what you get, I'll gladly pay the price to have a seat at this bar.

delicious.  4.5 stars but I round up since no half stars.   This is our second time visiting Hiro's. The sushi was very good both times and it tastes fresh.  There is a difference in fresh sushi that you can taste.  Now if you think places like RA serves fresh sushi then you don't have a clue,  just trust me.    The prices are decent to a little high compared to other joints but remember you pay for what you get.  I would recommend this place for date.  Sit at the bar if you can.   You may want to make reservation to make sure you have a seat.  We got seated right away but as we were sitting we noticed how a bunch of people kept coming in and people were constantly waiting to be seated.

Amazing as always. My wife and I come get about 3 times a month. Seriously the best sushi in Scottdale.   Tonight we had the amber jack, halibit, salmon, and mackerel sashimi. Airways sport fresh and very very clean.   We also had the veg tempura and the eggplant appetizer. All the best in Scottsdale.   If you have not tried Hiro, I beg you to give it a try if you like wonderful sushi.

I was told this was the best in Scottsdale, I can't confirm but I can say it was excellent!    We were seated at the sushi bar.  The deep fried rolls were not my favorite (I prefer more traditional fresh rolls) but my fianc loved them.    The salmon was extremely fresh, and the cucumber salad was wonderful.  Loved the jazz roll and Houston roll.  Service was 100%, staff was friendly and attentive.   When you walk in, it's a tiny little restaurant with limited seating and a half hour wait , that's how we knew we hit the jackpot.    Worth the wait!!!!

Brought 5 homesick, cafeteria overloaded students here last night and it was fabulous. We had at least 12 rolls including the spider, caterpillar, and sedona, and the sushi was fresh, delicious, and beautifully presented. We also ordered off the menu, and my udon was great. The broth was flavorful and delicate, noodles not overcooked at all. The sushi chef was really quick banging out our orders (I guess we looked hungry!) and I was just very impressed how neatly it was presented AND good too. I guess I have been to too many sloppy sushi restaurants and am a little fed up with so-so efforts. I know that this will become one of our go-to spots whenever we come to Tempe/Scottsdale.

This place is a legit Japanese restaurant.  I was skeptically being in AZ that I would find one.  I walked in and spoke to the chefs right away in Japanese and they spoke right back to me in the same language.  My first test.  Then order some basic nigiri sushi.  It was very good.  The fish was fresh and the selection was fantastic.  The sushi rice was very good also which is the key to good sushi - (my dad is a sushi chef).  I would recommend this restaurant to anybody looking for an authentic Japanese restaurant that also American inspired "rolls".

So I walk into the resturant gluten free soy sauce in tow. (mmmhmm San J, what will I do without you?!?!) We are all instantly greeted with foreign japanese by the many sushi chefs banked across the side at the bar.  We smile and I realize this is as authentic as it gets! (there is a page in the menu that is completely japanese!) My family and I have tried this place before, but we couldn't get in it was so packed and for a Thursday night there was a great showing.   My mother and I end up splitting a couple of rolls and some nigiri and I had some sunamono-it's always my vice. I liked every roll that we ordered, even the philly roll, my mother has a thing for cream cheese. (really not my thing) All the fish was fresh and tasty! My brother and my father ordered miso soup and both decreed that they gave it their approval- we are very picky with out miso! The servers were extremely attentive and brought us whatever we needed.   I felt that this was a great place being the only non asian family dining here. I really like a place that doesn't throw out "HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS" (ending up being old fish) and "artificial krab" (yucckk!) I will gladly spend a little more for fresh real fish and a nice authentic atmosphere without all the fried fake americanized sushi. (fried krab covered with globs of sugary sauce is NOT sushi whatever anyone says)  It's bittersweet that I have finally found a delicious sushi place that I can always go to for a fantastic meal when I am moving out of the state for college next week. Oh well, it will become a delectable treat whenever I come home or if I get really pathetic and need my real sushi fix maybe my mom will ship me some? hint hint :) just kidding.  Fabulous place I will be back very soon!

Best sushi place I've eaten at in the area. I've had Kabuki, Sakana, and Raw and this is by far the most authentic and least "Americanized" sushi place. They even have soba noodles and the appetizers are great (the sauce tastes authentic too). I had the agedashi tofu, fried oyster, mixed tempura, spider roll, and eel&cucumber roll, which were all very good and very filling. I got my order to go and they were really nice about it, packing it so that it didn't lose its taste. Will definitely be coming back!
Excellent sushi and service! Big selection, lots of specials. Neighborhood sushi restaurant that is better than many others in Scottsdale. Only drawback is that it's small & gets crowded easily.

Totally solid. Really. Reason it's not five stars... is the price! IMHO, there are other sushi bars in the PHX area, that are just as fresh and tasty, and not as $$$$ I ended up spending $75 on food and drink, including tax and tip. While it was tasty, it wasn't that tasty.  I can find better for $30.

I've found my favorite sushi place in Arizona! The restaurant is small, but it doesn't lack character. I got an avocado roll and sweet potato tempura roll, both of which were on a secret menu. I was blown away by how fresh the avocado was. The rice was the perfect consistency and flavor as well. The tempura was to die for. I was sad to finish eating it. My boyfriend loved his sushi as well (he got blue fin negi toro and the spicy yellow tail), which he described as "very rich and savory". Needless to say, we will be coming back! I'm so happy to find a place out here in the desert that can meet my vegan sushi needs.
will go back - good sushi - fresh fish!!  Good Sushi !!  - reasonably priced - good lunch spot - they are were packed service was off by 10% (not bad)

From the outside it looks typical Scottsdale strip mall.  But open that door and you will be instantly transported to an awesome Izakaya style restaurant you'd likely find tucked away on one of Tokyo's busy side streets.  While they do have menu items that cater to our Western tastes the experience is far more enriching than what you'd get at average sushi joint.  A specific tip of the hat to their Chirashi.

It is deff a small hole in the wall place but excellent service, food and quick! My mom works at the barber/hair salon at the end of the row and I prefer Hiro to Ajo Al's any day of the week. If I take my mom to lunch it will be here. I have also been in with my kid and they don't seem to mind the mess she makes with the rice and Ikura =) thankfully she is older now O:-) They have great stuff like Toro oh yummmmm not too many places have it!! Thank you seafood sushi god's!!
One of the best sushi places we've been. Service was great, fresh fish and reasonable prices.
Best japanese place in Scottsdale. Great fish, wonderful staff and good traditional japanese food! My family and I go here all the time:)

It's was okay. I'd like to give it 2.5 stars. I always order the sushi dinner the first time I go to a sushi restaurant, gives me a feel for the sushi chef and the balance of a complete meal. The dressing in the salad was the best thing we ate all night, it would have been better on cucumbers with sesame seeds instead of iceberg. The miso soup needed salt and the tofu was bland and too big. The fish wasn't the freshest, the surf clam was really hard to eat. The nigiri had no wasabi in it and the wasabi that came on the plate was not fresh made and was very mild. And my favorite mackerel was bitter which made me sad. The atmosphere was good, the service was wonderful.  I think I was expecting so much more because of all the incredible reviews and I was not impressed.

I was never very adventurous when it came to food. Even when I was a high school student studying Japanese, I was always too afraid to even try sushi. Thank goodness a woman with a more sophisticated palate than my own came along to show me the error of my ways!  Tucked away in a little shopping center off of 90th in Scottsdale, Hiro is another one of the many great places around town that you'd miss if you weren't actually looking for it...so pay attention!  Hiro Sushi is only open for lunch and dinner. I know...of course it's not open for breakfast...but between lunch and dinner the restaurant actually closes down. So, be sure and pay attention to the hours of operation, as you might miss your opportunity to enjoy awesome place!  Having been to a few different sushi places to date, I would have to say that that Hiro is my favorite. At some places, they have a conveyor belt that brings different dishes around for you to enjoy. Although I do enjoy those places as well, Hiro has a more traditional Japanese feel to it. It's more authentic than gimmicky.   Since we were with our daughter, we ended up sitting at a table. While we were waiting for our food, I noticed that there was a sushi bar where you could sit and see all of the different foods. I also noticed that the sushi chefs were very chatty and involved with the patrons seated in front of them. Next time, I think we'll find a sitter for a little while...THAT would be the full Japanese experience.  The menu itself is pretty extensive. They have "Fill-in-the-Blank" Rolls of all different types. So, if you're a veteran to the different styles of sushi or if you're a rookie who is looking to safely expand their horizons a little bit, the menu will undoubtedly have something you'll enjoy.  The location itself is actually kind of small inside. The tables are pretty close together, so if you happen to be there while other people are eating, it's almost as if you were having lunch/dinner with them. That's the only negative thing I could find about this place, because the food and the service were awesome!

I saw all the 5-star ratings so decided to check this place out.  I had a non-sushi combo dinner.  Teriaki chicken and fried oysters were the main courses.  The chicken was dry and the teriaki sause was sparingly added and not tasty.  My wife had several nigiri sushi selections and we found those to be very good.  We have been regular sushi eaters for over 20 years and came from the San Francisco Bay Area 2 years ago so we know good Japanese food when we see it.  This food is slightly over-priced.  The service was very good.  The wait for the food was a little longer than I would have liked.  This place is average and probably not worth waiting 30 minutes to be seated.
This is the best Sushi I ever had in Phoenix. They have very fresh fish. If you like Sashimi , you would love this place!

Delicious sushi for dine in or take out! Staff is courteous and helpful, food is fresh. Best sushi I've had in Scottsdale!  The restaurant is dark from the outside, when we first approached my party couldn't tell if Hiro was open or not. Once inside though, we were happily greeted by framed awards and pictures of baseball players (go Giants!) eating there.  A new favorite :)
Last min drop in, we were seated at the bar after a very short wait even though they were packed. The food was delicious and fast.

Definitely a cool place to hang with great food. After reading the yelp reviews, my husband and I made the trek to this establishment. I must say, we were not disappointed with anything. Fast, clean, friendly, fresh service and food.   I give it a four only because the sushi menu was very small and limited. However, the portions and items we chose were mouth watering delicious.   I love sushi and there isnt much I havent tried. The customers next to us had a lot of questions and I helped recommend a few items to them, which they loved.   I decided to finally try mochi and had the green tea and mango flavors. It literally made me smile and giggle it was so good. I know we will be back!!!   I suggest sushi lovers and newbies check it out. I also suggest you order the butterfish. The presentation is a lot fun.
So good !   Chirashi bowl is fresh and vibrant.  Nice fun atmosphere.   Sort of a strip mall feel outside but pleasantly surprised

Showed up on a Sunday evening around 5:45pm to have dinner. Needed a table for 4 and was told they wouldn't be able to accommodate us because they were booked with reservations for the night. (I had called 15 mins before to make sure they were open that evening before we drove over and was not told we needed a reservation). Decided to just order food to go because we had 2 hungry kids with us that needed to have dinner. On the way out after our food was ready, a group of 5 showed up, said they had no reservations, and were seated immediately. Apparently, this restaurant discriminates against guests with children. So, beware that if you show up with kids, you might be denied seating. Very sad and upsetting.

I ordered the lunch special here and Okinawan Soba.  The spicy tuna and salmon hand rolls were very good.  The taste just takes you to another world.  The salmon skin hand rolls smelled fishy and tasted fishy on a few bites but then again, this is my first time eating salmon skin so I have no reference point.  Don't care to eat it again.  The lunch special came with miso soup and ginger salad, all of which were ordinary.  The waitress was not personable but helpful.  The sushi chefs were very nice and friendly.  The soba was very mediocre.  I'm used to going to Udon Soup Houses in New York City's Chinatown where they only make that so the soba here tastes like McDonald's version of soba.  I'm sure for Phoenix area, it is decent.  lol.  Won't be eating that again.  Once you eat at a Udon restaurant where they make the Udon fresh in front of your face, you can no longer this type of soup.    Overall I gave it 4 stars because the sushi was very good.  However this is Arizona after all so don't expect too much for other types of food.  lol.

Hiro's is a real find - an unpretentious restaurant with an intimate feel and really good sushi.  It's also surprisingly inexpensive (though sushi costs can add up fast).  There is often a substantial wait - I had a 15-minute wait at 8:30 on a weeknight, attesting to it's popularity with those in-the-know.  They have several sushi chefs working simultaneously, and the nigiri and maki start arriving quickly.  My favorite was the unagi, with the maguro and some of the specialty rolls not far behind.  In addition to maki, nigiri and sashimi, the also have other Japanese food available, such as tempura.    This is a real sushi place of the quality you'd find in San Francisco or Seattle, though they make the concession to the local market of calling things by their English names (i.e. Tuna rather than maguro).  The restaurant is a small business (family run?), and it shows - the staff know each other well and have been working together for a long time.    It's a great little place, and I recommend it.

I am sure this is a local favorite and I try to find fun places to go while traveling. This one was a miss. Not a repeat. Tried the crazy roll and the caterpillar roll. The crazy roll had lots of rice and very dry. The caterpillar role was cute but just didn't taste good. Sorry for the poor review.

ordered: - chirashi bowl [$17.95]  pros: - miso soup had some great tofu in it - not a fan of salmon, but it was some of the best ive ever had - nice thick cuts of fish, lots of rice - hearing japanese being spoken by the staff was reassuring  cons: - tamago looked kinda old - pricey, but worth - wish it came with a liiiiiitttttle bit of uni  tldr: - great fish in a relaxed environment - the only people giving this place bad reviews are the type that order california rolls and deep fried cream cheese filled bs
Visiting from out of town and trying this out of other Yelp recommendations. Delicious and fresh! Would come back for sure!

read alot of good reviews. the place is pretty small but there was seating at the sushi bar so we were seated right away. the staff was very friendly and attentive from start to finish.   we shared a sashimi platter (3 tuna, 2 salmon, 2 clams, 2 of something else). it came with a miso soup and an iceberg salad. we also ordered a spicy octopus salad. the octopus was more chewy than i'm use to. the sashimi was all very delicious, fresh tasting, and cut very well. we were pleased with our meal, but it wasn't anything i'd go out of my for. we have a favorite spot closer to our house. but if you're in this area, Hiro Sushi is good.

Oh my god the best sushi I've ever had!! So fresh and it's authentic Japanese sushi made by Japanese people not Korean!!! Try their mirugai and fried oysters to die for. I've been to many sushi spot all over US and it's by far the best I've ever had!! I'll give them 20 stars if I can.  I drive like 30 minutes plus to just eat their sushi. It's kinda far but definitely worth it!!

Yum! Husband and I went here on mother's day. Super fresh fish, delicious rolls. Ate the deep fried soft shell crab as well. Tasty! About 1/2 way through our meal, Steven Seagal sat down with an entourage. Our server was also theirs, and still the service was good. We were greeted by the sushi chefs, and saw that they were talking and joking with each other and the patrons. Great atmosphere.

My coworker and I hit Hiro's for lunch the other day, and I'm so glad I did!   First off, this place isn't what I'd call inexpensive. Be prepared to drop at least $15, just for lunch. But it's worth it!  The vibe is very much like a legit sushi house in the middle of Tokyo, with everyone behind the counter and the main server being Japanese. It's definitely up there in terms of authenticity.  I have to admit, my initial impression was a little eehhhh... As soon as I walked in the door I was hit with a smell that was reminiscent of a fresh fish market. It threw me off, and I was a little worried about the quality of the fish because of it.   I needn't have worried.  The smell abated as soon as I stepped into the restaurant proper, and the seafood was ridiculously fresh. In fact, as we sat at the sushi bar we were able to watch one of the chefs butcher a yellow tail, and I don't think I've seen a fresher fish in Arizona.  As for the food, it was excellent!
