I got a spicy yellow tail roll and a Sesame roll, which is essentially a spider roll with a sesame soy wrapper instead of nori. The yellow tail was fresh and refreshing, with big chunks of avocado (I subbed it for the cucumber). The sesame roll was flavourful, with a ridiculous amount of soft shell crab.   My coworker got the chicken teriaki don and a roll... I don't remember which one. But the portion for the don was more than ample for lunch. Both items were so good, she cleaned both plates.   The service is excellent!  I'll definitely be back to try more of their rolls and their unagi don.

My husband and I are sushi fanatics and have been looking for our new 'spot'. He wanted to take me out for my birthday dinner, so we decided to try something new. HIro got great reviews (thanks as always Yelpers), so we went there. At first we were a bit put off by the strip mall setting, but we walked in to a full restaurant and very friendly staff. Everything from start to finish was fantastic. We ordered the seaweed salad which was labeled on the menu as "best seaweed salad in Arizona"... I'd have to agree. We then proceeded to order the real crab meat california roll, caterpillar, dragon, and crazy roll. All were delicious. And to top it all off, our waitress (who delivered top-notch service) brought an orange carved like Hello Kitty (very well done) for my birthday dessert. Hiro Sushi does a wonderful job and I can safely say we have found our new sushi spot.

Would have given it 3.5 stars if that was an option.  Not average, but not great either.  The portions were slightly above average.  The edamame (sp?) was very good, the service was excellent.  The sushi was good.  Definitely not the best we've had in town, probably not even in the top 10, but in the top 20.  There are at least 7 closer to our house with better sushi, so it is doubtful we would go back, unless we were in the neighborhood, and then the food was good enough to return.

Tried this place for the first time per recommendation to go. The atmosphere was cool!  The sushi tasted great! My only negative comment was that my friend had an upset stomach later that night and I woke up the next morning with a terrible upset stomach :-(
Paid a visit after a long research of reviews trying to find the best sushi place in Phoenix. Everything on the sashimi platter is very fresh. You really are getting what you are paying for.
A great sushi spot. The sushi was super fresh and this place is definitely one of the better sushi places I've been too.  Staff is very friendly and our sushi chef prepared everything excellently.
Get here early or make a reservation. Smaller space, but not with tables close together. The best Tuna Sashimi in Scottsdale!

Excellent fresh sushi served here.  You won't be dissapointed! Tasty potstickers. Large selection of rolls...many that I tried were good!! The service was very attentive. I'll defiantly be returning soon!

If you are a sushi lover, this place will make you happy especially because it caters to both the purists as well as to the wannabes. And I don't mean to use the term wannabe in a derogatory manner. I just wanted to convey that if you like your fish fried they will be able to satisfy your needs. And this is not just tempura. They have fried versions of many non-fried originals.  The menu is quite elaborate and they always feature numerous specials. This evening after being "stood up" for dinner by my son, Omar, who is a mere 6 hours behind schedule driving from LA to Scottsdale, I decided I was going to do sashimi. So I headed straight for Hiro, a place I have always been pleased with.  This evening was no different. I ordered a combination of mackerel, tuna and clam. Mon Dieu! It was heaven. What really accentuated the experience was that, if available, I always ask for freshly grated wasabi. Today I had the pickled wasabi and it was superb.  So I am a happy camper although I would have much preferred to have Omar eating alongside me.

This is my favorite sushi place in all of Arizona.  I have also taken out-of-town visitors and all have been delighted. The food is excellent, the service is great and the place is very cozy and relaxed.
Expensive! 3 rolls and 2 nigiri for $45 is pretty steep. I do have to admit, it was very good though! I placed my order to go and they included plenty of soy sauce, ginger and wasabi.

What a great place this is. I've recently become obsessed with sushi. I used to hate it, now I crave it on a daily basis. I want to eat everything with chopsticks... pizza... hotdogs... soup. whatever.   I was really in the mood for something spicy and I'm totally over the chain "Japanese/sushi" establishments, i really wanted something authentic. Yelp to the rescue!   It was a Friday night at about 8:30 and they were packed, I take that as a good sign. If the food is that good, I don't mind waiting. I was able to use my time to read the menu and decide on my meal.   My seat at the sushi bar was great. The chefs are so animated and alive. They all talk to each other in a funky mix of Japanese and English while they make your meal.   I started with the potstickers and they were delicious. Flavorful and hot and the perfect moistness, tenderness and crispy bottom. Perfect! Loved the scallion soy dipping sauce.  Then i had the Crazy Roll. This is shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, avocado and cucumber. Huge and fresh and great. Could definitely have been way spicier for me, but I guess that's what wasabi is for.   I would definitely come back and try everything else!   One glass of wine, one appetizer and one roll = about $25 with tip. Not bad!

This is my favorite sushi place in Scottsdale. It has been my favorite for more 10 years.  As long as I've been coming here, they have been maintaining their level of food. I am always pleased after my visit.  If fact, I don't think I ever left this restaurant unhappy.  I took people from Japan, California, and you know those who thinks they can't get good sushi in the desert. All the people I took, they were pleased with the qualify of food.  For lunch, my favorite is chirashi. If you want, ask for deluxe chirashi (not on a menu).  They will make the best chirashi you ever had by using the best ingredients they have.  For dinner, I like to order food in Japanese izakaya (tapas) style. We start with different appetizers (including sashimi platter) to share with the group, then order sushi to finish. My favorite appetizer (again not on the menu) is kiwi salmon.  I like everything on the menu but sometimes like to ask them to make something other than what's on the menu.  Don't forget to look for daily special menu on the wall too.  I highly recommend to make reservation for dinner as they get busy even during the week.

Took my daughter there for her birthday.    After reading the reviews, I decided it wise to make reservations.   A wise move on my part.   Even though it was in the middle of the week, the place was packed and people waiting.   I was a bit leery of going there because I assumed (wrongly!) that it would have a lot of the Americanized sushi with all the surprise elements mixed in the makisushi, which I dislike.   If I am going to have nigiri sushi, I want a bite size piece of rice with whatever fish or product I pick put on top.  I ordered the sushi dinner and my daughter ordered sushi ala carte from the sushi menu.   The fish was fresh, definitely.   I can't say any more than that.   I LOVED it!    Presentation is, of course, outstanding, as one would expect.   Ambiance is almost what I've seen in Japanese restaurants in California.    The service was attentive, friendly, and impeccable.  Darn right I would return.   You betcha..

My suggestion, come here for dinner as opposed to lunch. I've been here for both within a two week span and have had a good experience with both but I felt service was a bit quicker even if getting a table might be hard to accomplish.  The atmosphere is more calm even when busy, the food and wait service can be slow due to the high volume of people but the place was packed both times I came so I expected things like that. The food? In comparison with the other 3 places I've been to for sushi here in phoenix it was immaculate. It reminded me enough of Cali for the quality of fish I came back again the next day because I knew I would be leaving soon there after.  The flavor profiles for the food were good, the tempura whether as a side dish or within the rolls was crisp, the salmon was excellent, the quantity to quality ratio was good, aside from having to wait for a check each time for a considerable amount I was quite happy with the results.  So far I've had the negi toro, spicy ribbon, and I believe it was the phoenix or whatever the mixed fish roll was that had multiple types of fish in it that was deep fried. There was also one other roll but the name of it escapes me at this time. The negi toro and spicy ribbon were good, the phoenix not exactly my cup of tea.  All in all, in comparison with the other places I've been here, this place is a jewel. I'll gladly wait to get what I want out of food. If you're in a crunch for time, you shouldn't be going to places you know will be stacked with people anyway. That's just idiotic.

Fabulous Sushi in Arizona... Yes!  You heard it correctly!  Try it out for yourself and they take reservation for the tables, but at the sushi bar you'll have to wait... We waited 40 minutes, but it was worth the time!   Leo was our chef and was on the TOP of his game!!!!   Can't wait to go back the next time we are in Scottsdale!!!!!
This was a disappointment , ordered California roll and was really mediocre not as fresh as it should have been , ordered other rolls with friend , will not be back, Pure is Much better!!!

I'm not sure if we caught them on a bad night or what but I'd have to say this was some of the most disappointing sushi I've had in a very long time. The rolls were sloppily rolled, part of me didn't want to believe a real sushi chef put that together but I was sitting at the bar watching him roll and it was horrific. Nothing about my meal was good besides the Sapporo lol.
Never had a bad meal in all the times I've gone there. Good service. Friendly place. Great sushi

During our stay in Scottsdale, we decided to stop by Hiro Sushi. Based on previous Yelp reviews I thought it was going to be mind blowing. I really wasn't impressed. The sushi is fresh, but the rolls are nothing to brag about. It was just ok.   Service was excellent, but I will not be visiting Hiro again.

Since my original review I've been back to Hiro and have had a plethora of their nigiri. Fresh, well prepared, tasty. If this were - say Seattle - it'd be 3 or possibly 4 stars but here in the valley Hiro is best-of-the-best. When I'm craving sushi this is definitely my go-to.

4.5 in my book.  The fish is beautifully cut, as well as generous in size.  And fresher than I've has in quite a while.  Nigiri was best, the rolls were yummy - Diamondback and Crazy - but not amazing.  But still really solid in technique and flavor.  Seaweed salad was perfectly seasoned, which is hard to find.  Make a reservation or be prepared to wait.  Sushi chefs are quite friendly; perhaps the hostess could take a few tips from them?

First time trying sushi here. The customer service was off the charts. Our waiter was very attentive and considerate. She brought out two bowls for us to share an udon without us having to ask. She and the chef checked in on us periodically. The sushi was amazing. We orderded the blackdiamond special, a grilled mackerel, and nabeyaki udon. Everything tasted great. Overall, highly recommended.   Food: 5/5 Service: 5/5 Price: $$

Sushi in the desert?   That's the question I always get from my out-of-town friends and family... and even my husband rarely eats sushi with me here in AZ.  But, my answer to that question is YES!  Especially if that sushi comes from Hiro.  I recently went to Hiro to celebrate a friend's birthday.  There were four of us and we ordered a variety of salads, rolls, and other menu offerings.  Every single thing we ordered was amazing... and oh so fresh!  Highlights included oysters, salmon sashimi that melted in my mouth, and the Arizona roll.    Service was attentive as well, and when it came time for dessert, the lights went out in the entire restaurant while the staff sang to my friend and brought out orange slices with a candle in it... the perfect sweet (and healthy) ending to a fabulous meal!  I will definitely be returning to Hiro and soon.  Anyone craving sushi? Let me know!

Love this place! It's a great local place with fresh tasting sushi! The sushi chefs all greet you when you sit down. The place is relatively small so keep that in mind for large parties. We have been multiple times and never had a bad experience. It is consistently good and the staff is always nice. Two thumbs up!

We drove 20 mins to try this place. I was craving sushi while we're here in the phoenix/scottsdale area. Overall, I agree this is a good place. Not awesome but good enough. I definitely would come back again next time we're in town.  I didn't like the over salted edamame. Yuck. Cut back the salt please. The tempura udon was too SALTY. I ate the udon and didn't bother with the broth. This is the first place that separated the tempura from the broth. I never understood why they would place the tempura in the broth. It gets all soggy.

The food was good , it not great. The thing that bother me was there open tables and open seats and our party of three waited 45 minutes to be seated. While waiting it had a very unfriendly vibe. Pricing is also fair but not cheap.

This review has been summarized as I personally don't enjoy reading in-depth opinions on restaurants. I've pretty much copied the same format as ZAGAT & Michelin uses.   Ambiance = 3/5 Food = 4/5 Service = 4/5 Cost = 4/5

I can't believe how underwhelmed I was when I initially visited Hiro.  Since that time, it has become one of my favorite restaurants in Arizona.  Besides more "fast food" type options, Hiro is one of our most frequented dining experiences and a constant reservation when we have guests.    One thing that you have to get past, is that it is in a strip mall.  The overall atmosphere when you first arrive leaves a little to be desired.  Once you enter, you are transported to a completely different area.  This does not feel like Arizona (especially Scottsdale) once inside.  It is small and dark and smells like sushi.  Sitting at the sushi bar is a must-do if you are there as a couple.  It is fun to interact with the employees making sushi.    We typically order the salmon skin roll (try it - its awesome!), the veggie roll (also great!), some sort of salmon nigiri, the tofu agedashi (another thing I highly recommend to anyone) and whatever sort of nigiri they recommend to us that night.  We have tried all sorts of non-menu items including fermented soybean rolls (not sure the actual name for that).  If you have any favorites, just ask, they always seem very willing to accommodate people's whims.  I also insist on the moshi before we go.  I'm sure its nothing special in terms of moshi in general, but its a favorite dessert of mine!    One tip - if you are interested in going, you will want a reservation.  If you can't (or don't) get one, you will likely have to wait or you may even get turned away if they have no tables opening up.  You cannot reserve the sushi bar - its first come first served, but its still typically a decent wait as well.  Reservations are definitely recommended and worth it!  If you can't get in, try Andreoli's across the street!

This place is my favorite place for actual nigiri sushi as well as sashimi. The fish is always fresh and they have a great selection, not just your typical tuna, salmon, yellow tail and shrimp. If you're more about diversity than this is the place.
Expensive Chirashi bowl, for not much fish. Chirashi was 21.99, and came with about 5 pieces of fish. It was tasty though.

I was in Mesa for business and was in mood for sushi.  I searched Yelp for a highly recommended sushi restaurant and people highly suggested Hiro.  It was ok I guess if you don't know any better or if you were expecting more like I did. I ordered the more expensive stuff like giant clam, toro, and unagi. I also had a crunchy roll which was only mediocre. The tempura in it was cold and spicy tuna wasnt much or spicy and rice was soft and mushy. The toro tasted very frozen and only ok.  I would search again next time for another place. I will be out there again soon.

I hate to write bad reviews, but today's experience definitely left my party hungry and angry after having a lunch date at Hiro's.  First of all, the few items we tried were pretty good. That is where my original 4 stars went. Try the Crispy Shrimp (fried shrimp wrapped in potatoes), it is delicious and creative. Sashimi and nigiri were all great quality, so I definitely agree with all the positive reviews on the food here. Japanese Snapper sashimi was excellent too!  The reason I have taken away the 2 stars is the absolutely terrible service we received from the sushi chef that was servicing us (whom I am pretty sure was the head sushi chef and likely Hiro's son). We sat at the sushi bar, pretty much facing the chef, but we were never acknowledged, nor greeted. When the plates of items were handed to us, it was not stated what they were, if the chef decided to tell us, it was handed to us like we were a bother. He was EXTREMELY friendly and chatty with the people sitting on the left and right of us.   Not sure why we were singled out to be treated like a bother by the sushi chef. We know the waitress was overworked with the amount of guests today, but the sushi chef would spend 30 minutes chatting up the couple next to us, make special items for them to try, but when he finally made the few items for us, he would hand the plate to us one handed and look away, like no eye contact and not a hint of smile on his face! How rude!   When we asked for fresh grated wasabi, he gave us a giant pile of what appears to me to be a mixture of freshly grated horseradish mixed with wasabi powder. I am sorry, we have eaten at many sushi restaurants, and have had fresh grated wasabi before. That big pile of green stuff sir, was not freshly grated wasabi. If that was, we would have been happy to pay for it. But since it was simply piled on a little plate like it costs nothing, I am pretty sure my assumption was correct. Freshly grated horseradish does not equal freshly grated wasabi. It was like the sushi chef thinks that we have never had real sushi before.   We understand the turnaround of items we ordered were slow to show up due to the non-stop stream of customers coming in. However, we definitely did not feel welcome by the sushi chef at the sushi bar. We went there prepared to drop a few hundred dollars for excellent sushi, but was left with a bad taste in our mouth.  I am sorry, we will never return again, especially if we were such a bother to be served by the one sushi chef there. The great food was ruined by the bad service experience, bad mood does not make good food...

This place has quite the reputation, highly rated on yelp and it's been recommended by many friends, so I HAD to try it.  The wait staff very attentive and lovely. The place is nice and quaint, which I'm a big fan of and the sushi was devine!   So excited to have such awesome sushi only 5mins from my house!
Wow.  A plus.   I went here a long time ago and thought it was good but tonight blew me away.   Super good sushi.  Diamondback roll was awesome.  Only bad thing,. I are too much.

We had a great experience here.  We were suprised to have authentic Japanese sashimi, sushi, and appetizers in Arizona.  The sashimi was fresh.  Really enjoyed the Aji (Spanish Mackerel), Hamachi (Yellow tail), and other fish.  If your in town and love sashimi and sushi, this may be the best choice in the Phoenix, Scottsdale, AZ area.  Enjoy -!

Omg!! Bet sushi in Arizona! I have been to  many many many sushi places here in Arizona and this place is the best ! The fish quality is amazing. Make sure you arrive early for dinner and on weekends because this place gets packed quick! The sushi bar is the best and the chefs are amazing! I went on a Saturday for dinner they open at 5 and we were there by 440 and there was a line then went back on Monday for lunch!!  if you love sushi this is the best place

Had dinner here on Saturday night.  Sat at the sushi bar and didn't have to wait.  The entire staff was warm and welcoming.  Ordered a cold Asahi and told the chef "omakase".  For those that aren't sure what that means, it is a phrase that means "I'll leave it to you".  In other words, I left it up to the chef and put my dinner in his hands.  He did not let me down.  He started me off with ankimo, tempura battered & deep fried squid, and grilled shishito peppers.  The ankimo was delicious, the squid was crispy and hot, and the shishito peppers were a great counter-balance to the richness of the other two dishes.  Next was a platter of sashimi followed by a dish of various nigiri sushi.  All the fish tested fresh and presentation was good.  By this point I was stuffed and couldn't eat another course.  Out came my check and a deep fried shrimp head for "dessert" as my waiter called it.  It was crispy, hot, flavorful and was a nice finishing touch to the very good meal that I just had.  Overall, I was highly satisfied with my meal and will certainly go back.  A lot of places really push those bastardized garbage sushi rolls filled with cream cheese, drenched in sauce, and deep fried to high heaven.  Thank goodness I didn't see a whole lot of that being served here.

in scottsdale? wanna have good sushi? look no further. come on down to hiro! you'll be a hiro to all of your dining company! ;)  service was good. staff were nice and kept apologized often as we waited for a table.  a little kid bumped their head really hard on the wall and without any hesitation a staff went and got a bag of ice to help with any upcoming bumps. that's definitely top notch service.   ordered: *salmon sashmi-tastes fresh!! yum! melts in your mouth. wasn't fishy at all. definitely order! *uni- this did taste fishy so i wasn't a fan of it whatsoever. *hiro roll $13.95- i really liked this roll. it had salmon, white fish, yellowtail, asparagus, imitation crab meat baked with eel sauce.  *baked mussels- not the absolute best that i've had but pretty darn good. this yelper has no complaints. i would recommend this if you are a fan of baked mussels.  *spider roll $9.95 - its the usual deep fried soft shelled crab w/ avocado cucumber and mayo. my husbands coworkers liked it. so i would say get it if you're a fan of the spider roll. you can't go wrong with a classic roll.  *octopus-my husband and his coworkers liked it. they thought it was fresh and tasty. so i would definitely recommend!   tips: *takes reservations *plenty of parking spots shared with other businesses. *located really close to the freeway *hard to spot at night as the lighting is very dimmed at night.  *takes credit card and cash *serves alcohol *staff appears to be authentic japanese.

This spot is right in our neighborhood, but because we have a favorite sushi place nearby, we had never tried it. A friend told us to try it. We were not disappointed!  My husband and I really dislike the "Scottsdale Sushi" experience where women are falling out of their dresses, music is loud and the sushi tastes like it was made last week.....worse yet, the people eating it don't know the difference.  When we walked in the door at Hiro we knew we were in for a treat. A true Sushi room, Hiro is all about the Sushi. No music was playing, the sushi chefs were artists. Sitting at the bar was a joy. Eating in the presence of true Sushi lovers was also a joy. The Sashimi my husband ordered was "the freshest he has tasted" and everything else was amazing. For a little more money, we enjoyed fantasic sushi in a tiny and cozy space with great energy and wonderful service. This will be our spot from now on!

Love Hiro Sushi!  It's my favorite neighborhood sushi spot.  The fish is so fresh and always good.  The people that work there are friendly and it's always a good time.  Sushi can vary quite a lot from place to place and to find one that is consistent and always good is a great thing!  It's become a weekly visit whenever we're in town.

Best sushi I've had in the Phoenix area. Believe me, I have been looking for good sushi here ever since I moved from Dallas to Phoenix three months ago.   What I ordered: - Grilled Mackerel Appetizer (cooked): YUM. If you are like me and love fishy/salty foods, this will hit the spot.  - Fresh Salmon Nigiri (raw): I always order this at sushi restaurants and base the freshness of the salmon on whether I will come back or not. Kinda been disappointed with other restaurants but Hiro Sushi's was excellent.  - Spicy Salmon Roll (raw): Good as usual. - Escolar Nigiri (white tuna- raw): Melts in your mouth good. They put a little bit of pico on top which I am not used to but it works.   For those of you who don't like seafood and are forced to accompany your friends or significant other to sushi, my boyfriend loves the vegetable roll. They actually put an assortment of veggies in this roll, not just cucumbers and carrots.   Other than that, service is helpful and friendly. Prices are a bit high, but if you are looking for quality fish, this place is worth it.

The food is fresh and the service is wonderful , now here come the complaints  We ordered yellowtail sushi I and only received 5 slices. We ordered Saba sushi the slices of fish were noticeably small   The dinner was 80 bucks. I thought the portions should be better. They are suppose to serve exactly the same size...henceforth the consistency feature of the food and all the trouble becoming a sushi chef. If consistency means nothing anyone can do it, right ? Well Hiro did it wrong. We were very disappointed. We can eat anywhere for 50 bucks and get much more food.  I'm always starving so it will be hard to return.
Tasty sushi. Decent service. Good prices. Would recommend.
The best Salmon Bento in town They actually crisp the skin on the salmon, hmmm! Try the real crab California rolls

This is simply the Best Sushi I have ever experienced. My wife and I tried different seasonal specialties like the Matsutaki mush teapot soup, (jaw dropping) to the dynamit oyster which was sublime. I cannot say enough about this place. The outside is lowkey but insidecis paradise!!
Best sushi in Arizona!!! Come here all the time, it's right down the street. Found it on Yelp. I'm from NY and it is right up there with some of the best sushi I've had.
Chicken was good, salad was tasty and the California roll and soup were not enjoyable.  This place wouldn't last in LA. Checked out the sushi in the case and went with a safe option.

My $50 small meal did not turn out well. Sashimi was not fresh and the rolls tasted weird. Let's just say, I had to stop eating the rolls and  I was close to regurgitation. Staff was fine, but the food is not up to par.
Great place! Great service awesome food, fish was fresh and delicious. We eat a lot of sushi in Phoenix and this was one of the best places we have been. Try the oysters!
The best sushi in town! Not cheap but worth it. Making a reservation is almost a must because the place is small and fills up quickly.  Food and service are top notch.
I like this place because their fish is fresh but on more than one occasion, I've had to find another place to eat because the wait was too long.

I agree with another review that I read. This sushi rolls were limited and nothing special. Stick with the sashimi or nigiri. The fish was REALLY fresh, especially the blue fin tuna toro. The fatty slice of fish just melts in your mouth as you bite into it, delicious!! The other downside was the cost of this place, pretty expensive... should be more like $$$

I have lived in Japan for years, very particular about Japanese food. This is the one of the BEST in the Valley. If you love Soba, you should NEVER miss Okinawa Soba in their menu. The soup and ribs are so delicious, plus the special Vodka chilli sauce...every friend I brought there loved it! Their lunch/dinner menu with teriyaki chicken and Tempura is equally fantastic! Although is quite pricy, but the service is great.

This little place is busy!   I tried the Donkatsu appetizer, toro and tuna nigiri, and spider roll. I thought the donkatsu was good, but a little dry and tougher than some others. The toro and tuna portion was a little on the small size as well. I thought the spider roll was great- I loved the cucumber mixed with mayo in the roll. Asahi on draft was the cherry on top.  Service was friendly.

Great Japanese flavors! My husband and I were here for dinner on Sunday and we loved it. Being vegetarian, our choices were limited. Nevertheless, the Vegetable Tempura and Vegetable Sushi Rolls served with the soy and dipping sauce was beyond yummy! Staff was extremely friendly and courteous and service was quick. Great ambience too! We'll surely be making this place a regular!

I approve of this place. Although the food is not phenomenal, this is the best I have found across the valley so far. The food tastes authentic and there are actual Japanese people working. This place is simply at another level compared with the many fake sushi places around.
Hiro Sushi is my favorite sushi restaurant in Phoenix. I am there at least once a week, some time more.  The food is great and well priced and the staff is very friendly.

I'm very sorry fellow yelpers, but the yelp rating on thie place has left  me in quite a quandry.  After moving to the east side of the valley, hubby and I were looking for a new "neighborhood sushi" that was closer than Glendale.  On the positive side,  this place is authentically Japanese.  The sushi selection was just OK on the night that we went.  The fish:rice ratio was right on.  The rolls were not over-stuffed with rice either.  They have a very good selection of sake and authentic appetizers.  More importantly the selections ranged quite a bit in freshness and quality.  Some of the more expensive nigiri pieces were very good, but the $2.95 nigiri menu items were awful such as the eel and the ebi.     In my book, selling old and bad fish is inexcusable at any cost.  Unfortunately, our search for the neighborhood sushi restaurant continues.

My husband said this was the best sushi he's ever had in AZ and that's saying a lot since he is from Hawaii. I only had cooked items due to being pregnant but everything was amazing, nonetheless. Service was top notch- from our waitress to the sushi chefs. We are very excited for them to open one up on the east side in a few months! This will definitely be our go to spot.
Yummy Yummy!!  Always ask them to prepare something off menu, you won't be disappointed! We dine here once a week and have never had a bad meal, the sushi is always fresh and service is outstanding.
Four years of searching for good sushi- this is it!  Not fancy.  Down to earth.  Fresh. Can't wait to go back.

There's that old saying "Don't judge a book by its cover", and in this case, it applies to Hiro's in spades.  Ignore the fact it's in a strip mall, and looks closed from the outside due to the shades being tightly drawn all the time.  Ignore the fact that there are so few tables and the host/hostess at the front can be a little bit terse at times.    Once you get seated, you'll be treated to moutwateringly amazing sushi that rivals some of the best I've had in cities with much more direct access to fresh seafood (Seattle, LA, San francisco).  Everything we ordered was delicious and it was so good, I ended up here for dinner here twice in the same week.  My only hesitation in writing this review is that it will encourage more people to dine here which will make it harder for me to get a table :)

Wow.  I just realized I have never Yelped about Hiro.  Way before Yelp, I reviewed Hiro on some other website, and I think what I wrote ended up on an award displayed on the restaurant's wall for being "best sushi" in Phoenix.  Anyway - About the food...  First and foremost, the fish is flown in DAILY.  Not once a week, not every other day, DAILY.  Ask what is fresh that day, and you are sure to get the freshest fish in town, even on a Sunday!  I love sashimi - no rice, no roll, just raw fish - and Hiro's is the tops.  While they haven't had it in a while, the Striped Jack is my all-time favorite, but give me any sweet, buttery, or somewhat firm fish from Hiro, and I am in heaven.  BTW, don't let the strip-mall location scare you away.  What it does say about this oh-so-awesome sushi bar  is that it is a place to get damned good sushi, not to be seen.  If you want the typical Scottsdale bar scene quasi-japanese restaurants better known for happy hour specials than fish, don't go to Hiro.  If you want the best sushi in the Southwest, take a drive to Hiro.

This hidden gem is the best sushi place in the Phoenix area! It's small and quaint but that's what is so charming about this place. On my first night in Phoenix, I tried the fancy schmancy Roka Akor...let me tell ya, this place trumps Roka Akor. The menu here is simple and very typical of a Japanese sushi restaurant but you can tell that they put so much care and precision into making all of their dishes.   Ordered about 4 rolls between my friend and me (yes, 4 rolls for 2 people!) and we demolished everything. We were VERY full afterwards but were VERY satisfied. The quality of the raw fish is really up there and even the sushi rice is quality sushi rice. I hate overly sauced rolls but Hiro Sushi does a good job of keeping the balance between all the components of making a great sushi roll. Thanks for a great lunch, Hiro!

Amazing. Sit at the sushi bar. Ask the sushi chef to drive. It's incredible. The toro, the snapper and the jumbo clam were out of the world. The toro handroll was maybe the best handroll I've had in my life.

This place gets it right on all levels.  Extremely friendly and attentive staff, knowledgable and enthusiastic sushi chefs, superior grade sashimi, an eclectic variety of specials, and a menu that offers everything from Soba noodles to Chicken Teriyaki.  On our visit, we sampled the following specials:  Jellyfish Sunomono (a jellyfish and cucumber salad.  Jellyfish has virtually the same texture and taste as a seaweed salad) Ankimo or Monkfish Pate: It is essentially a sea foie gras and comes from a fish whose flavor is likened to lobster.  On its own the flavor is lacking, but dipped in a citrus ponzu it is delectable! Agemono Ibodai or Fried Butterfish: Even though the fish is served whole, the tender meat from the belly is cut up, fried individually, and made easy for eating by hand.  For our main course, we asked the sushi chef to create a Sashimi plate for us.  It included:  Kazunoko, or Herring roe.  It was pinkish, firm, and with a rubbery texture and appearance.  It came in a single cohesive mass and so it looked like a piece of sushi, but was crunchy and overall strange. Abura Bouzu or Escolar.  This is not to be confused with white tuna, or pretty much any type of sushi you have ever had.  I have to say that it was the most delectable, soft, creamy, rich fish I have ever had.  Better than a cut of Bluefin Toro!  Bright white in color and quite fatty, this fish is not always easy to find - in fact you will rarely see it on sushi menus due to the high levels of fatty esters.  It is known to cause digestive issues with some individuals, and for that reason has been prohibited in Japan since the 1970s.  I myself had mild cramping later that evening, but I can honestly say it's worth it! Whitefish: Less fatty than salmon.  It certainly has a lighter, smoother flavor - but I prefer more fat and texture in my sushi. Ahi Maguro or Yellowfin Tuna: Beautiful deep red color, soft, meaty texture and clean taste.  Wonderful fish!  With a large bottle of hot Osake Sake, our bill was about $100.  I believe the majority of the cost came from the chef's special sashimi platter, as the average cost of a special was about $8.  This is definitely a place for people who know and love good sushi, and would highly recommend it.  Not only for the quality of its dishes, but the wonderful service.

For once they didn't run out of monkfish liver!!!!! Best quality I've had yet. So rich and buttery. The salmon sashimi here is also like crack. It's better than anywhere else. Tiny little restaurant but I love it.

This is, truly, as good as it gets. And not just in Arizona, but anywhere. As someone from California with access to exceptional sushi any time any place, I can confidently say that Hiro Sushi in Scottsdale AZ is the clear and indisputable best.  The chefs are astoundingly well trained -- Hiro himself trained in Japan for over 25 years. I consider it a kindness that he brought such an art to the desert. Not a single cut is sloppy.  The hard-to-find items can all be found here.  The Hiro website advertises that they do not have "trendy" sushi. While this is true, Hiro and his team do embrace the local culture and incorporate it into their menu through fun local-inspired items like a Diamonback Roll.  Hiro brought culture to Arizona and brought Arizona culture to sushi.  The sushi is not the only amazing dish featured on their menu. All of the soups and entrees are also delicious and authentic.

Best sushi I've ever had!  It's so fresh, it's so melt-in-your mouth delicious, it's pretty much the best sushi I've had the pleasure of trying.  Our party ordered lots of salmon, lots of tuna, and my all time favorite, lots of yellowtail.  We also had a variety of rolls too.  Everything, from the appetizer to the sushi was omnomnom.  The seaweed salad was perfectly seasoned, probably the best I've had.  The fish was generously and perfectly cut.  I'm usually not a fan of tuna, but the tuna was so delicious, I ate lots of it.  Obviously I stuffed myself with salmon and yellowtail nigiri.  I'm pretty sure I gained 20lbs after gobbling up everything.

Just when I thought I would never find good sushi in AZ (and I have really, really tried) I walked into Hiro.  I heard the banter in between the sushi chefs in Japanese and knew I had found what I had been looking for.  Yes!  A REAL Japanese sushi restaurant.  I have been there three times now, and have loved every visit.  It is a place to eat and enjoy the food, not a strangely-lit cocktail lounge pretending to be a sushi bar.  The fish is fresh, the edamame is warm and salty, and the beer is cold.  What else can you ask for?  Thank you Hiro Sushi!

The small little restaurant makes this place totally deceiving. This is actually one of the best sushi joints I have ever been to! Not only do they deliver the food quickly after you order, it's all fresh! And by fresh I mean when my fried avocado roll was delivered to me, it was still piping hot and when I bit into it there was still a crispy crunch to it! Typically, whenever I eat a fried avocado roll at other sushi joints, the roll wouldn't be as hot so that meant the texture of the roll itself wouldn't be as crisp. The cucumber salad has the perfect taste of sour to it while still containing it crunchy texture, probably the best cucumber salad I've ever tried! Not only that, but the staff overall were wonderful and they truly know how to treat their customers well! The secret behind a successful business is through an amazing team that know a thing or two about quality customer service, and this place has got it!

If you're here for lunch, do the lunch combo: mixed tempura and fried oysters!  Sushi is great here is well. The atmosphere is kinda tight and noisy but during lunch hours on weekdays it is to be expected with all the business people who come here for feeding time. The lunch menu is decently priced and the food is great and the service is awesome.

I've been searching for high quality sushi for months, and I finally found it!    Hiro is a smaller, unpretentious establishment with enthusiastic and well-trained sushi chefs. We sat at the sushi bar (we opted for first-available seating)--I loved watching the chefs slice each cut of fish with precision and flawless technique.   Hiro gets my stamp of approval because they actually listened to me when I said I wanted a LOT of ginger. Yes, an entire plate piled high is what I mean by a lot!  Thank you Hiro!  We had edamame (perfectly cooked with just the right amount of salt), the squid salad (the sauce was the perfect compliment to the fish), crazy roll, striped roll, and unagi, tuna and scallop nigri. Each cut of fish was extremely generous and tasted fresh. There was a LOT of rice in the crazy roll, which was good (balanced out the tempura shrimp) and bad (I prefer to fill up on fish, not rice).     Everything is made-to-order, and the chefs hand over the plates with pride; I've been to countless sushi joints where the chefs whip out as much product as they can without giving any care to the quality.  Not at Hiro!  Everything comes together deliciously because of their carefully prepared components.   We finished with the hot green tea--no need for sugar here because of its subtle (not artificial!) sweetness.  My favorite part was the mochi!  They serve the best kind, something I've been searching for since Sushi Den and Izakaya Den (premier sushi restaurants) in Denver. We had the red bean and green tea. Mochi is hard to describe, but its a creamy, perfectly portioned, and refreshing treat!
Fresh great selection very authentic fish place. Jenki's new favorite  in AZ bam!  I will now come here every month  best fresh in AZ!

The BEST of the BEST for sushi in Phoenix! This review is long overdue. I'm been coming here for years. I used to live right down the street and would come 3 times a week. Now I don't get to come as often but the food is AMAZING and so fresh! They Ankimo, Uni, Oysters and all the great things that not every sushi place carriers. All the staff are very attentive and friendly. It's a small place and can fill up quickly. Sit at the sushi bar and say "hi" to Hiro...he's the best there is!
Must go!  Arguably one of the best sushi spots in Phoenix, if not Arizona.  We visit Hiro at least once a month for our sushi fix.

Great sushi. The menu is definitely authentic. This gets them five stars. Service is prompt but not as constant as in most American restaurants. If you need something just look or motion towards the wait staff. This is a good thing in my opinion as I prefer to eat in peace.

My husband and I ate here for dinner.  We arrived right after it opened at 5pm and had to sit at the bar (I'd recommend calling during the lunch hour to reserve a table if you're going for dinner).  The service was a bit slow and not particularly friendly (the sushi chef was nice though).  We ordered the dumplings appetizer, the California roll, Philadelphia roll and shrimp tempura rolls.  I liked everything but the Philadelphia roll wasn't my favorite (my husband liked it).  I'd recommend if you're in the mood for sushi.
Best and freshest sushi in AZ period. Even rivaling many out of state sushi places. Yummy. Small place would recommend reservations.
Some of the best, freshest, and tastiest sushi I've ever had! Friendly staff and a cute setup inside.  Kudos to a great experience!

My favorite sushi spot in Arizona! The fish is always super fresh and they always have multple "catch of the day" and last time I went I got possibly the greatest thing I have ever eaten..Blue Fin toro. This place is a hot spot and they do not take reservations so I suggest gettig there early.

Its good don't get me wrong. I've heard there is a soup to die for but I have yet to enjoy that. The sushi is great but the sushi for what it is I think is highly overpriced. 2 rolls for me for $30 is a tad steep but then again...welcome to Scottsdale. You do get what you pay for.

I eat a lot of sushi, and I'm a snobby bitch about it, so that might translate to the fact that I'm a decent critic of sushi, or just that I'm a snobby bitch. Either way, I attest that Hiro stands out above the sushi fray in Scottsdale where there's a sushi joint for every man, woman & child. If you don't believe me, well... more sushi for me.   Hiro is not a place to be seen. Its about the chow, and to say its old school is like saying Sarah Palin might have had an Alex P Keaton poster on her wall in high school.   The fish is spectacular, the plating is gorgeous, but perhaps most notable is the expertise. I sat in front of Take, one of the four chefs on staff and was mezmerized watching him cut fish. I mean.... I've been to some acclaimed sushi restaurants.. but there is just something when you watch someone who lives this stuff, rather than just someone who's come to it by trade.   On my last visit, there were a number of Japanese businessmen who came in, with their own sake, and sat in front of Hiro himself. This says a lot, and if you experience the same, follow our advice: say to the chef: "we'll have whatever they have".

I went here for the second time. It has been more than 4 years since the first visit. We ordered tons of sushi and sashimi and mixed tempura. Our expectation was pretty high due to its great reviews. The first dish was their special order, snapper sashimi. The snapper was really good and fresh. Then scallop, toro, eel, fatty tuna, tamago, hamachi, yello tail and uni came out. Lot of them, right?.  The rice under the sushi were not so tasty and did not blend well with the sushi. The sushi piece were too thin cut. It was fresh at least. We were pretty disappointed by its overall taste. The mixed tempura were lacking its crispyness and the miso soup was not even hot. Overall, bit disappointed.
Great place.  Had the blue fin tuna, tuna belly, Spanish mackerel ... All of it was great.

This restaurant is a nice find in the Scottsdale area. The seating is pretty tight though, so make sure to get here earlier/later than the typical lunch or dinner rush. We've ordered their bentos and Katsu-don. - Bentos: more like your typical Japanese bento; impressive selection = fried oysters (a unique find). The mixed tempura is actually quite nice and juicy. The shrimp especially is more meat-like and high quality. - Katsu-don: HUGE portion of rice! We had to take the leftovers home. Overall, the dish was very delicious and reminded me of the katsu-don I've tried in Japan. Would recommend for sure!

Authentic Japanese cuisine. Best sushi and sashimi in town, they even have chirashi on the menu and sauteed gobo (burdock root). Sashimi is always fresh, prices are very reasonable. They also have a great lunch special.  I took my four-year-old, who enjoyed the chicken katsu.

Ok first off, the -2 stars is not because of sushi quality. The quality of sushi is very good. Fresh meat & good preparation. The only issue was pricing.   I ordered take out & they didn't list the prices on their website (at least then they didn't). I go to pick it up & it came out to $70 for only 8 piece nigiri & 3 maki rolls. To me, that is too expensive for just "good" sushi. Just list your prices so people know how much their totals will be.
Delicious. Cozy atmosphere. And delightful serving woman. Very legitimately Japanese place. Great place.
Hiro Sushi is the best. They are friendly, clean and the food is for real. No fake sushi here!!  They serve the real thing.

Ehhh (it's okay but nothing mind-blowing).  I tried their Philly roll, Rainbow roll, and Spicy Tuna roll. Little disappointed w/their Spicy tuna - I didn't feel any degree of warmth on those.  In general, I felt that their seafood wasn't the freshest, but I realize that this is challenging as we're in the middle of the Sonoran Desert. Prices were a tad high also.  Best I had was their Seaweed Salad - so yummy! Spices were perfect!  Their ambience was rather sub-par, IMO. You walk in and it's a tiny little waiting room w/chairs that scream that they're from 1988. Additionally, they had a wall of framed photos of past patrons w/their autograph? Hmm - looked very dated and sorta junky/cluttered. Some photos were faded - this makes me scared to eat their food...  They could do a makeover and do like a modern/contemporary and Asian hybrid look.

Some of the worst sushi I've had in Phoenix. I don't get the hype. The people were nice but service was slow. Waste of $22 for lunch. Very dark inside. I'll take nori, sakana or the place in downtown Phoenix with the purple rice instead. I won't be back.

My new favorite sushi restaurant! Hiro Sushi serves high quality authentic Japanese sushi and other fish dishes. If you want to try real Japanese food, I would highly suggest to try here. It is pricey but definitely worth it!   Comparison with other restaurant: Hiro Sushi Vs. Shimogamo  I would like to visit Hiro Sushi. Shimogamo is very good but certain rolls and sushi is just okay. I tried few different dishes from Hiro Sushi such as nigiri, Grilled Miso Black Cod, and other dishes. I was satisfied with all dishes :D
Loved loved loved every bite! Sushi was so fresh it could have been caught today! Great service and some of the best sushi I've had in AZ!

I love this sushi restaurant alot, but the only problem is that it's really, really small. It's almost impossible to walk in and get a table without waiting. We have been here 4 times and have had to wait an hour or gotten take out because they are closed to seating. During the cooler months there's just no way you are getting in here so don't even bother. They do accept reservations but def book WAY ahead to get your preferred date & time. Ok, enough about that, sorry to be a debbie downer there, but you gotta know what to expect. I can't fault this place for it's incredible popularity. The prices are reasonable and the portions are decent. I love that there are always Japanese folks in here dining. That always tells me something....that the place is good and the locals know! I've never sat at the sushi bar but the table service is very attentive and fast. The food as I mentioned is delicious and well worth it. Get hooked on this place during the summer and do take-out during the winter. That's as good as it gets!

We had 9 dishes on the day before the new year eve. This place was packed and it is recommended to make a reservation. All shellfish and fish were so fresh (Abalone, conch, giant clam, snow crab, toro, striped jack, etc). Deep fried pompano and smelt fishes were so tasty, especially with tangy salty sauces. The eggplant with miso was also delicious with the taste of charcoal grilled. We could order more but we were so full. We are really enjoy their food and their sushi bar atmosphere.

I still maintain that a great sushi bar does not have to be near a coast to be fantastic!   Hiro unfortunately is just not all that great. Rice was overcooked and grainy. The variety of fish was ok, the quality was mediocre.   Fish does not have to be caught the same day to be the best tasting.  Ask Any sushi chef and he will tell you that there are certain species that taste better a few days old. So it comes to selection, storage, and cut.     Toro was served so cold it almost felt frozen, a few others were too cold as well.   Tai was not the same premium tai that you Might find at a 5 star sushi bar.   I'm sure there is a great sushi bar in the Phoenix area, but Hiro is not it.

What a gem they have here. The staff were very helpful and attentive, the food was excellent. And they have nato! Can be crowded, so pick your time carefully. Plus people hang around too long and like to watch us wait, don't they? Great sushi, soup, and I got the meat dish which was exceptional.
Best sushi in scottsdale hands down. Really fresh fish. Try the spicy mussels...they're amazing. The only bummer is they don't have a full bar. If they did it would get 5 stars.
Great atmosphere. Sake (sushi) was fresh. Nigiri was cold and top notch.   Rainbow roll was my fav. Exceptional service. Spicy rolls were ground - which I do not prefer, but tasty.

We arrived and it was hardly any cars in the lot so we got kind of concerned. Reluctantly we went in and found it packed out! We ordered 4 rolls and it was so much we couldn't finish it all. The sushi was fresh and had good flavor. I've had better but it was solid.

Wow, not a fan.  Had high expectations.  We ordered the lunch special, 3 hand rolled items, which were conical wraps with too much nori.  The food on the plate, upon arrival, smelled fishy and then the wraps  tasted fishy.  The salmon skin instead of salmon filling was just gross.  It seemed as though leftover, not-so-fresh ends and pieces were ground together and stuffed in the wraps.  On the plus side, the miso soup and small side salad were delicious.  Service was OK until our waitress saw our uneaten food and said something about sloppy instead of asking how the food was.  What???!!!
Good things come in small packages. Five stars for the food, service, and atmosphere.

Overall it's definitely not my favorite sushi place in the whole world. It's small and often feels cramped, the service is spotty (like they're nice but are not very attentive which is somewhat surprising considering how small it is) also its always noisy and the sushi selection isn't as good as it could be butttt it's virtually the only authentic Japanese restaurant in the area that's not terribly americanized. Also the rolls the do serve are good in the sense that the fish tastes good and fresh...I guess I just don't absolutely adore them though because they use this weird soy paper instead of seaweed, they don't offer many dishes with eel which is my favorite,  and they I just wish they utilized more ingredients and sauces to mix it up a bit. So overall not the best place ever but it's authentic, the fish is good quality, and the chefs are always nice so if you want sushi and it has to be in Scottsdale this is a good place to go.

Like all great sushi restaurants they are typically found in a unsuspecting strip malls and Hiro sushi is no exception to this rule. To tell you I love Hiro Sushi would be an understatement... The fish here is beyond fresh, I wasn't a fan of Salmon sashimi until I ate theirs. I swear on my cocker spaniels life that I could sit there and eat my weight in their in salmon sashimi. Sushi chefs were always totally friendly and helpful, and service was always spot on.   I am not a huge roll gal, but their rolls are pretty amazing as well... I highly recommend their Arizona roll.  So if your looking for some great sushi this is your spot!

Some of the best sushi in town, right up there with Yasu, Hana, and the like. Unpretentious (I dare say "bare bones") strip mall spot with about 12 tables and maybe 18 seats at the sushi bar. Not a scottsdale scene at all. Good $10-18 lunch specials that are large and hearty. Sushi prices are about average for the valley. It's always fresh, always high quality, and always delicious. Hiro watches over the show and makes sure all the quality is up to his standards. There's always something rare or unusual on the specials board that other more standard sushi places would never carry (like conch, giant clam, jellyfish, toro, etc). Service is ok, though the servers tend to be a little confused and try to do too many jobs. If you're at the sushi bar just ask your chef and he'll set the servers straight. It can be crowded at night so be sure to call for a reservation if you're more than one or two people. Only complaint I have is that the cooked food from the kitchen doesn't keep up with the quality of the sushi. Cooked food is kind of an afterthought here. They have some standard items but if you're looking for something adventurous or a nice steak this isn't your spot. But if you're feeling sushi, go here for sure.

I have been a customer since the grand opening day in 1998. I am from the NY city area and know what great sushi is.  This is the only place to get good sushi here in AZ.  There are a lot of sushi places,  but this one has Toro (blue-fin tuna) when in season.  Most places out here wont buy it because they cant sell enough of it to make it worthwhile.  All those in the "sushi know" eat at Hiro.  Hiro is from Japan and has brought his local knowledge to our little corner of Scottsdale.  If you have to impress an out of towner, perhaps from California, take them here.  They'll realize you don't have to live on a coast to get fresh fish.  I have never had a bad meal.  Go be impressed, worth the wait.

Made a reservation and arrived on time. Hostess said they were running behind - which is understandable - and we would be seated next. She then proceeded to seat a large party in front of us. Horrible customer service.

The best thing about this place was that my father and I only had to wait 15 minutes on a Friday night to get a spot. We ordered drinks, the wine is way over priced and a poor selection. But why do you go to a sushi place? For sushi of course. The selection was not vast and what we did order was decent at best. Our "volcano" app came after the rest of our meal. I will be checking out other restaurants before I go back here.
Everything is always fresh and yummy! Never a disappointment, you can't go wrong when choosing a sushi restaurant. We'll be back, as always.

Came in with a friend for dinner last night and was very impressed with the warm ambiance! Cute place and very friendly employees. The salmon nigiri was fresh and flavorful, and I HAD to attach a picture of our Caterpillar Roll. Just TRY and tell me that is not the cutest thing you've ever seen!! :) Thank you Hiro for a delicious meal.
i absolutely love this place. super fresh, authentic, delicious, and good service. definitely the best sushi around.
today I went there for dinner. boy, the quality drop significantly. the fish was bad. the rice was bad. after all this time, :( I guess its time to start looking for new sushi place.

A Sushi bar that's all about substance and not flash! Hiro doesn't waste its space with a dark or flashy ambiance. It's a tiny restaurant with its Sushi bar on one side, and around a dozen tables on the other. You won't find the loud music and the Old Town crowd at this place. Instead, you'll find some of the best rolls in Arizona.   We had orders of Spicy Tuna Roll, Spicy Salmon Roll, and asked them to make a Salmon and Avocado Roll (a great call by my girlfriend), and a small bottle of Saki. Hiro has a pretty good selection of Saki, not just the cheapest stuff to heat up for a Bomber. All three rolls may be simple, but with full confidence I can say they were better than all of the more popular Sushi bars.   The staff is also very friendly. As we got up to leave we got a "goodbye" and "Thank you" from the server, all the chefs at the Sushi bar, and the hostess. As much as I enjoy the "scenery" at the flashy Scottsdale Sushi bars. I'm not going complain that I got to enjoy Sushi without them. If you're looking for great rolls, head to Hiro.

Love this place. A must if you are in the Phoenix area. The Spanish mackerel is amazing. Check out the Diamondback roll, so yummy. We love how fresh everything is. One of our top two sushi places in the country!
Great service, great and fresh quality food, and huge portions (dare I say almost too big!). Lots of home made items from the kitchen to perfectly balance the high quality sushi.

Fantastic sashimi, great service, and pretty decently priced for the quality and quantity. It doesn't bring the ritziness or glamour like Ra or Stingray in terms of fancy rolls, environment, or location, but it's definitely one of the best sushi places I've found in Phoenix!

This is the only Sushi restraunt in the Phoenix area that I've eatten at and I see no reason to go anywhere else.  The place is run by Japanese staff and frequented by a large population of Japanese customers.    Just a little shop, simple decor and great food.
In the desert, an unlikely suitor emerges....  The verdict? Best authentic sushi I've had south of the Mason-Dixon Line. 5/7 with rice.

Awesome sushi.  Hiro's has become our go-to sushi restaurant for whenever we come out to AZ during Spring Training.  The sushi chefs were extremely skilled and personable.  I'd highly recommend the bluefin toro, spanish mackerel, striped jack and halibut fin.  The snapper carpaccio was also fantastic.  Thanks again!
Simply excellent on every count...quality, variety, service, portion, vibe...bravo!!!

If you are looking for fresh catch of the day, real authentic Japanese food cooked from real Japanese people, this is the place. Everything is so Japanese, small place and so cozy! Hiro the chef is amazing. They speak just Japanese ;)

Judy? More like Rude-y.   My family and I were so excited to eat here and was ready to walk out the second we were greeted by Judy. She was rude and unfriendly. She barely greeted us. She was in such a rush, didn't care to have any conversation with us, checked on us once and didn't refill our drinks once. She had an attitude when we were ordering and made everyone feel so uncomfortable and rushed, nope unacceptable. Just an unsatisfying experience at this restaurant, there were reviews from yesterday that said the server was rude, he wasn't lying.  Also, it's 18% added gratuity for parties 6 or more.   Did she deserve 18%? Hell to the no. More like 5%.  If you want excellent service & excellent food, do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.  That is all. Cheers!

We liked the food, the variety, We didn't like the wait, or the service, i still give it a 5 because of the variety of fish, I am not about the cooked food or the california rolls , give me some good old sashimi, and variety that is fresh. and I will be there  Too bad you can't get good service with good food.
Finally found a great sushi spot in Arizona. Definitely will come back again. Their vegetable roll was the best. Veggies were so fresh!

Suffered a senior moment today! Did the yelp check and thought this sounds good...the drive was very dejavu and then I discovered why....see previous review! lol .....but to update....the volcano appetizer, sedona roll and Mochi Icecream (which I am becoming addicted to) were all wonderful. Our waitress was also fantastic bringing plenty of their delicious iced tea and keeping the ginger bowl full....a necessity for me. The place was full tonight and I can see why. Question is will I remember?
Good friendly service but several things I tasted seemed stale, especially the fried items. The Vegas roll also tasted very fishy.

I did the Omakase in Scottsdale this week! Good sashimi, and cozy atmosphere. Saki bottles are opened and they serve smaller carafe if you don't have the need for the entire bottle. If you want a better crowd go to the Sushi Roku at the W Hotel on Camelback Rd.

Every time I come back to town I have to go to Hiro Sushi. This restaurant is a gem in North Scottsdale. The sashimi is very fresh and the sushi is outstanding. It's hidden in a strip mall but I can tell you this is some of the best sushi I've had on the west coast price wise.

The atmosphere was great. Authentic Japanese sushi bar. All the sushi chefs spoke Japanese as well as English.   I ordered the hiro roll, Las Vegas roll and one other roll. They were all delicious. The Las Vegas roll was one of the best Vegas rolls I've ever had. Their green tea would taste better sweetened.their miso soup was also delicious.

Came here with my boyfriend for his birthday dinner and we are both completely blown away with the freshness of the sashimi. We ordered 2 salmon sashimi, king crab rolls, toro sashimi, 2 orders of oysters, clam dynamite, nabeyaki udon, and some drinks on top of that. We will definitely make another appearance soon at this little gem.

Wow!! We came here for our 3 year anniversary dinner we are both huge sushi fans, this place blew me out of the water the fish was fresh and had amazing taste. I'm glad we made sure to get a reservation because it was really busy. I will throw this out here if you are in a rush....DONT GO HERE....BUT.. if you have time to sit down and enjoy the company you are with and have and long dinner this is your place. It's and little gem. I do recommend getting an appetizer or getting plates you can share as most plates come one and a time so one person may be eating and yhe other person may not have anything, which if that doesn't bother you than awesome, some people however it might.  Will make sure to come here again!!

All i can say is we loved this place after finding it on yelp - great food and fine service in a relaxed, unself- conscious setting. No pretense at Hiro and that is so refreshing. Next time we are in the Phoenix area we are sure to.come back. Thanks Hiro and company and keep up the great work.

This sushi is the only sushi my Japanese wife and I will eat in Arizona. Hiro is so particular on presentation and quality, everywhere else just falls short. Japanese Business men even know this is the place to go in AZ...   The Okinawa Soba is a MUST TRY!

I met a friend at Hiro Sushi as part of our Phoenix sushi tour, and it was amazing. We only had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated at the sushi bar. It took me about 45 minutes to get there but was definitely worth the hike. We ordered Omakase to leave the selection to the chef, and everything we were served was on point. The sushi and sashimi were fresh, tender, flavorful, delicious. I think the eel was my favorite. The rice was amazing, perfectly vinegared. The staff and chef were friendly and knowledgeable. Will definitely be back.

Sushi.  You either love it or you, well, don't.  And don't think you love it if what you really like is deep fried cream cheese topped with Siracha.  That is not sushi.  Hiro is Sushi.  The location, in a strip mall on 90th street, is decidedly un-sexy.  We've been three three tims this year and I always see the same things: - Actual Japanese guys working the sushi bar - Actual Japanese people eating there - really fresh fish - Friendly staff  The restaurant has an ols school Japanese bistro feel.  The service is friendly and warm.  The sushi is spectacular.  We had salmos, Hamachi, Unagi, and tuna.  All were fresh, melt in your mouth tender and had the kind of flavor you want your sushi to have.  No tadpoles here.  No cloudy dilm.  Just pure, fresh from the ocean goodness.  They have some nice specialty rolls, and we tried a few.  Prices were reasonable.  Rolls average 8-10 bucks a pop.  Nigiri runs 4-7 bucks a pair.    Now, this is one Japanese place where I wat to try the actual food.  The tempura on the shrimp tempura roll is what other batters aspire to be.  Light, crunchy, not greasy.  Like the thought of batter.  I can only imagine what a plate of it would be like.  well, maybe I won't imagine.  Anyway, highly recommended.

One of the best sushi restaurants in the valley. The food is fantastic and I go quite often. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is that they don't serve liquor/cocktails.  Everything else about this place is 5-star!

We stopped by on a Saturday night without reservations and the place was quite busy. Tables seemed to be by reservation only with seating only available at the sushi bar. We were told about 25 minutes wait and were seated in about 20.  Hiro's is rather small and was very busy but we were never rushed out the door. Staff was quite attentive and everyone we encountered was friendly. My wife, who is pregnant had short rib pork soup and seemed to enjoy it greatly. My sister and law and her boyfriend ordered up salmon sashimi and a couple of rolls. I chose the chirashi dinner special.   Overall all the dishes were very good. The rolls looked good, but I couldn't comment on taste. My chirashi was a first for me and it was good, beautifully presented and tasty. I can't speak to pricing as I didn't see the final bill but it was definately good and I'd return when we are back in Scottsdale.

Don't understand what all the clammor is about when I was expecting outrageous sushi  and what I got was very mediocre sushi I suppose it was fresh but it didn't taste great and Ive been eating sushi for 30 years! It was very crowded on a weeknight so maybe Im mssing something but I dont think so! Sorry...

Had dinner the other night. Definitely need to make reservations since the dining area is very small! By 5:30 every seat at sushi bar was taken and only a few tables were open. Service was great. Started with calamari and 2 rolls-salmon skin & crunchy California. Hubby had the udon tempura, son had tempura dinner plate, daughter had the terichicken & chix katsu combo & I had the chix katsu & tempura combo. Everything was delish.
Best Japanese restaurant in town. Very authentic, very fresh! Wouldn't go anywhere else
Actually this place reminds me of Japan, the food tastes good but the staffs need to be more friendly, maybe they are too busy. I would recommend to make an appointment before you go there!
Had chicken katsu and gyota. Every dish was horribly sour tasting.

WoW!     So legit, the real Japanese sushi experience is at Hiro.  Without any special motif or hip Scottsdale decor, it's Japanese and sushi at it's BEST!  Chefs..Japanese, who greeted every person that was walking through the door. It's  pretty small place, like ones found in Japan, and has one of the longest sushi bars I've seen in Arizona.   With daily specials written on the wall including conch (From Florida) in miso to spicy scallop rolls that are sweet and spicy.  The seaweed salad is always a great way to being your meal, Hiro's tempura was crispy and light, and the sushi was very fresh.    It is so hard to find a REAL sushi house and this one that I will be going back again and again!  The service was great all in all from beginning to finish.    We walked in not knowing what to expect, the prices seemed reasonable for sushi and we walked out knowing this hidden gem, is the place to be for sushi !    P.S. First Asian restaurant I've seen in Scottsdale, that I've seen alot of Japanese go to, AWESOME cause I know it must be fresh and good! And it was.

I don't know what happened since the first time we had tried Hiro Sushi. We were in the neighborhood and stopped by for a quick lunch. EJ was not there to our dismay. The waitress that was serving use had a very abrupt manner. We were entertained to try the "Lunch Special": Miso Soup, Salad, 3 Handrolls (spicy salmon, salmon skin, spicy tuna) we also added an order of Uni Sushi. I asked the waitress if the sushi chef could make the Handrolls extra spicy and was immediately cut off to say "no already pre-made. We should have known to cancel the order and go  ala carte. The rolls were just not good, tasted fishy, was a total turn off. To top it off for some reason waitress also crossed out our Uni order as we waited and waited. Maybe it was a bad day, but it will be a while before we go there again.

So as a major sushi fan I had to give this place a try. I am always looking for great sushi with fresh fish and some fun rolls just for kicks. This place was outstanding. I have been twice (once on a weekend and once during the week) and both times the sushi I had was the freshest I've found in the Scottsdale/Phx area in the 27yrs I've lived here. Service was a bit slow both times I was there, but that is easily overlooked as the sushi was so good and the fish was so fresh. I will definitely be back!
We have been going here since they opened and have never been disappointed.,always good service, big smiles from all of the Chefs and the food is delicious every time.

Came here on a Saturday night with my Mom, just on a whim. I live right around the corner from here , and since I love sushi, I figured I had to try it.   Plenty of parking. The restaurant itself is pretty tiny. The first thing the person in the front asked us was if we had a reservation. Now that I have been there, I do highly recommend a reservation for the weekends even if it is just two people!   We luckily got seated pretty quick at a table. There are more seats at the sushi bar than tables.  Our server was very sweet and smiled, which I always appreciate.  My mom and I ordered a few rolls and some sashimi. The rolls were decent. I think you can always tell the quality of a place by the sashimi and the sashimi here was WONDERFUL. I would go here in a heartbeat if I was craving some fresh fish.   I always recommend trying tiny, hidden gem places like this !

We are foodies.  Normally I would say Hiro has the freshest sushi.  I think their quality has went down.  We will not be coming back nor recommending.  There are nicer, cleaner, more fresh places to eat.  When it comes to sushi it has to be fresh.

This is the best sushi restaurant in the Valley, hands-down. It's tiny, though, so get there when they open (or make reservations) for a chance at a seat. Better yet, forget this review so I can have Hiro all to myself!

Wife feel like Japanese and we are in a city we've never been. So she dug around and found this gem. They are not some gigantic over-priced fancy place, but just a friendly little joint that serves good Japanese food. The staff and the chefs are friendly and make customers feel like VIPs. We love the cucumber salad. The acidity is so on point that it is actually sweet. Their fish are fresh, and their rolls, ESPECIALLY the D-Back Roll, are impressive. it has just the right amount of rice and are seasoned just the way it should be. We order the Hamachi Kama, and it was grilled just right. It must have been fresh as they didn't need to down it with salt before grilling, and with a little bit of soy sauce and it tasted perfect. We finished our dinner with deep-fried green tea ice-cream. Now, most places we've been to, we would have ordered a ball of ice-cream rolled in tempura crumbs. That's not the case here. they actually deep fried the ice-cream. Every bite comes with the warmth of the crispy pastry-skin and the coolness of the good green tea ice-cream. LOVED it.

I do not particularly like sushi, however I met friends here tonight. I chose to have the shrimp tempura appetizer and miso soup. Very, very delicious. Most of my friends did have sushi and they all enjoyed their meals. One friend had the fried oyster dinner and she really liked it. A lot of food on her plate!  Another friend actually tried the quail eggs and the octopus!!!  She kind of liked them. I give her an "A" for experimenting. I want to bring my daughter and her boyfriend here because they both love sushi.

If you actually like sushi...like not just tempura'd sauce'd American stuff, then you should try this place.  They have the freshest fish that I've had and the atmosphere is top notch.  When you walk in, its like you walked into a little sushi place in Japan.  I love it here and may I suggest the calamari.  It is nothing like you would expect.  I LOVE Hiro and will continue to go there every time I have a sushi craving!

Delicious! Salmon Nigiri and salmon sashimi flavorful, fresh, and delicious. We also had their special, Diamondback roll, yum. And the baked mussels with special sauce... Let me take a moment of silence.... Yummmmmmm. Good prices too, as we compare to other good sushi places like Nori in mcdowell mtn ranch. Responsive, smiling service. Really liked this place.

This sushi bar was a surprising little find during a trip to Mayo Clinic. It is as authentic as you can get with two Japanese itamae-san preparing beautiful and generous portions of sushi. Looking forward to my next trip.
Months later and still super good. This time I ordered the Nabeyake Udon. Worth every penny. Anything here is totally worth it.

The rolls are quite good.  Sushi and sashimi are pretty good; not terrific.  The staff is very professional.  Our server was very responsive, but I did see other tables waiting a while for their checks.  The food came out at a pretty good pace.  The space is a little cramped.

I'd bookmarked Hiro Sushi forever and finally got to try it out.  I got he chirashi Bowl which was very fresh and pleasing to both the palate and the eye. I watched the chef put together my bowl with extreme precision and care. It was like he was creating a work of art, which is true in a sense!  Hubs got a few rolls which I tried but I liked my bowl better :)  Very traditional Japanese owned and operated restaurant. Definitely recommend reservations, otherwise you might be standing outside for quite a bit.

I came here to have sushi and it came out room temperature when it should have been cold & was not pleasant. Their white rice was mushy. The teriyaki chicken was okay but very salty and the teriyaki sauce tasted like it was soy sauce. The only thing good here was their miso soup. They did have great service as well. But I would not come here again or recommend this place.

My family and I have been regular patrons of this restaurant since before yelp even existed!! The owner, Hiro-san, is the friendliest man ever :)  When I was a little girl he would used to carve me flowers and animals out of carrots in his spare time to keep a bored kid in an adult's dinner party happy and occupied. Now that the restaurant's so successful he has barely any time to make it in and out of the kitchen! But he never fails gives us a huge grin and welcoming wave whenever he sees us.  The staff here is so friendly that when I walk in the doors I always feel at ease.  It's the same feeling as returning home to food and an experience that I KNOW is going to be amazing and satisfying.  Now on to the food...my family and I come to this restaurant AT LEAST once every month.  Since this place is a must-go whenever we have guests visiting, and we've had numerous guests visit us this past month, we have been to HIro's once every week!  Even with all the frequent dining at this restaurant for so many years, we're never tired of it because it is JUST THAT GOOD.  The food is authentic (as I already knew but again confirmed by my visiting friends from Japan) and the quality very fresh.  The following is a list of our favorites:  - miso soup- no explanation necessary :) - spicy tuna roll - catepillar roll- ADORABLE looking and everyone whose had it swears it's delicious.  I believe them but I don't eat eel so I've never tried it. - toro- excellent quality!! - hiyayakko- cold tofu with bonito flakes paired with scallions and ginger.  Pour some soy sauce over it and you have a light, healthy, but tasty appetizer. - nasumiso- miso glazed eggplants. You can't go wrong with this one, trust me. - hamachi kama- yellowtail collar.  The meat is so tender and the sauce they have with it totally makes the dish.  Be sure to squeeze some lemon on it as well! - dynamite- a seafood mix baked in a special sauce.  This is a dish you won't see elsewhere.  It's very rich but also very unique. - halibut carpaccio- raw sliced halibut with sliced scallions and tomatoes.  They pour hot oil over it to half-cook it.  Kind of Italian-Japanese fusion, and very creative! - zaru soba- authentic Japanese soba noodles. Refreshing and perfect for a hot summer day. - green tea ice cream- if you're feeling up to desert, definitely give this a try.  Green tea is my personal favorite and it's actually hard to find good quality ice cream in that flavor!  Their GT ice cream is definitely NOT the cheap gross ones I've unfortunately purchased once at a supermarket...  That should be enough to get you started!
