There are so many more great dishes I could list but these are the ones we always come back to :)  Branch out and give everything a try! This would be the place to try new things because you can be at ease knowing that anything you order will be of a certain caliber. We tried the sesame roll for the first time yesterday and it was surprising, creative, and delicious.  :)  Hopefully my super long, and way overdue review of this restaurant will convince you to go try it out, or even just try some new dishes!  Now go make your reservation...I promise you won't be disappointed!!
We had the saikyo yoki, scallops, Houston roll, king crab roll and other items.   All of it was very well prepared and presented.  The atmosphere is very relaxed and the service is excellent.

Hiro!  I've been hearing great things about this place and I finally pulled the plug and dined here.  Let me start by saying if you go during peak dinner hours you'll be waiting a good 30-40 minutes to sit down for a party of 2-3.  They don't have much seating inside, but if you're patient it is worth the wait.  The service was on point from the moment we sat down.  We met Mr. Hiro himself and he actually made our sushi! Very nice guy and very humble.  Everything that we ordered was fresh and delicious.  The oysters, the shishitou peppers, the king crab roll the caterpillar roll & to start a warm bowl of miso soup.  They also have great specials to choose from.  I'm a big sushi fan and this place earns its 5 stars for service, fresh sushi & great atmosphere.

This is a great sushi place.  It is very cozy on the inside but all of their staff was very friendly.  For a random weeknight, they were super packed, only one seat was open as we were leaving.    The spicy tuna was awesome and I highly recommend their Sedona Roll.  We also asked our sushi chef (we sat at the sushi bar) to create a special, and he made an awesome tuna and salmon poke bowl.  Everything was really good.  Great atmosphere overall.  Will definitely be back on my next trip to Phoenix.

Nothing memorable, very plain roll selection. Waited almost 20 minutes to be seated when there were clearly available tables, also overheard a woman in the waiting area with us who had waited over an hour and a half for her togo food when they told her on the phone that it would only take 25 minutes.   Sushi rice was too soft/mushy and all the rolls consist of either eel sauce or shrimp tempura. Not a big variety of rolls and DO NOT GET THE DYNAMITE APPETIZER. it is a waste of $10. It was literally a bowl of baked mayonnaise and tiny scalllops with imitation crab.(crap) Not even anything to dip into the bowl to pick it up with. Were still on the hunt for that WOW sushi in Arizona. It is not here though.  If your looking to "satisfy" a sushi craving, this place will work, if your looking to wow your taste buds and your dining experience...keep searching.

Definitely so-so sushi. I'd rather go down the street to Sakana. I probably won't go back.   We had the Volcano Roll and I've had better. Nobody beats Tokyo Lobby's Volcano Roll.   They don't offer happy hour either.  In the words of Yelp, "Meh, I've experienced better."

This my favorite sushi bar in the Valley of the Sun.  The fish is fresh and sushi is top notch and prepared by actual Japanese sushi chefs!  My only wish is that the restaurant were bigger as it is almost impossible to get a reservation for 4 people same day even mid-week.  The food never disappoints.
Nice experience enhanced with recommendations from some of their regular customers. I'll come back for more!

The best spider roll I have had in any sushi place I have ever been in.  Awesome!  If you're into soft-shell crab rolls like I am, you are always looking for the best.  So far... this one tops the list.  Good balance of ingredients and very fresh.  A must try on your next time out.

The best and most authentic sushi place in Scottsdale! The atmosphere is comfortable and not too upscale, the staff are also very friendly and attentive! The quality of their fish is always top notch and majority of the items I have tried have been to my liking. There were probably only one or two things that didn't suit my tastes but that's understandable since everyone has different tastes.   Some of my favorite dishes here include the calamari, salmon skin rolls, unaju, chicken udon, and the tempura ice cream!

This place has the best sushi I have tasted in awhile. They make some homegrown originals that are the f__king bomb. Try the Arizona Roll that comes with their miso sauce, it's worthy of a death row last meal request. Also the Dynamite Scallops appetizer will blow you away. Service is above average. Only drawback ? they're kicking you out of there at 10 pm on a Friday night, hence the fall to 4 stars....
Great food but beer is too warm and lights are way too bright. I feel like I'm being interrogated. I would give the food 4 1/2 stars but the ambience just ruins it.

I found Hiro Sushi to be excellent. The quality of the fish used was high, and the service was good. I enjoyed the sunomono (cucumber salad) and their mango ice-cream dessert was very good. The Hamachi (yellowtail) was very good, and the portions were generous. The rolls did fall apart a little and could have been packed tithgter but the overall quality was terrific and the price was good.

We eat sushi about 3 times a week- what Im shocked about is, we have only just found Hiro Sushi. It has jumped to our favourite sushi restaurant. The fish was extremely fresh and delicious and not overpriced. A plus, the staff and service are excellent.  A MUST GO if you are looking for top notch sushi in N. Scottsdale.

This was a great find.  We were looking in north Scottsdale for a sushi place that wasn't super high-end, but every place we saw was only 3.5 stars (I need higher than that to go for sushi).    Based on the Yelp reviews, we decided to take the 10 minute dive to Hiro.  Man, are we glad we did!  It's a little hole-in-the wall place in a strip mall that only seats 42 (according to the max occupancy sign) and has the glass on the front door that obscures light, so we didn't even know if it was open.  When we walked in, the tiny waiting area was packed, and we felt like we found a 'hidden gem'.  We got there at 7:30 on a Saturday night and there was about a  1/2 hour wait -- but worth it.    Super-fresh fish.  Many of their daily specials are simply based on what they found that looked good at the fish market that morning.  Pricing was actually a little less than we are used to paying in Our 'go to' spot in Vegas.  Regular rolls around $9-10 and specials rolls around $14-15.  Definitely will return when back in town!

It's OK but certainly not great.  We stopped by on a Saturday night around 8.  It was busy and we sat at the sushi bar.  We ordered a couple of rolls and a half dozen nigiri sushi and everything was alright but nothing beyond that.  The atmosphere is old-school neighborhood Japanese like you used to find in LA's Japanese neighborhoods 20 years ago.  Unpretentious and slightly divey.  Service was friendly and efficient from the waitresses.  The sushi chef never made eye contact or spoke to us even though we were sitting right in front of his workspace for 45 minutes.  Our platter had perhaps 3 pieces of ginger so I asked the sushi chef for more ginger.  I got maybe another tablespoon of ginger - without a word.  Annoying. The sushi was decently made but nothing terribly special.  The rice was a bit loose/wet, the fish quality was very average, with the exception of the hamachi, which was quite good. The fish portions were also a bit small. When we were there,  they were out of uni.   I would stop by if I was in the neighborhood and in the mood for sushi but I wouldn't drive across town for it.  Our bill was $60.00 for two with tip for a moderate amount of sushi, a sake and a beer.  As several other Yelpers have observed, the plethora of 5 star reviews for this joint are baffling to me.  My response would have to be "huh?"  I've been eating sushi for 30 years, been to Japan many times and I know what great sushi is and this isn't even close.  The sushi chef seemed to be mainly making the very non-Japanese rolls (cream cheese, etc.) that are so popular throughout the Valley.  If this is "the best sushi in the Valley" then people in the valley have set the bar a bit too low or else they've never had really good sushi.

AWESOME!  My husband and I lived in Tokyo for a few years, so our standards for sushi are rather high. We tried this place for the first time and immediately stepping in the door, I knew it would be good. From the welcoming "irashai!" from the sushi chefs, to the sound of Japanese banter from behind the sushi bar, and the Japanese customers, this is the real deal. The sushi was fabulous, with many exotic options that are just not found in very many places in Arizona. The sushi and rolls were fresh, pretty, and delicious. This is the best sushi I've eaten in Arizona and we'll be frequenting this neighborhood sushi bar often. I highly, highly recommend.

I've been looking for a Japanese Restaurant in this area and finally found one that our whole family likes. We had the caterpillar and eel and Cucumber rolls. They were really good. They make the caterpillar in the shape of a caterpillar with a caterpillar head. Very cool and creative but even better is the taste.  i had the Teriyaki chicken, my wife had the Teriyaki Chicken and tempura and my daughter had the chicken katsu and tempura. The dinners comes with salad and miso soup. The salad had a salty dressing but the soup was very good. The chicken teriyaki was all white meat and was a little dry but very good. The chicken katsu very good. I tried the tempura and this was very fresh and really good.  I would say to stick with the sushi and tempura. It's the best.  Overall I would say the place is very small and the service was pretty good. Next time we have a sushi craving we'll be back.

I've been going to Hiro Sushi since they opened in the 1990's.  It never fails.  Still one of the top ten Sushi restaurants in the Valley, per the food critics.  As a loyal customer, thank you for years of consistent quality and wonderful service.

We really enjoy sushi and since relocating to AZ have been trying to find "our" place. Search is over. Sushi here is reasonably priced, delicious and taste very fresh (which is key). I luv's me some sushi and this place hits the sushi spot. Due to busy schedules we have only done takeout here and I never order ahead, I order when I get there. However service is pretty fast for takeout and each time we go the place is packed which is a good sign. Will definitely go and actually sit and take in the environment one of these days.
I ordered the unagi and crazy roll and both were great- although the crazy roll was a bit too big to fit in one bite.

Best sushi in town hands down! I am a sushi guru and have been all over.  My dad has worked for a Japanese company all my life. When his clients come into town from Japan this is the only sushi place he'll take them because it's the best in town.   It is a small intimate place that has become a daddy daughter tradition. Him and I get together around Christmas time and splurge ourselves full of sushi and saki. We finish off with green tea ice cream, my absolute fav!!!  Love it, love it, love it! Can't say enough great things about Hiro!!!

The review is not about food. We love their quality sushi rolls. Unfortunately tonight they failed at customer service. I called to make reservations for Friday night for party of 12 and was told they can not accomodate more than 10!!! They can take reservation for 2 tables/6 people each table...Well, its my birthday and obviously I want everyone to sit together and not at 2 separate tables. I understand that it is a small place but I have never heard someone restricting a number of people for a reservation. We are extremely disappointed!!!

-Exquisite Sushi-  You know a sushi place is going to be legit when they serve items like maguro (bluefin), sake (salmon), and otoro but Sushi Hiro goes beyond the scope of what most sushi places in Phoenix serve by offering an array of hard to find goodies. Items like Hirame Engawa (Halibut Muscle), Uni (Sea Urchin), and Amberjack are all on offer here. More importantly is that they treat their dishes right as each nigiri comes with the appropriate brush of glaze like the Anago with its sweet soy based glaze.   The all Japanese chef team here have noticeable especially when you watch their knifework and sushi crafting. No sloppy cuts of fish or clumpy rice here and you can clearly see their talent and deftness with their tools.  Their nigiri and sashimi is excellent but I was pleased to see that they do the traditional fusion dishes that Chinese and Korean sushi owned joints excel at. Caterpillar roll came in at $13 and was topped with loads of avocado and unagi. More impressive was how thinly the chef was able to slice the avocado onto the roll. It seems minor but it changed the texture of the dish and made the avocados one of the best I've had topped on a roll.  Overall, I think Sushi Hiro is one of if not the best sushi places in Phoenix and able to compete with the more established sushi destinations on the West Coast. You simply can't find quality, value, and menu diversity elsewhere in Phoenix.   Having Asahi on Draft is icing on the cake.~

I'm in town for business and looked for yelpers to guide me the way and I was led to the right spot. It's tiny and in a small strip mall. I would've driven past it if it weren't for the great reviews. I had the sushi dinner and it was fresh and tasty. The service was excellent and welcoming. The sushi chef was a cutie too. What more can a girl ask for when she is forced to eat alone!

We love this place! 2 years in a row (annual trip to Phoenix) and the quality and service is fantastic. Love that we were able to make reservations. Sushi quality is excellent - especially the salmon and blue fin tuna.  I think the shrimp tempura roll could use a little help - awkwardly big and too many cucumbers.  The sesame roll (soft shell) was a bit greasy but still tasty.  Our server was so nice.  See you next February!

Stopped in today with a friend as I was craving sushi  and this place is always spot on. I arrived at 5pm to a line already at the front door, but we were able to sit at the bar no problem. We were not acknowledged by our chef. In fact he ignored us the entire time. I am not sure when he prepared my rolls as I did not see him do it. He handed me a plate with very small rolls the kind you see at Chinese buffets. My first thought was wow the quality here has changed in the past year until another couple sat next to me and were acknowledged right away. This couple also ordered two of the same rolls that I too ordered and there's were substantially larger. Now I know from being a sushi fan for a number of years that if you get in good with your chef they will sometimes hook you up with larger portions, free samples, etc. but they were not chums of his. In a nut shell, I felt slighted going to Hiro Sushi today. The food remains good and of substantial quality but I will not return. I will take my money to Shimogamo in Chandler where both the food and customer service rocks!

Decided to try Hiro Sushi because of the  reviews as it is very difficult to find a good sushi restaurant in the valley.  With my husband being half Japanese, lived in Japan & just having visited Tokyo last May for 2 weeks - it takes a lot to win over our palates.    First, this not your typical modern sushi restaurant which translates to social meeting place/lounge for people that want mega rolls with different condiments splattered all over them. They have some, but  if that is what you think sushi is - head to Sapporo or RA.  Second, nothing against non-Japanese sushi chefs as they can be quite talented - but something about having Japanese sushi chefs creating your food that brings some authenticity to the whole experience.  Third, the fish was fresh and was served in good portions.  Its not about bigger is better - quality is what you pay for when it comes to sashimi or nigiri.  Looked over the entree menu - typical mix of tempura, teriyaki & katsu dishes - nothing real special.  Will definitely go back.

I love their sushi - that's 5 stars. I hate, hate, hate their customer service. That one gets 1 star, so I guess 3 stars is where they land.  After waiting on the phone for 10 minutes to place an order and they got it wrong after I waited there to pick it up for 15, I give up - I will not go there again. They didn't even try to make it right after wasting my time. Plenty of good sushi in other places...

I've not had a bad sushi role yet. I also get the Okinwan soba bowl which is quite tasty. Don't forget to go early on the weekends, they are packed. Food is expensive, but most well run sushi places are ;)

Hiro Sushi is amazing and if you're in the East valley or on the East side of Scottsdale you've got to try it.  We we're introduced by friends of our who are living in North Scottsdale and were blown away by the food. A little hole in the wall owned, managed and run by a Japanese family originally from Okinawa...  We sat at the bar and noticed all the fresh fish that is flown in daily. The eel was superb along with the yellowtail and speciality rolls.  We will be going back when we are on that side of town!

I found a new sushi place, and no one has even yelped it yet!  I'm not surprised, it's not in a location that really jumps out at you or catches your eye as you're driving along.  It's in a strip mall of course and the building looks really plain from the outside.  But when you go in, you'll find a cute sushi place that has pretty good food.   They have creative sushi rolls in colored soybean paper (pink, yellow and blue)- I've never seen that before.  And although I'm not very daring when it comes to sushi, I did try a few different ones.  I liked the Jazz roll, which had shrimp, asparagus and some other things, and I thought that one was delish.  I thought the Crazy roll was just okay, and that one has spicy tuna, avocado, fried shrimp and something else in it.  The Arizona roll was pretty tasty too, it has asparagus, cucumber and scallops.    If you like sushi, you should definitely give this place a try.  It's always fun to try somewhere new and the prices are on par with other sushi restaurants I've been to. Just don't rake me over the coals if you go and decide this is the worst sushi ever.  Remember, I'm not a sushi connoisseur!

This is the best Japanese place in Phoenix --- the only actually authentic place that I've been to here!   The sushi and fish quality was the best for around here. Even their tamago was the quality one.   I ordered ahi (7/10), salmon (8/10) & tamago (10/10) nigiri, and a tempura & pork katsu dinner (8.5/10). We also ordered gyoza (10/10 - homemade!!! but only 4 pieces) and fried red bean/azuki ice cream (10/10).  This is definitely my new favorite place in Arizona!!! I've been dying to find an actually GOOD/true Japanese place and this definitely delivered! Will be returning very soon!!

Stopped by again for sushi...actually the best sushi in the valley...by far...really no competition...you have to try here to see the difference...started with Kara Taiba sake...rich full flavored and crispy...amazing!! Had the fried eggplant (eat with rice, sauce is strong) and shrimp tempura appetizer...wow amazing!!! Then had salmon sashimi which is insanely fresh followed by sea bream, albacore, uni, surf clam, but they were out jumbo clam tonight. Perfect dinner as always...there is a reason I genuinely think this is top 5 sushi place in the US...from New York to Chicago to LA...
Incredible, fresh toro sashimi and rainbow roll but outrageous albacore tataki! Reasonable prices, fun time at sushi bar, highly recommend!!

Mr Hiro you got a review of the day with a little help from Michelle M of course.  I am no expert here. I have however known Mr Hiro for many years and right from the start loved how the chefs took extra care when making food and how I would feel in his small restaurant with all the style.  I remember my first visit with my friend, a sushi maniac so many years ago. I hardly understood the food at all. We ate crisp shrimp heads. I hardly believed this was food.  Anyway I have grown to love sushi and sitting at the bar. It's more than just a food, sushi is an art form enjoyed for its taste as well as presentation.   Hiro Sushi, better than a single slab of o-toro tuna.
Hiro sushi is an unbelievable hidden gem, family owned and operated, top notch sushi quality!

I'm impressed by the salmon nigiri. The salmon was plump, soft, and tasty. The soft fresh tofu was delightfully cool and light. Do add the ginger and onions a atop if the lightness is to bland for you. The crazy roll was decent and basic. No mayo or sauce or extra flavoring added. I didn't try their fancier rolls because it costs like $15.95 or $14.95...which i think is over the top for one roll...  I'd come here again but only if i was in the neighborhood...

This place is ridiculous! I placed a to go order and arrived when I was supposed to then waited for 15 mins in a small crowed waiting area just to pick up my order. They really need more help at the front during peak dinner hours. I will not be back

I was introduced to Hiro Sushi by a good friend. The food is always delicious and the service is impeccable - whether you choose to sit at a table, belly up to the sushi bar or bring your order home. Everyone has a terrific attitude and the food is always extremely fresh. In a word: outstanding!

I wish there were 10 stars available for this place.  I started coming here about 10 years ago with the office crowd and I had never tried sushi before.  Now I am a firm fan of this small neighborhood place.  I have now tried sushi in many different restaurants in different cities and countries, but they don't stack up against this place.  I love their spicy octopus, stuffy crunchy shrimp (a house special) and their tempura is light and tasty.  They also offer an out if this world eggplant miso which I would gladly drink pints of that sauce it is so good!  I am also a big fan of their Okinawa soup, a meal in the bowl with soba noodles, broth, slices of fish cake, shredded ginger and spring onion - a real treat.  They offer a chirashi dish which is served in a lacquered box and consists of a bed of rice with slices of fresh sashimi which is always good.  If I don't have that then we have fun with the maki / sashimi menu options ordering their excellent spicy tuna (they roll it in sesame seeds which really make it pop), tuna tempura sashimi (which comes with that wonderful miso sauce), their spicy ribbon roll is good and we love their scallop maki as well as their flying fish eggs, spicy salmon and yellow tail.     If you do want to eat here at night you should consider booking a table or waiting till a seat at the counter opens up.  If you don't mind the counter, sitting there is where you get to witness the wonderful knife skills of the friendly chefs, some of which are the sons on the owner Hiro.    I love this place, hope you do too, enjoy.........

3.5 stars rounded up to 4.  My boyfriend and I ordered the Uni, Toro, Spicy Ribbon Roll, Chirashi, and Udon noodles. We always get an order of Uni and Toro whenever we get sushi nowadays, so its become sort of our starting indicator as to how the restaurant ranks to others. I'm so sad to say that I was disappointed with both the Uni and Toro-- both cut into thin slices on their relatively large beds of rice. The Chirashi was slightly better although I must warn you that its not much fish. I loved the thick slices of tuna and salmon, but was personally not a fan of the other items (squid, octopus, fish eggs). Overall, solid quality but left thinking, "That's it?"  Both the Spicy Ribbon Roll and the Udon noodles were superb. I'm a huge fan of salmon and my boyfriend loves spicy tuna, so the Spicy Ribbon Roll was absolutely perfect for us. The Udon noodles' soup was flavorful and the exact type of bowl you'd crave on a cold, rainy day.

It's like the Meatloaf song, "4 outta 5 ain't bad"  I can't seem to give the 5th start to Phoenix Sushi places, it's like I am blocked by the God of Shashimi. Don't get me wrong this place is great they have a wide variety, friendly and quick staff, and it is really off the beaten path. It is pretty small and quaint, ( I actually had a debate with a person I went with here, can something be both small and quaint?) Either way, it's nice inside, you get a cozy sushi feeling. The Miso soup is great, and the shashimi is fresh, and cut into big pieces. The prices are OK,  the down side, no happy hour of any kind.  It is a small place, so I can see why they don't have a happy hour. I highly recommend this place to all sushi lovers, you won't be disappointed. It's very clean and inviting.  In the terms of atmosphere, I was tempted to get hammered off saki here, (though I only had 1 Sapporo)  it's that type of place that you want to do shots of Saki with the sushi chef's and pass out on a plate of ahi tuna, to awaken with a tattoo on your arm that says "Konichiwa Bitches" and has a picture of Morimoto the Iron Chef from Japan, it's that quaint ;).

Hiro is one of the best sushi restaurants in Arizona. I eat at Hiro at least once a week and have been doing so for over a year. Their fish is always fresh. One of my favorite things about Hiro is that their sushi speaks for it's self. There are not a lot of sweet sauces, mayo and fillers that poor quality restaurants use to mask their fish.  In addition to the food, the staff are great. Masa, Take, and Leo (just to name a few) are great chefs who are also very personable and funny. We enjoy sitting at the bar as talking with the chefs and watching them masterfully prepare food. You have got to give Hiro sushi a try.

This was by far the best sushi place in the Valley. We were very happy and satisfied with every single thing we ate. Sashimi slices were thick and good portion. Unlike other sushi place where nigiri sushi rice is huge and dry, Hiro Sushi had perfect texture and size. Uni, aji, mirugai and toro were amazing. They even had pickled ume flavored seaweed. My only problem is that place is not closer to Chandler.

Sushi was amazing good. It was more simple than what we have had but it had great flavor. Price was very reasonable and the quality of sushi was great. Just wish they had a bigger selection of drinks.
Amazing. Just became my new favorite sushi spot. Everything we had was so fresh and prepared amazingly. I had the rainbow roll and sushi dinner. I cant wait to go back and try more.

AWESOME, AWESOME Sushi! By far the best sushi in AZ. I've been traveling to Arizona for business for 3 years now and so glad I finally found this place. Everything about this place is great. Service is great and Sushi is extremely fresh. Defiantly give it a try if your on the search for good Sushi in the Scottsdale area.

Authentic Japanese Service is great: quick and friendly! I have been here a few times and the fish always tastes very fresh especially for being a sushi place in the valley.   I always enjoy getting a seat at the sushi bar so I can talk it up with the chef. for the adventurous: Ask the chef to make you their own specialty dish, my taste buds have never been disappointed!
Great sushi one of the best in Scottsdale. The place is small so get a reservation. If you are looking for a good authentic sushi place. This is the place to go.

Best sushi in AZ in terms of authenticity and quality.  I appreciate their focus on sashimi and nigiri instead of having a menu full of specialty rolls.  My wife and I always get some uni and Toro here.  Our kids love the chicken katsu and miso soup.
Great old school sushi bar feel. Very fresh, we lived the Houston role  Service was good and price was fair

Found Hiro Sushi from great reviews on yelp. Was able to be seated immediately for lunch on a Wednesday. Party of 4, staff was very friendly and cordial, ordered drinks, no liquor available- just beer and water wine, no big deal. Edamame to start, spicy tuna rolls, spicy salmon rolls, California roll with real crab ordered. Spicy Tuna Don and tempura shrimp roll. All was quite good, miso soup and salad tasty, quick turn for sushi and other dishes. Spicy Tuna roll was rough chopped pieces of tuna not macerated style (we prefer the rough chopped pieces). Quaint old school atmosphere, mild fish smell, but not over powering like some established facilities of similar age. Not for the person seeking the trendy approach. Highly recommend
The Jazz roll was delicious! This is great sushi and you don't have to pay for a fancy atmosphere!!
Hiro is my favorite sushi restaurant in the Phoenix area. The quality of the toro was very good. The salmon was buttery and quite tasty as well.

Most authentic Japanese food in Arizona. Service is 5/5 food is 5/5. Freshest fish, high quality ingredients. Great prices. I've spent quiet a bit of time in Japan and this is honestly the best Japanese food I've had since then. A+

Another Yelp-led awesomeness. When I searched for restaurants in Scottsdale and came upon Hiro Sushi, I was a bit skeptical. It definitely did not seem like it could be a 5-star restaurant, but I am wrong.  First of all, the ambiance of the place is a lot nicer than the pics that are shown here on Yelp. They have a very long sushi bar with chefs chatting it up with you, and then there is also lots of dining areas. Light jazzy music is played softly and the lights are dim.  I ordered the crazy roll ($9), with spicy salmon, tempura shrimp, avocado, cucumbers wrapped in a pink soy. Their spicy sauce is so good and their tempura is very crunchy and tasty.  I also had the Volcano ($10), which had clams, enoki mushrooms, regular mushrooms, mayonnaise, baked. The dish was super creamy and meant to be shared. I kinda regret eating it all by myself since it must be super fatty, yet i enjoyed every bite of it.  All this was accompanied by a large glass of plum wine for only $6.  Fantastic!
We live in the neighborhood and tried it out last night. It is so great! Delicious sushi, beautiful restaurant and great service. We sat at the sushi bar and had a fun time.
In from Denver and our first visit.  Great service at the sushi bar, tremendous quality in fish and and very tasty.

I wish I could give 50 stars! I went here for my 11th b-day. The food was great! We ate a ton! I had a spicy salmon roll, octopus nigiri, spicy scallop roll, sea urchin nigiri, Houston roll, eel nigiri. But the most amazing part was dessert. I ordered chocolate  mochi. When they came out the lights dimmed, and then they were singing. They must have heard me talk about my brithday because they sang happy birthday to me! I was so touched by the generosity. Plus the mochi was amazing. I would go back anytime! No fake wasabi or anything. They even speak Japanese unlike many places which feel very phony.  Domo arigato Hiro Sushi!

This is what willis was talking about!  I tried to find decent sushi in the Scottsdale area and i failed again and again until I hit up Hiro last night.   Great place! Good Sake selection, delicious hamachi kama and the freshest sashimi that i've found in the area. You are getting what you are paying for here.  We tried almost all the sashimi available here including the toro and ankimo and everything was pretty good. For some reason, the american sushi chef guy put the hirame to swim in ponzu sauce which upset me a little. but i will let this slide. Will probably have to pass on the toro next time too.  Try the hamachi kama if they have it available!  My coworkers and I will be back here soon. very soon.

We have been going to this wonderful Japanese Resaurant for years.  The food, all of it, is great and the sushi is always fresh and delicious.  The employees greet you when you arrive and thank you when you leave.   They have a lunch menu that runs from $7.50 to $10.99 and it is all great and there is plenty to fill you.    If you enjoy Sushi and Japanese food this is the place to go and the price is very good.
Busy always = Fresh fish!  Some not so usual varieties so there are things to try.  These guys work hard and it shows.  We spent two weeks in AZ and ate here twice in one week.

Hands down--best sushi I've had in Arizona. The tuna sashimi tempura was amazing. The flavors and textures were simply amazing. Top 5 sushi rolls ever.  The sashimi tasted like the sea and was very tender. We had the toro = also amazing.   Sit at the bar for quick service with the occasional joke from the chef.

This is by far my favorite sushi place in the area. I just moved here a couple months ago and have been dying to find quality sushi. Hiro Sushi is a small hidden gem that's just off 101 & 90th Street. Although the restaurant is a little small, there's always free/open seating at the sushi bar. That's where I usually sit anyway. The sushi chefs are knowledgable and very passionate.   The salmon sashimi was really fresh and generously cut. I also ordered the monk fish pate - served steamed with miso or ponzu sauce. If you're feeling adventurous, just ask the chef to surprise you with a roll! I was surprised with the tuna tempura sashimi roll and it was fabulous! Not really a fan of tempura rolls but it was very light!   Will definitely be back!!
The food is great and the service is excellent. The chefs and staffs are very friendly. I'm glad I found this place. Thanks Yelp!!!

After a long afternoon lying by the pool, hungry, looking for happy hour deals, we found Hiro Sushi in N. Scottsdale.  No happy hour here, but they offer high quality Japanese food at an affordable price. My favorite was the tempura dish. It was perfectly fried and so crispy.  You can taste that they used clean oil to fry, not like other restaurants.  The sushi rolls were very fresh and well prepared. This is my new favorite Japanese restaurant in N. Scottsdale.

So glad we tried this place! Hiro Sushi is the best place we've tried so far.  The pair to sapporo and nearest sushi, this is by far hands down much better! Their prices are better.  They have a larger selection of sushi. This issue was so fresh!  They  truly are an authentic sushi place. You know this when the chefs are Japanese!!  :)   The service was excellent! It took awhile to get our order but it was because it was packed!  So be patient.   Yelp doesn't allow you to give half points. Otherwise I would give a 4.5 rating only because it's nearly impossible to get through to them on the phone. I tried calling 7 times for 10 minutes and just kept getting a busy signal.

You're transported to that little restaurant around the corner from the train station in Doko-demo, Japan - the Japanese version of Cheers - where everyone knows you like sushi and eating the simple, good things. We loved the crab sunumono, agedashi tofu, calamari, fried smelts and gyozo to start, and then fresh sushi - in the desert - was wonderful - especially the uni. I had heard about this place for 2 years and finally went - and it became of our best new discoveries in the past year. Hiro Sushi is not fancy, but it's good. Highly recommended.

Some of the best Sushi and service I've had in a long time.  Sushi Chefs were quick and prompt with making the rolls and very lively and fun to watch.  Never had to wait for a thing, wait staff was discreetly working in the background, don't think my water glass ever got below 1/2 before it was filled back up.  Will be back, exceptional!

For me personally, Hiro's is in that rare category of restaurants that is so good that (out of pure selfishness) I almost don't want to leave a review or tell people about it because I want it all to myself. However, after nearly a decade of patronage, anytime I'm asked about my favorite restaurant, where good sushi is, or where to find good fish in general... There is only one answer Hiro's Sushi. If the fact that even though they open for dinner at 5:00pm, My dad and I get there at 4:30 (so we can sit in front of Hiro at the sushi bar) and still have people already in line. Any regular will tell you that on Friday and Saturday nights they open at 5:00 and by 5:05 they're on a 45 minute to and hour wait. What more do you need to see? If that isn't proof you're in the right place for an incredible meal I don't know what is. What's nice about Hiro's (aside from the level of high quality ingredients, skill in preparation and sincere hospitality) is that whether you're getting your first California roll or your idea of desert is Uni or Quail egg and roe you will be taken care of. All you need to do is let them know what you like what you don't like and they will suggest a few things to lead you in the right direction. However, if you'd rather have the full experience and you don't mind spending a pretty penny... The best way to enjoy an evening at Hiro's is to sit at the far end of the sushi bar in front of Hiro and say "Chef I'm in your hands tonight, if you would choose what I have I would be extremely grateful." It's truly the best way to experience this restaurant.

Great little restaurant. Every time I call they are often booked up. Turns out it's a pretty small restaurant. Sushi was tasty, and fresh. Service was wonderful, very attentive. Salads were all delicious.  This might be my new go-to sushi place.

I don't know if it's fair to review a fish place that's located in the middle of the desert.  Especially when my main gripe is that the fish was not fresh and tasted frozen and thawed. Is it fair? Maybe not. Still wasn't good. It was edible, but not "oh this is tasty." We also received two rolls that neither of us remembered ordering. I'm not saying that they were added to our bill on purpose, I'm just saying i hate salmon skin rolls and if somebody tells me that I ordered a salmon skin roll, that's suspicious to me.

Hiro sushi is hands down one of the best places in Arizona to get sashimi and sushi of high quality. Their fish is always fresh and cut well. They are the only sushi place I've ever been able to order jellyfish, which is excellent. Their toro is amazing. They also have less expensive sashimi lunch specials which are great quick options if you're not looking to spend more on a full sushi or sashimi meal. They also serve one of the best sunomono salads I've ever had. I also recommend trying the sauted mushrooms as well.   Atmosphere - Cozy and dim lit, the sushi bar dominates the space in the best way. Small tables fill the rest of the restaurant and a small waiting area as you walk in with a wall filled with celebrity photos. Their staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. This is my go to spot for sushi any time day or night. It is an environment that allows you to be a bit more casual which I like.

This past weekend I had one goal. That goal was to find the best sushi joint in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and thanks to a great suggestion of a co-worker I found it. Then I Yelped it and I drove about 20 minutes and had one of the best sushi meals of my life. I spent about 60$ and it was worth every single freak'n penny. The sushi chef, Masa, was one of the kindest and coolest people I've met. Also, according to Masa, all of the sushi they serve is 100% fresh. They don't use the vacuum packed and frozen fish ever. I fell in love.

Sushi was good. Udon was disappointing to say the least. My girlfriend got the chicken teriyaki and the chicken was dry and tasteless. Only reason for the second star was the atmosphere. Worst $50 I have ever spent.

Great,  but pricy,  place for sushi.  Kitchen  dishes leave a lot to be desired.   Sushi quality and quantity is very good here and I believe has always been. I have been dining here for over 10 years. Unfortunately, one of my favorite dishes (oyakodon)  is just not good anymore. I won't be ordering again.  The chicken  is totally overcooked and rubbery, inedible. It's very obvious that the chicken is precooked then added to the dish while cooking. That is NOT how oyakodon is supposed to be cooked.  How do I know, you ask?  I worked in a real Japanese restaurant and I know how the dish is properly prepared. I have also been to Japan numerous times. Un acceptable rubber chicken makes the dish not enjoyable.  Meat is to be cooked in the broth.

They might have good sushis to get this many good reviews, but my goodness, just came out of this place and I feel I am going to have to throw up the food I just ate to get rid of the salt intake! I order a $13 udon soup. It is so so salty that it hurts my lips. I was hungry and didn't want to waste my money so I tried to eat as much I could stand. Now, I regretted it. Hopefully, my blood pressure doesn't go up too much and I won't have sore throat tomorrow. The first time and the LAST time!!

Saturday was a busy, busy day!  There were so many moving parts to my day:  * I rode my mountain bike to Tempe to see the Tour de Fat:)  * I had to play Squash at the club:)  * I had football on the TiVo that really needed my attention:)  * Oh yeah, Carin had a pretty big photo shoot that she was managing, and she asked me to help her with "model wrangling" for a little while...(she didn't call it that...she's far more refined than I am...she asked me to help sign people in and make sure they got where they needed to be...but I call it "model wrangling":-)  Where do I get the energy? :)  After a busy day, it was time for a dinner party with the photographer, the owners of the business, and selected guests from the shoot...interesting people and a wonderful mix for great conversation...which makes for a great dinner party:)  Hiro Sushi had been selected for the party and they did not disappoint:)  Hiro San has been a sushi master since 1968 and knows his way around a sushi bar (as do all of his assistant chefs:)  Hiro likes his boats, and all the sushi, sashimi and rolls were delivered to the table in traditional sushi boats...that's presenting your fish old school...and I approve (I have too...I went to an old school...back in olden days:)  Fresh tasting and delicious, the food came in waves ebi, maguro, iki, ikura, uni and anago, along with Arizona Roll (vegetarian...not my favorite), Caterpillar Roll and Spider Roll while we all enjoyed Kirin and hot and cold sake:-)  Hiro doesn't really have a party room, but they created a nice little spot for us all and we all laughed and talked and drank and ate and it was just a wonderful night.  We've been to Hiro before and the food and service are always top notch:)  The ambience in the restaurant is a little bit pedestrian...it kind of feels to me like a strip mall sushi bar (which it is, although the food is an order of magnitude better than most strip mall sushi:)  And creativity isn't really Hiro's strong suit...good and fresh sushi always, but not always presented as art.  Does that make a difference?...I don't know for sure...it can be an important part of the equation for me:)  That said, I like Hiro's...a lot:)  A lot better than I like model wrangling...it's really not my cup of dirty chai latte....it was like herding cats...pretty, pretty cats:)

Really good quality sushi!  It's busy on Friday nights, but they take reservations.  Great tamago.  Their hamachi sashimi was incredible!  Some of the best I've ever eaten.  Very good customer service.  The atmosphere is nice, not trendy.  It gets pretty loud when they are busy, but it's definitely a great place to get excellent sushi!

If you're looking for the diametric opposite of Sopporro or Pearl, come to the light side. Enter Hiro.    It's void of a club scene, the quality of the food is stellar, and while it's not cheap, it's justifiable. Their udon, sashimi, salads, and rolls are all delicious, fresh, and expertly prepared. This is the place where my friends from Japan go to eat when they want Japanese food... that's right, no cougars or scenesters. Mostly Asians (always a great sign at sushi place), couples, and families. Oh, and their green tea is fantastic, as is their sake selection.  Hiro really knows its stuff when it comes to Japanese food, especially when compared to the other options in Scottsdale. I'd give them 5 stars, but the prices and total lack of atmosphere renders me a standard fan, not quite a cult follower.

I'm so glad we decided to try Hiro Sushi! For the past few years I've been very disappointed in Phoenix-area sushi restaurants. Hiro isn't just good for the area; it compares well to restaurants in other cities, too.  Hiro is a small, quiet restaurant done up in dark, sophisticated colors. Even when the restaurant was full, the atmosphere was relaxing. There were a few families there, but it would still be a good place for a date.   I'm incredibly picky about the freshness of fish, most of all when I'm eating it raw, and I've passed this on to my family. If you feel the same way, you'll be happy to learn that none of us had any complaints in this area.  Hiro's portions are large, which is great if you love shashimi. In fact, my favorite item was the salmon sashimi. Hiro had some truly beautiful salmon last night, and it tasted even better than it looked! The tuna sashimi was also served generously and it was very good.   The nigiri items we ordered were ikura (salmon eggs), ika (squid), suzuki (bass) and unagi (eel.) The suzuki is usually prepared with ponzu (a cirtus vinegar) but you can get it without. Unagi is usually barbequed, but they offered it to my husband in two different ways. I can't remember what the other way was, but he ordered the barbequed, and he and my daughter said it was delicious. (I could taste that one because it wasn't gluten-free; same with the ikura, which my daughter, the ikura fan, said were good.) I'm the squid fan, and since you see I've given Hiro five stars, you know I enjoyed their squid!  I'd like to make special note about the edamame. At most restaurants this popular appetizer is treated with the same care as the free chips you get at a cheap Mexican joint. There's a lot of overcooked edamame in this town! At Hiro, ALL of the edamame in our three large bowls were bright and crispy. You didn't see salt on the outside of the pods, but they must have seasoned them in some way, because the peas inside were mildly salty and seemed to have some other flavors, too.   Hiro takes reservations, and on the weekends you should make one. We went early on a Saturday (6pm) and wanted to sit at the sushi bar, so we were okay, but all the tables were already reserved, and within a half hour of our arrival all the tables were filled, and the sushi bar, too.  We'll definitely be back!  UPDATE JULY 2015: We HAVE been back to Hiro Sushi, and it's always been great.

Came to this place based off recommendations from coworkers and creeping on a local (Phoenix) friends yelp page. I was lookin' for sushi! But in the Wild West? Doubtful I'll find any worth writing about...   WRONG!   Walked in and it's packed! Good sign, as there's another all you can eat sushi place within walking distance. So obviously this place is worth it. But what's this? A minimum of 40 minute wait? Dude, I'm hungry and again, expectations are low. Fresh fish prepared properly in the middle of the desert? Yea right.... again: WRONG!  Sit down at the bar, and a delightful woman attends to me.... speaks Japanese, is Japanese. But what's this? Get to talking and come to find out, she's from Okinawa!!! Itoman to be exact. Those of y'all that know me know I lived in Okinawa for 6 yrs. And I'm very familiar with her hometown. Then she turns to the gentlemen that is referred to as ??, the main and obviously head sushi chef, and tells him hey this guys from Okinawa! Well go figure, he's her husband, and guess where she's from? Yea. So not only does this Japanese restaurant have actual Japanese people preparing the dishes, but they are fellow islanders, what a cool surprise. And I'm not being prejudice or anything, but don't you get excited when you walk into an Italian joint and find that it's actually owned and operated (and the cooks) by actual Italians?!? Yea, well I like sushi places to have sushi chefs that are actually from Japan! Anyways...   The menu is full of everything from rolls to nigiri and sashimi! But there's hidden gems there, mainly, OKINAWA SOBA! Yuuuup! I ordered it, and it's REAL! Just like Hamaya Soba in sunabe! Go figure, with actual Okinawans working the joint. And, for those of you that drink (I do NOT and did not) they have Orion! Yup, the only Japanese beer exclusively made and owned and operated on the tiny island of Okinawa. What a rare find that was.   The lady and the man talked the entire night and you could tell they were thrilled to have someone come in that knows there homeland. They were both so friendly and so delightful. Very much like the people of itoman, the area they are from.   The sushi was AMAZING! I ordered 4 pieces of nigiri and 2 rolls along with my soba. Before I was done I had to order another 6 pieces of nigiri. It was that good. But be warned, if you come to eat like I did, bring your wallet. Now I'm not saying it's overly expensive, in fact I found it relatively fair priced. But as you already know, good sushi, real sushi, isn't a fast food cheap meal. Please understand that. Your paying for quality, freshness, presentation and all that, and that's what you'll get here, along with good conversation.   If you're with a group, grab the tables. But if you're in a party of 3 or less, sit at the bar and talk and interact with the expert gentlemen that are preparing your dishes right in front of you.   This place is a for real 5 star joint. I will absolutely go back anytime I'm in the Phoenix area. And if you are in the Phoenix area, make a reservation and go check this place out. You will not be disappointed.   Dat sushi mayne!

An overall mediocre experience this evening. The place is pretty small and gets busy quickly. We got there just in time and got a table! The host was very nice and got the table set up for a family of four. The waitress wasn't happy to see kids at the table. She was noticeably discontent with the four of us. We rushed through dinner to give her table back for the next guests. The food was fair, but nothing special. It left us wondering why the place was as highly rated as it is, but everyone has "off nights". This might have been one of them.

This is the BEST sushi  I have in US!  I happened to travel to this town and would never expect I can have sushi so authentic! If you are local, you probably know this place already.  If you are just like me traveling , this is definitely the place if you feel like some sushi.

Thank goodness for Yelp! This was such a great find. I had a looooong day at work, missed lunch, and was starving on my way back to my hotel. Stopped in to place an order to go. The hostess was UBBER friendly! I mean, I wasn't even at a table so didn't need waiter service, but they were so nice! Offered my water while I waited and overall just really nice staff.  Now onto the food: I was a little disappointed in the sushi/roll options. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that I did order to-go and maybe they had more options at the sushi bar that I wasn't privy to, but from the menus, there was much. I settled on my go-to safe choice rainbow roll, seaweed salad, and salmon dinner. Told you I was hungry! The roll was great, but hey, it's a simple standard roll. My fav was the salmon. It was a nice piece of fish, almost like they skinned it right off of Nemo! Even had the skin on it, which I actually like. Came with salad, rice, and miso soup, which I thought smelled a little funny in the car ride, but it was VERY tasty!   I did think the food was slightly pricey, but hey, most sushi places are. I will certainly be back to Hiro and this time dine-in. Thanks Yelp!
Wonderful Assortment of Sushi and Sashimi.  Very disappointed in Oyster Shooters, though.  We will be back.

I've been here several times because it's near my office, and honestly I don't get the hype. It's very expensive for what you get and the quality is about 7/10 on everything I've had. The interior is also very squishy, dark, and unappealing. There's often a wait because of the limited seating and service can be dodgy with not enough servers on the floor. I'm not scrambling to go back anytime soon, I'd rather take a bit of a drive and go to Kodo.

Hiro Sushi is located in a strip mall -- between a nail salon and bakery.  When you enter, you will note some decorative items. The ambience is comfortable and laid back. Lighting is on the darker side, but not too dark.  To begin, I recommend Ama Ebi with Heads (and yes, the entire thing is eatable). As an entre, I recommend the Beef Teriyaki. All dinner items include miso soup, steamed rice, and salad.  Sashimi/Sushi items range from about $6 to $14. Entres range from about $16 to $26.  I must add that the portions are somewhat small for its price -- particuarly the Ama Ebi (they are very small at this restaurant). Also, the same can be said for the main items on the dinner items (ex. small amounts of beef teriyaki, chicken, etc.); and they seem to get smaller with each subsequent visit (just an observation).  Nonetheless, Hiro Sushi is certainly above average.

I have been coming here for a few years now, and let me say, the sushi here is some of the best in the valley.  As the captain server of one of the most popular sushi restaurants in old town, it's easy for me to see that the quality here does not lack in any category.    The service is impeccable and the smiling faces behind the sushi bar make for an amazing dining experience.  This is a "hope in the wall" type place that is an absolute diamond in the rough, great work guys, keep it up! Masa-san sure knows his stuff!

I love the Lunch and Sushi Specials.  It is a small, cozy place with lots of regular customers.  The Bento Box choices are excellent and the food plentiful!  They certainly don't skip on rice either-perfect for this carb lover.  Sushi appears to be fresh off the boat!
1st time here. Kyoto is our go to place but they are renovating right now. Hiro is as good as all the reviews say

The place force me to define what sushi really is! Until Hiro Sushi, my palet, my expectations, my knowledge, and my  experiences were something completely different than what I tasted at Hiro. What I knew, well, I don't think I could go back to that taste again. What I know now;  is one of the most special cuisine in the World that I just met. Exelent! Satisfying! Colorful!
It was good. But, the nori was chewier than I'm used to. The rolls were a little loose for my liking. But the taste was great and the price was decent.

Oh how I wish I lived in Phoenix, so I could become a regular here. For those of you who are also on the quest to find authentic Japanese restaurants in the US, go to Hiro's if you find yourself in the area.  From the initial, "Irrashai!" As we walked in, the experience was like being in a little sushi joint in Japan.  My companion noted several times how great the service was and I have to agree.  I was excited to see Okinawa Soba on the menu so gave that a shot along with Otoro, salmon, Hamachi and Kani.   Ok, so the Toro did not need to be chewed it merely melted...heaven.  The last time I had Okinawa Soba was in Japan and this was the real deal even to include the hot pepper infused Awamori (ok, it was actually Vodka, but tasted the same). Our waitress had just moved here from Okinawa three years ago.   We had a Japanese rice beer... An import that was very good.   Sooo, this was overall an excellent experience and I'm glad we found it

Perhaps I had low expectations for sushi in AZ, but I have to admit that they can hold their own to some of the sushi places back home.  First the negatives, or actually just negative, since I can think of only one thing - the place is tiny, so the wait could be quite long if it's a busy night (we went on Thurs, and waited about 15 mins for a party of 3).  I ordered some of the sushi: blue fin tuna, unagi, yellowtail, and scallop - they were all fresh and yummy!  In addition, we had the agedashi tofu, and the shishito peppers - both were done perfectly!  In addition to the sushi and appetizers, I ordered a combo chicken teriyaki and pork ginger...yes, I was hungry - both entrees were delicious too!  So needless to say, whenever I'm back in the area, I will definitely make an effort to return to Hiro Sushi!

Hiro is the real deal - a down to earth Japanese-run sushi place with delicious fresh fish. It was around 7pm on a weekday when I walked in. The dining room was pretty busy but they had a few seats at the sushi counter. I stuck to a side of miso eggplant and some nigiri. The fish was fresh and super flavorful; the rice was perfectly vinegared too. I also had a negitoro hand roll to end the meal, which was handed to me directly by the sushi chef, as you'd expect. You won't find fancy over the top rolls and service here, but you will find authentic, high quality nigiri and sashimi.

Hiro Sushi is a traditional sushi bar/restaurant in Scottsdale.  It's a popular place where you can get a true Japanese experience.  My Overall Rating - 3 Stars (Atmosphere, Service, Food, Return)  Atmosphere - You'll find a long, traditional sushi bar along with several tables & chairs.  Now, it's not a large restaurant, so you can expect it to be full of patrons.  It can be a bit cramped in certain areas.  You're best off in a party of 4 or at the sushi bar when it's crowded.   1/2 Star.  Service - I like sushi restaurants where the server speaks Japanese.  It always makes me feel like getting authentic sushi.  Hiro Sushi passes this test.  Service was a bit slower when it got busy, but we were able to get all our orders in, order more, etc.  Great stuff here.  1 Star.  Food - We ordered the Chirashi special, which provided us with a large assortment of sashimi.  Honestly, from the ratings we thought we would be blown away, but it was good.  Also ordered some Udon noodles which provided a nice broth.  We continued with several other rolls - again solid but nothing memorable.  The entire meal is good not great, which isn't a bad thing.  1 Star.  Will I Return? - Only if I'm craving sushi in Scottsdale.  We made it here due to the high ratings, but honestly I didn't find anything so outstanding that I haven't had at many other Sushi restaurants.  There's no doubt Hiro has a loyal following, but I would only come back if sushi was the only type of cuisine I was craving.   1/2 Star.  My Yelp Rating Scale (Sum of all parts): 1 Star - Atmosphere - Is it a cool dive?  Perhaps an upscale place?  No matter the type, atmosphere plays a big part and I'll give a star if I like it or thinks it has great charm. 1 Star - Service - You can have a great meal with bad service.  But that's also what can make a five star joint drop to four.  It's important to the dining experience that service is great and on point. 2 Stars - Food - I'll award up to two stars for the food, since this is the main reason we dine out.  Sometimes the extra star is given for value, but it's really all about the food. 1 Star - Will I come back? - If I know for a fact I'll return, I'll give this a star. A place has to make an impression for me to return.   Each Category can be given up to 1 star except food (2 stars) because I consider all these categories important to the overall dining experience.  I will sum them up to provide my final Yelp score.

Hands down, best sushi in Phoenix. Seriously - the best. If you're looking for an amazing experience with a mom and pop feel, this is the place. They always have amazing specials and are super friendly.

Love this place, the best fresh sushi in Arizona!   Since I found out about this place a few months ago I was hooked!  My hubby, daughter and I we go there 2-3x a week. We like to sit at the bar and watch them make the sushi.  Love everything I have ordered sofar so good.
Fantastic!   Love the authentic nature in the middle of nowhere AZ. Very fresh and large piece sushi. Very very good!
Best sushi I've ever had! The sushi is always delicious and the staff is extremely friendly. It's a smaller location - but well worth any sort of wait! I love Hiro sushi... A must try in Scottsdale!

Outstanding sushi in the North Scottsdale Area. Started out with grilled miso eggplant that melted in your mouth with some edamame.  The spicy ribbon role and crazy roll were very flavorful but not overwhelming. Delicious  all around!
Great place for a first date. Got sat immediately at the bar at 6pm on a Tuesday. Friendly service, served quickly. They also found my lost wallet and held onto it for me until I could come back.

It's been a while since I've been back, but today I had my usual lunch order. I got the bomb pieces of maguro sashimi...like straight from the dock fresh and choice pieces. When this place is on, they have the freshest and choicest pieces of fish in town. Hoping the next visit is the same...

We have lived in Phoenix for 6 months now. Having been previously spoiled by living near the amazing Asian food scene on Convoy St in San Diego, we are happy to say, we finally found Japanese food that reminds us of home.  Hiro is simply delicious and won't cost you an arm and leg to enjoy.

I cannot say enough positive things about Hiro. This place has the freshest fish, the most authentic sushi-house vibe in town, and the nicest sushi chefs and servers in town. We arrived right at 5pm on a Saturday (without a reservation) and were quickly seated at the sushi bar. In other restaurants, this would have bothered me, but the chefs here are friendly and entertaining. The selection is wonderful, and I highly recommend whatever the fresh catch or special roll of the day is. I promise you, IT WILL BE GREAT. As mentioned, the service is exceptional. Our water glasses were never less than half full. Drink recommendations were more than helpful. And there was nothing we ordered that was not absolutely amazing. Hiro Sushi is a favorite for sure!

Tldr; -Very friendly staff -Authentic feel -Fish is fresh -Appropriately priced  Came towards the end of the lunch rush for my first visit. Took less than 3 minutes to get seated at the sushi bar. My order drink order was taken quickly and I received a pleasant greeting from the sushi chefs. My server was very bubbly, but didn't ask many questions or provide additional insight on the menu or lunch specials.  I deferred choosing by selecting the Chirashi bowl. The miso soup was very hot, had excellent broth flavor with fresh green onions and large pieces of tofu!  The chirashi bowl was a little under-welming at first glance, but each piece of fish was delicious, with the exception of what I presume was red snapper. It was a much chewier than I was expecting and the flavor wasn't at the same level as the other fish.   My salad showed up after my Chirashi bowl, and I hadn't expected to eat much of it, but the flavor of the dressing was really special. I ended up eating all of the salad and would gladly come back just for the the starters.  The total cost was just shy of $20, which I would gladly play again! Came hungry and curious and left fat and happy.  I will definitely be back to eat here again!

Good food, good ambiance, good prices.   I have been coming here for as long as I can remember.  The fish is always fresh, except for maybe a time or two in the dead of summer. But eating sushi in the summer in Az is always kinda iffy anyway!  It's usually pretty busy here, but the wait is never too long for a table. I love sitting at the sushi bar here, the chefs are friendly and entertaining.!

Hands down the freshest, best tasting sushi in Arizona!  Their "real crab" California roll is amazing.  Every time we go there we get the calamari appetizer which is just lightly breaded just enough to give the tentacles a little crunch but not overdone, and the drizzle of ponzu sauce is perfect!  Their d-back roll is LOADED with crab and shrimp and the Sedona roll, when ordered with the house made hot sauce is incredible.  Their service is prompt and attentive by a warm, welcoming family run staff, but get there early if you plan to eat a lot. A "Scottsdale bar scene" this is not....think more "small family run restaurant".  When closing time comes they mean it! It is amazing how that place clears out.  You'll enjoy every piece though!

This is my go to sushi place to find hard to find fish such as sweet shrimp, mirugai, toro, and aji. Its all fresh too! I recommend their chirashi also. The only problem is that this is such a small restaurant so if  you don't have a reservation, expect to wait an hour for a table. I usually go right when they open to beat the crowd.

Authentic! The sushi and sashimi here are excellent. I lived in Japan for two years, and the Bay Area for three years. Hiro sushi could operate in either aforementioned locale. The staff was friendly and everyone was able to converse in japanese with me. Give it a try!

BEST sushi in the valley.  Small quaint restaurant that's usually packed so make a reservation or be prepared to wait, esp on Fridays and weekends.   Their sashimi/ nigiri is always fresh and the chefs are very welcoming.  If you are looking for an authentic Japanese sushi place this is where you should go
Given all the great reviews, I was disappointed. Prices were high and the food was no better than most sushi bars. There was nothing wrong with it, it just was uninspired.

I have lived in Arizona since April 2013 and this is the best sushi I have had in the state so far. The spicy tuna roll was rolled to perfection with mouthwatering flavor. The YELLOWTAIL nigiri melts in your mouth and is by far the best yellowtail I have EVER had. We also tried the spicy octopus which was also perfectly flavored and not too spicy; the texture was spot on.   Walking up to the restaurant it looked a little "sketchy" but the moment you walk in the door the restaurant is booming with people and you are kindly greeted by the hostess and sushi chefs. The sushi chefs have a sense of humor, and I rarely sit at the sushi bar, but we did, and it was worth it! They are skilled, and constantly laughing and cheerful as they prepare your food.   I will be returning! I would suggest calling ahead. It is a small restaurant and I think the secret is out (at least on yelp) of how good this place its.

I've been here a couple times. Both times the service has been fantastic, they're really on top of that but I wasn't impressed with the fish. Maybe it was because both days I went were on Mondays. I've heard that Mondays and sometimes Sundays aren't the prime days to eat sushi due to when they get their shipments in. That's the only thing I can think of. Both times we had sushi that tasted well...fishy.  We ordered a few appetizers, the yellow tail cheek, baked mussels, and baked clams. The yellow tail cheek I've never had before so I have nothing to compare it to but it was a little crispy and burnt on the outside and I didn't much care for it. You had to dig through all the bones to get just a few little scraps of fish. The sauce they served with it was good though.  The spicy baked mussels and clams were in a mayo sauce that was okay but not fantastic. Normally my favorite part of these dishes is the sauce, but the mayo didn't seem thick enough and both came out soupy and lacking flavor. They were just mediocre.   We ordered the tuna tataki & albacore tataki. I thought the tuna tataki tasted very fishy and so did one of my dining partners. Our other dining partner thought it was okay though and ate our portions. The albacore tataki was seared quite a bit on the outside, giving it a rubbery texture that made it not taste right. I didn't care for either.   We ordered a lot- various nigiri, spicy scallop roll, spicy tuna roll, Houston roll (salmon, onion, cucumber), jazz roll, Arizona roll, rainbow roll, and I'm sure others. I thought the spicy scallop and Houston roll were the best but nothing was out-of-this-world. I just wasn't impressed either time we went there. 2.5 stars for the food, 5 stars for the service.

As you approach this building from the outside, you don't really expect alot, or at least I didn't. It's in a strip plaza (across the street from the Fry's on 90th), surrounded by shops catering toward spyware and vitamins. Odd, huh? In any case, you walk in and immediately notice how small the place is. Some may call it quaint - perhaps that's a nicer way of saying "i could walk the length of the restaurant if I took 50 giant steps."   Sushi bar is where to go. The chefs are polite and offer suggestions. Don't expect to be entertained, but do expect to receive your order in a timely fashion.   You get a clean towel here, too. And prompt beverage service. 3.50 for a Sapporo - you can't go wrong.   So, is there anything extraordinary about this place? Not really, but perhaps that's why it works. Without the loud music and flashy scene of Scottsdale, you instead find succulent sashima in generous portions, along with a menu that makes you "hmmm" and "uhmmm" a bit longer than usual.   Miso soup is medicore (i've had better) and the edamame is refreshing without a thunderstorm of salt - thankfully!  Jazz Roll. Crazy Roll. Shrimp Tempura Roll. How do you decide? When it doubt, just try it all. Or get the Caterpillar Roll - it's made different from other places. I can't quite put my finger on it, but there's something oddly wonderful about mixing textures - from the softness of the rice and avacado to the crunchyness of the inside. Oh, and eel is divine. So is the extra bonus of shrimp ontop.   I wouldn't consider this my fave place, and it's definitely not in my neighborhood... but if you live, work or just happen to be in the area, definitely stop into Hiro. You shouldn't leave disappointed, unless you're expecting something other than great food, friendly staff and, lo and behold, a restaurant where you actually hear Japanese spoken by the staff. Now that's worth a bonus star!
Best I have ever had !! Definitely a must try if you are in the are! All the sushi is fresh the sushi chefs are super friendly. Try the uni it's soooo good and Fresh!

This is the best sushi I've had for a very long time, impressed by the service. We got there with no reservation at opening time, there was already a line in front door, sat at sushi bar, but despite busy time they removed a chair for us to fit our baby's stroller between us. We will be regulars from now on.  Staff is super friendly, and helpful.

I really was so disappointed in this place. I was excited to eat here because of all the ratings. Maybe I'm spoiled in California but the sushi rolles here are bland and tasteless.  What a waste of my money. If this is one of the best in the area all I have to say is you have my condolences.

Hiro Sushi is the most authentic and best tasting Japanese food in the Phoenix Valley.  All the servers say thank you, yes, and your welcome in Japanese.  I have not been to Japan in more than 20 years, but the service reminds me from what I saw in Japanese restaurants in Tokyo as a child.  The sushi is extremely fresh like it came from the ocean too.  Hiro gets the best of the best in terms of quality.

Best sushi in town!  Brought tears to my eyes to find this place!  They do a great job with the basics and have a fine selection of off menu items on the board behind the sushi bar.  The Gyoza was tasty and delicious and made fresh there on the premises!  Ended the meal with some strawberry and chocolate mochi! Yum!  Friendly and warm staff.  There is just nothing to complain about here.  They nail it on all counts!

I am not one to hyperbolize but Hiro Sushi is the best sushi that I have been able to find in the valley. The food here is fresh, meticulously prepared, and delicious. I would typically point out favorite dishes and suggestions but I have loved everything that I have ever tried here. Subject to your tastes, you simply cannot go wrong. The prices are extremely fair, the sushi is prepared by people who actually know what they are doing, and you will enjoy your experience.  Make sure to have reservations when possible. It's tough to just walk in at 6:00 PM and expect to be seated right away.

When Japanese sports players come to town (especially baseball), they come here. And my Japanese friend used to come here whenever she missed her home. I am sure that this tells you a lot :)   Highly recommend!

This is the best sushi in the entire city of Scottsdale. The food is incredible, service is great but what I love most is seeing the sushi chefs create everything- they bring personality to their product and that is important. This is a small restaurant and there is very little room for pretentious people in the place, perfect.

Maybe it's better when you dine-in, but the take out sushi was horrible across the board.  It was chewy and appeared old.  I was somewhat surprised when I arrived 5 minutes after I ordered, and my sushi was already waiting for me.  But the way it tasted, it was probably prepared earlier and was sitting around.  My wife suggested calling to maybe get a voucher for a future visit, but then I'd have to eat more bad sushi.  No thanks!

Unquestionable 5 stars. Take away the 5 star service and there's 5 star food to back it up.  To this day I have not had such incredible Japanese food in Arizona, only comparable in LA the miso soup reminded me of my favorite (now closed) Japanese restaurant in LA. The sushi was to die for as was the teriyaki. This place is a winner.   I recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family.

Alaxandra-'Hey, who wants to join me for my birthday lunch'  Me- 'I'll go' That response was all it took and now I have 'my sushi spot'  It is a small restaurant with a lot to offer. Every time I walk in, I feel like I am stepping into a true Japanese restaurant. You get greeted by the 'sushi experts' ;) with a big welcome -spoken in Japanese- which I have yet to ask what exactly they are saying, but they sound happy and that's all that matters.  The freshest seafood, the best specials and the most fantastic miso soup, YUM! My goal is try almost everything on the menu and so far I am doing pretty good.

I was running out of time to spend in Phoenix but I just couldn't possibly pass the opportunity to try Hiro Sushi, especially after reading these amazing reviews from you fellow yelpers.  I called in and placed a take-out order as I was driving towards the restaurant.  You gotta do what you gotta do for food you can't get in your city.  ;)  While waiting for my food around 6pm on a Friday evening on their little bench by the entrance, groups after groups and couples after couples made their ways into the restaurant.  Most of them have reservations, which definitely suggested me to be sure to make a reservation for my future visit.  As much of Hiro as I saw, there were numerous pictures of famous people with the same Japanese man.  (Perhaps Hiro, the restaurant owner?)  The restaurant persuaded a cozy feeling.  The traditional noren by the entrance and the actual Japanese chefs earned bonus points in my book.  As the waiter handed me my food, and my check, I was sad I had to leave Hiro.  Without even trying their food, I knew I wanted to come back for the full experience, the whole SHEBANG!  I was tempted the whole entire drive to unpack that brown bag.  As soon as I got home, I was pleased to find how nice everything was packaged up.  Everything was there as if I was served in a restaurant; the thinly sliced ginger, wasabi, packaged soy sauce, sauce for my hiro roll, my foam container for my rolls was even decorated?.  I appreciated the fact that they were thoughtful enough to separate the sauce for my long drive.  If I remember it correctly, hiro roll is supposed to be served in their special sauce, which means my roll would be soaky when I get home.  Both rolls tasted delicious even though they were made an hour ago.  I only wished I ordered more food.  :P  I had no complaint as far as food concerns.  Hiro by far serves the best sushi I have had in Phoenix/Scottsdale area.  I did think the bill was a bit pricey but after tasted their food, it was no longer a concern.  I am giving Hiro a four-star rating because it didn't quite match the best I had in Asia.
Best sushi in the valley. Japanese owned and run. Very authentic! My husband likes to speak Japanese with them and remember his time in Japan... always an extra treat along with an amazing dinner.
Fantastic sushi and service! When you want the more traditional, quiet setting rather than the trendy "hip" sushi places, this is it. Very fresh all through. Definitely try the Albacore tataki!

Let me starts by saying this: This restaurant has the best sushi in town.   It was my friend's birthday and I wanted to take her some place special. My yelp friend, Karen, recommended this place to me. It's a bit of a drive from Chandler. But if it's good food, I'm willing to drive anywhere. I made a reservation for 2 at 5p.m. and was the first person who arrived. First hint that tells me they are legit was seeing a group of Japanese guys waiting for it to open when i arrived. Second hint - shortly after the door was opened, the restaurant was already packed.   We ordered Aghi tofu and spicy squid as our appetizers. The aghi tofu is definitely the best I've ever had. The "spicy squid" that we ordered was not spicy at all. Nevertheless, I still like it. It was seasoned well and very juicy. Just the right amount of portion for appetizers. For our main entree, we ordered a sashimi combo to share and replace two pieces of clams with two additional pieces of tuna and yellow tail ($1 for each item you switch out, what a deal). Every single piece is fresh, delicious, and literally melts in your mouth. I cannot be any happier to order that. We also ordered Eel sushi (2 pieces each order) and it was cooked exactly to our liking. I love the eel sauce that comes with it. Super delicious!!!!   I was a bit disappointed that the hostess did not tell our waitress that it was my friend's birthday. I reminded them upon reservation as well a reminding the hostess when i arrived. When our waitress gave us the bill, I told her that it was my friend's birthday. She politely took the bill away and arrived with the tempura ice-cream. Even though she didn't bring back the "green tea" ice-cream that we specifically asked for, it was still delicious. They literally shut off all the lights at the restaurant and sing to my friend along with the guests. She was sooooo happy.  Overall, this has been a wonderful experience for my friends and I. You bet I'll come back here again. Thank you for the wonderful time!
Great restaurant!  Sushi was very fresh.  Staff was very nice.  Try the potstickers as an appetizer.  They're d

I didn't know what real sushi was until I first came to Hiro. It totally blew all the other "fancy" sushi places I'd been to out of the water. I used to never like straight raw fish, but the fish they use here is so fresh and tender it melts like butter in your mouth. Everything here is good, the chefs and employees are very accommodative, and the ambiance makes you feel like you're walking into a sushi place in Japan. I always look forward to the next time I can go back and experience it all over again!
Super high-quality sushi, the salmon was amazing! We were a little disappointed with the lack of choices and small menu. I would absolutely return and will suggest to other locals :)
